30 #ifndef NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
31 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
32 
33 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MAJOR 3
34 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_MINOR 5
35 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_VERSION_PATCH 0
36 
37 #include <algorithm> // all_of, find, for_each
38 #include <cassert> // assert
39 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or
40 #include <cstddef> // nullptr_t, ptrdiff_t, size_t
41 #include <functional> // hash, less
42 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
43 #include <iosfwd> // istream, ostream
44 #include <iterator> // random_access_iterator_tag
45 #include <numeric> // accumulate
46 #include <string> // string, stoi, to_string
47 #include <utility> // declval, forward, move, pair, swap

49 // #include <nlohmann/json_fwd.hpp>
50 #ifndef NLOHMANN_JSON_FWD_HPP
51 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_FWD_HPP
52 
53 #include <cstdint> // int64_t, uint64_t
54 #include <map> // map
55 #include <memory> // allocator
56 #include <string> // string
57 #include <vector> // vector
58 
59 /*!
60 @brief namespace for Niels Lohmann
61 @see https://github.com/nlohmann
62 @since version 1.0.0
63 */
64 namespace nlohmann
65 {
66 /*!
67 @brief default JSONSerializer template argument
68 
69 This serializer ignores the template arguments and uses ADL
70 ([argument-dependent lookup](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/adl))
71 for serialization.
72 */
73 template<typename T = void, typename SFINAE = void>
74 struct adl_serializer;
75 
76 template<template<typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType =
77  std::map,
78  template<typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
79  class StringType = std::string, class BooleanType = bool,
80  class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
81  class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
82  class NumberFloatType = double,
83  template<typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
84  template<typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer =
85  adl_serializer>
86 class basic_json;
87 
88 /*!
89 @brief JSON Pointer
90 
91 A JSON pointer defines a string syntax for identifying a specific value
92 within a JSON document. It can be used with functions `at` and
93 `operator[]`. Furthermore, JSON pointers are the base for JSON patches.
94 
95 @sa [RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)
96 
97 @since version 2.0.0
98 */
99 template<typename BasicJsonType>
100 class json_pointer;
101 
102 /*!
103 @brief default JSON class
104 
105 This type is the default specialization of the @ref basic_json class which
106 uses the standard template types.
107 
108 @since version 1.0.0
109 */
110 using json = basic_json<>;
111 } // namespace nlohmann
112 
113 #endif
114 
115 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
116 
117 
118 // This file contains all internal macro definitions
119 // You MUST include macro_unscope.hpp at the end of json.hpp to undef all of them
120 
121 // exclude unsupported compilers
122 #if !defined(JSON_SKIP_UNSUPPORTED_COMPILER_CHECK)
123  #if defined(__clang__)
124  #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
125  #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
126  #endif
127  #elif defined(__GNUC__) && !(defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER))
128  #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40800
129  #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
130  #endif
131  #endif
132 #endif
133 
134 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
135 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
136  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
137  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
138 #endif
139 
140 // disable documentation warnings on clang
141 #if defined(__clang__)
142  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
143  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
144 #endif
145 
146 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
147 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
148  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
149 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
150  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
151 #else
152  #define JSON_DEPRECATED
153 #endif
154 
155 // allow for portable nodiscard warnings
156 #if defined(__has_cpp_attribute)
157  #if __has_cpp_attribute(nodiscard)
158  #define JSON_NODISCARD [[nodiscard]]
159  #elif __has_cpp_attribute(gnu::warn_unused_result)
160  #define JSON_NODISCARD [[gnu::warn_unused_result]]
161  #else
162  #define JSON_NODISCARD
163  #endif
164 #else
165  #define JSON_NODISCARD
166 #endif
167 
168 // allow to disable exceptions
169 #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && !defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
170  #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
171  #define JSON_TRY try
172  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
173  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
174 #else
175  #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
176  #define JSON_TRY if(true)
177  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
178  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH(exception) if(false)
179 #endif
180 
181 // override exception macros
182 #if defined(JSON_THROW_USER)
183  #undef JSON_THROW
184  #define JSON_THROW JSON_THROW_USER
185 #endif
186 #if defined(JSON_TRY_USER)
187  #undef JSON_TRY
188  #define JSON_TRY JSON_TRY_USER
189 #endif
190 #if defined(JSON_CATCH_USER)
191  #undef JSON_CATCH
192  #define JSON_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
193  #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
194  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_CATCH_USER
195 #endif
196 #if defined(JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER)
197  #undef JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH
198  #define JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH JSON_INTERNAL_CATCH_USER
199 #endif
200 
201 // manual branch prediction
202 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
203  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
204  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
205 #else
206  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
207  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
208 #endif
209 
210 // C++ language standard detection
211 #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
212  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_17
213  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
214 #elif (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201402L) || (defined(_HAS_CXX14) && _HAS_CXX14 == 1)
215  #define JSON_HAS_CPP_14
216 #endif
217 
218 /*!
219 @brief macro to briefly define a mapping between an enum and JSON
220 @def NLOHMANN_JSON_SERIALIZE_ENUM
221 @since version 3.4.0
222 */
223 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_SERIALIZE_ENUM(ENUM_TYPE, ...) \
224  template<typename BasicJsonType> \
225  inline void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const ENUM_TYPE& e) \
226  { \
227  static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!"); \
228  static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__; \
229  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m), \
230  [e](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool \
231  { \
232  return ej_pair.first == e; \
233  }); \
234  j = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->second; \
235  } \
236  template<typename BasicJsonType> \
237  inline void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ENUM_TYPE& e) \
238  { \
239  static_assert(std::is_enum<ENUM_TYPE>::value, #ENUM_TYPE " must be an enum!"); \
240  static const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType> m[] = __VA_ARGS__; \
241  auto it = std::find_if(std::begin(m), std::end(m), \
242  [j](const std::pair<ENUM_TYPE, BasicJsonType>& ej_pair) -> bool \
243  { \
244  return ej_pair.second == j; \
245  }); \
246  e = ((it != std::end(m)) ? it : std::begin(m))->first; \
247  }
248 
249 // Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json. They
250 // may be removed in the future once the class is split.
251 
252 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION \
253  template<template<typename, typename, typename...> class ObjectType, \
254  template<typename, typename...> class ArrayType, \
255  class StringType, class BooleanType, class NumberIntegerType, \
256  class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType, \
257  template<typename> class AllocatorType, \
258  template<typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer>
259 
260 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL \
261  basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType, \
262  NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, \
263  AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>
264 
265 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
266 
267 
268 #include <ciso646> // not
269 #include <cstddef> // size_t
270 #include <type_traits> // conditional, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_constructible, is_integral, is_same, remove_cv, remove_reference, true_type
271 
272 namespace nlohmann
273 {
274 namespace detail
275 {
276 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
277 template<bool B, typename T = void>
278 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
279 
280 template<typename T>
281 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
282 
283 // implementation of C++14 index_sequence and affiliates
284 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/32223343
285 template<std::size_t... Ints>
286 struct index_sequence
287 {
288  using type = index_sequence;
289  using value_type = std::size_t;
290  static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept
291  {
292  return sizeof...(Ints);
293  }
294 };
295 
296 template<class Sequence1, class Sequence2>
297 struct merge_and_renumber;
298 
299 template<std::size_t... I1, std::size_t... I2>
300 struct merge_and_renumber<index_sequence<I1...>, index_sequence<I2...>>
301  : index_sequence < I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)... > {};
302 
303 template<std::size_t N>
304 struct make_index_sequence
305  : merge_and_renumber < typename make_index_sequence < N / 2 >::type,
306  typename make_index_sequence < N - N / 2 >::type > {};
307 
308 template<> struct make_index_sequence<0> : index_sequence<> {};
309 template<> struct make_index_sequence<1> : index_sequence<0> {};
310 
311 template<typename... Ts>
312 using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Ts)>;
313 
314 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
315 template<unsigned N> struct priority_tag : priority_tag < N - 1 > {};
316 template<> struct priority_tag<0> {};
317 
318 // taken from ranges-v3
319 template<typename T>
320 struct static_const
321 {
322  static constexpr T value{};
323 };
324 
325 template<typename T>
326 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
327 } // namespace detail
328 } // namespace nlohmann
329

333 #include <ciso646> // not
334 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
335 #include <type_traits> // false_type, is_constructible, is_integral, is_same, true_type

345 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/void_t.hpp>
346 
347 
348 namespace nlohmann
349 {
350 namespace detail
351 {
352 template <typename ...Ts> struct make_void
353 {
354  using type = void;
355 };
356 template <typename ...Ts> using void_t = typename make_void<Ts...>::type;
357 } // namespace detail
358 } // namespace nlohmann
359 
360 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
361 
362 
363 namespace nlohmann
364 {
365 namespace detail
366 {
367 template <typename It, typename = void>
368 struct iterator_types {};
369 
370 template <typename It>
371 struct iterator_types <
372  It,
373  void_t<typename It::difference_type, typename It::value_type, typename It::pointer,
374  typename It::reference, typename It::iterator_category >>
375 {
376  using difference_type = typename It::difference_type;
377  using value_type = typename It::value_type;
378  using pointer = typename It::pointer;
379  using reference = typename It::reference;
380  using iterator_category = typename It::iterator_category;
381 };
382 
383 // This is required as some compilers implement std::iterator_traits in a way that
384 // doesn't work with SFINAE. See https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/1341.
385 template <typename T, typename = void>
386 struct iterator_traits
387 {
388 };
389 
390 template <typename T>
391 struct iterator_traits < T, enable_if_t < !std::is_pointer<T>::value >>
392  : iterator_types<T>
393 {
394 };
395 
396 template <typename T>
397 struct iterator_traits<T*, enable_if_t<std::is_object<T>::value>>
398 {
399  using iterator_category = std::random_access_iterator_tag;
400  using value_type = T;
401  using difference_type = ptrdiff_t;
402  using pointer = T*;
403  using reference = T&;
404 };
405 }
406 }
407 
408 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
409 
410 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/detected.hpp>
411 
412 
413 #include <type_traits>
414 
415 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/void_t.hpp>
416 
417 
418 // http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/experimental/is_detected
419 namespace nlohmann
420 {
421 namespace detail
422 {
423 struct nonesuch
424 {
425  nonesuch() = delete;
426  ~nonesuch() = delete;
427  nonesuch(nonesuch const&) = delete;
428  void operator=(nonesuch const&) = delete;
429 };
430 
431 template <class Default,
432  class AlwaysVoid,
433  template <class...> class Op,
434  class... Args>
435 struct detector
436 {
437  using value_t = std::false_type;
438  using type = Default;
439 };
440 
441 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
442 struct detector<Default, void_t<Op<Args...>>, Op, Args...>
443 {
444  using value_t = std::true_type;
445  using type = Op<Args...>;
446 };
447 
448 template <template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
449 using is_detected = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::value_t;
450 
451 template <template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
452 using detected_t = typename detector<nonesuch, void, Op, Args...>::type;
453 
454 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
455 using detected_or = detector<Default, void, Op, Args...>;
456 
457 template <class Default, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
458 using detected_or_t = typename detected_or<Default, Op, Args...>::type;
459 
460 template <class Expected, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
461 using is_detected_exact = std::is_same<Expected, detected_t<Op, Args...>>;
462 
463 template <class To, template <class...> class Op, class... Args>
464 using is_detected_convertible =
465  std::is_convertible<detected_t<Op, Args...>, To>;
466 } // namespace detail
467 } // namespace nlohmann
468 
469 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
470 
471 
472 namespace nlohmann
473 {
474 /*!
475 @brief detail namespace with internal helper functions
476 
477 This namespace collects functions that should not be exposed,
478 implementations of some @ref basic_json methods, and meta-programming helpers.
479 
480 @since version 2.1.0
481 */
482 namespace detail
483 {
484 /////////////
485 // helpers //
486 /////////////
487 
488 // Note to maintainers:
489 //
490 // Every trait in this file expects a non CV-qualified type.
491 // The only exceptions are in the 'aliases for detected' section
492 // (i.e. those of the form: decltype(T::member_function(std::declval<T>())))
493 //
494 // In this case, T has to be properly CV-qualified to constraint the function arguments
495 // (e.g. to_json(BasicJsonType&, const T&))
496 
497 template<typename> struct is_basic_json : std::false_type {};
498 
499 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
500 struct is_basic_json<NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL> : std::true_type {};
501 
502 //////////////////////////
503 // aliases for detected //
504 //////////////////////////
505 
506 template <typename T>
507 using mapped_type_t = typename T::mapped_type;
508 
509 template <typename T>
510 using key_type_t = typename T::key_type;
511 
512 template <typename T>
513 using value_type_t = typename T::value_type;
514 
515 template <typename T>
516 using difference_type_t = typename T::difference_type;
517 
518 template <typename T>
519 using pointer_t = typename T::pointer;
520 
521 template <typename T>
522 using reference_t = typename T::reference;
523 
524 template <typename T>
525 using iterator_category_t = typename T::iterator_category;
526 
527 template <typename T>
528 using iterator_t = typename T::iterator;
529 
530 template <typename T, typename... Args>
531 using to_json_function = decltype(T::to_json(std::declval<Args>()...));
532 
533 template <typename T, typename... Args>
534 using from_json_function = decltype(T::from_json(std::declval<Args>()...));
535 
536 template <typename T, typename U>
537 using get_template_function = decltype(std::declval<T>().template get<U>());
538 
539 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
540 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
541 struct has_from_json : std::false_type {};
542 
543 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
544 struct has_from_json<BasicJsonType, T,
545  enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
546 {
547  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
548 
549  static constexpr bool value =
550  is_detected_exact<void, from_json_function, serializer,
551  const BasicJsonType&, T&>::value;
552 };
553 
554 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
555 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
556 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
557 struct has_non_default_from_json : std::false_type {};
558 
559 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
560 struct has_non_default_from_json<BasicJsonType, T, enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
561 {
562  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
563 
564  static constexpr bool value =
565  is_detected_exact<T, from_json_function, serializer,
566  const BasicJsonType&>::value;
567 };
568 
569 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
570 // Do not evaluate the trait when T is a basic_json type, to avoid template instantiation infinite recursion.
571 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename = void>
572 struct has_to_json : std::false_type {};
573 
574 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
575 struct has_to_json<BasicJsonType, T, enable_if_t<not is_basic_json<T>::value>>
576 {
577  using serializer = typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>;
578 
579  static constexpr bool value =
580  is_detected_exact<void, to_json_function, serializer, BasicJsonType&,
581  T>::value;
582 };
583 
584 
585 ///////////////////
586 // is_ functions //
587 ///////////////////
588 
589 template <typename T, typename = void>
590 struct is_iterator_traits : std::false_type {};
591 
592 template <typename T>
593 struct is_iterator_traits<iterator_traits<T>>
594 {
595  private:
596  using traits = iterator_traits<T>;
597 
598  public:
599  static constexpr auto value =
600  is_detected<value_type_t, traits>::value &&
601  is_detected<difference_type_t, traits>::value &&
602  is_detected<pointer_t, traits>::value &&
603  is_detected<iterator_category_t, traits>::value &&
604  is_detected<reference_t, traits>::value;
605 };
606 
607 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/37193089/4116453
608 
609 template <typename T, typename = void>
610 struct is_complete_type : std::false_type {};
611 
612 template <typename T>
613 struct is_complete_type<T, decltype(void(sizeof(T)))> : std::true_type {};
614 
615 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
616  typename = void>
617 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
618 
619 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType>
620 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl <
621  BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType,
622  enable_if_t<is_detected<mapped_type_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value and
623  is_detected<key_type_t, CompatibleObjectType>::value >>
624 {
625 
626  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
627 
628  // macOS's is_constructible does not play well with nonesuch...
629  static constexpr bool value =
630  std::is_constructible<typename object_t::key_type,
631  typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
632  std::is_constructible<typename object_t::mapped_type,
633  typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
634 };
635 
636 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType>
637 struct is_compatible_object_type
638  : is_compatible_object_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType> {};
639 
640 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType,
641  typename = void>
642 struct is_constructible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
643 
644 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType>
645 struct is_constructible_object_type_impl <
646  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleObjectType,
647  enable_if_t<is_detected<mapped_type_t, ConstructibleObjectType>::value and
648  is_detected<key_type_t, ConstructibleObjectType>::value >>
649 {
650  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
651 
652  static constexpr bool value =
653  (std::is_constructible<typename ConstructibleObjectType::key_type, typename object_t::key_type>::value and
654  std::is_same<typename object_t::mapped_type, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value) or
655  (has_from_json<BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value or
656  has_non_default_from_json<BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type >::value);
657 };
658 
659 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType>
660 struct is_constructible_object_type
661  : is_constructible_object_type_impl<BasicJsonType,
662  ConstructibleObjectType> {};
663 
664 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType,
665  typename = void>
666 struct is_compatible_string_type_impl : std::false_type {};
667 
668 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType>
669 struct is_compatible_string_type_impl <
670  BasicJsonType, CompatibleStringType,
671  enable_if_t<is_detected_exact<typename BasicJsonType::string_t::value_type,
672  value_type_t, CompatibleStringType>::value >>
673 {
674  static constexpr auto value =
675  std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleStringType>::value;
676 };
677 
678 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
679 struct is_compatible_string_type
680  : is_compatible_string_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType> {};
681 
682 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType,
683  typename = void>
684 struct is_constructible_string_type_impl : std::false_type {};
685 
686 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
687 struct is_constructible_string_type_impl <
688  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType,
689  enable_if_t<is_detected_exact<typename BasicJsonType::string_t::value_type,
690  value_type_t, ConstructibleStringType>::value >>
691 {
692  static constexpr auto value =
693  std::is_constructible<ConstructibleStringType,
694  typename BasicJsonType::string_t>::value;
695 };
696 
697 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType>
698 struct is_constructible_string_type
699  : is_constructible_string_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType> {};
700 
701 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType, typename = void>
702 struct is_compatible_array_type_impl : std::false_type {};
703 
704 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
705 struct is_compatible_array_type_impl <
706  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType,
707  enable_if_t<is_detected<value_type_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
708  is_detected<iterator_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
709 // This is needed because json_reverse_iterator has a ::iterator type...
710 // Therefore it is detected as a CompatibleArrayType.
711 // The real fix would be to have an Iterable concept.
712  not is_iterator_traits<
713  iterator_traits<CompatibleArrayType>>::value >>
714 {
715  static constexpr bool value =
716  std::is_constructible<BasicJsonType,
717  typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value;
718 };
719 
720 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
721 struct is_compatible_array_type
722  : is_compatible_array_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType> {};
723 
724 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType, typename = void>
725 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl : std::false_type {};
726 
727 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
728 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl <
729  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType,
730  enable_if_t<std::is_same<ConstructibleArrayType,
731  typename BasicJsonType::value_type>::value >>
732  : std::true_type {};
733 
734 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
735 struct is_constructible_array_type_impl <
736  BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType,
737  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<ConstructibleArrayType,
738  typename BasicJsonType::value_type>::value and
739  is_detected<value_type_t, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
740  is_detected<iterator_t, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
741  is_complete_type<
742  detected_t<value_type_t, ConstructibleArrayType>>::value >>
743 {
744  static constexpr bool value =
745  // This is needed because json_reverse_iterator has a ::iterator type,
746  // furthermore, std::back_insert_iterator (and other iterators) have a base class `iterator`...
747  // Therefore it is detected as a ConstructibleArrayType.
748  // The real fix would be to have an Iterable concept.
749  not is_iterator_traits <
750  iterator_traits<ConstructibleArrayType >>::value and
751 
752  (std::is_same<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type, typename BasicJsonType::array_t::value_type>::value or
753  has_from_json<BasicJsonType,
754  typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>::value or
755  has_non_default_from_json <
756  BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type >::value);
757 };
758 
759 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
760 struct is_constructible_array_type
761  : is_constructible_array_type_impl<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType> {};
762 
763 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
764  typename = void>
765 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
766 
767 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
768 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
769  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
770  enable_if_t<std::is_integral<RealIntegerType>::value and
771  std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
772  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value >>
773 {
774  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
775  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
776  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
777 
778  static constexpr auto value =
779  std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType,
780  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
781  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
782  RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
783 };
784 
785 template <typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
786 struct is_compatible_integer_type
787  : is_compatible_integer_type_impl<RealIntegerType,
788  CompatibleNumberIntegerType> {};
789 
790 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType, typename = void>
791 struct is_compatible_type_impl: std::false_type {};
792 
793 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType>
794 struct is_compatible_type_impl <
795  BasicJsonType, CompatibleType,
796  enable_if_t<is_complete_type<CompatibleType>::value >>
797 {
798  static constexpr bool value =
799  has_to_json<BasicJsonType, CompatibleType>::value;
800 };
801 
802 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleType>
803 struct is_compatible_type
804  : is_compatible_type_impl<BasicJsonType, CompatibleType> {};
805 } // namespace detail
806 } // namespace nlohmann
807 
808 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
809 
810 
811 #include <exception> // exception
812 #include <stdexcept> // runtime_error
813 #include <string> // to_string
814 
815 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/position_t.hpp>
816 
817 
818 #include <cstddef> // size_t
819 
820 namespace nlohmann
821 {
822 namespace detail
823 {
824 /// struct to capture the start position of the current token
825 struct position_t
826 {
827  /// the total number of characters read
828  std::size_t chars_read_total = 0;
829  /// the number of characters read in the current line
830  std::size_t chars_read_current_line = 0;
831  /// the number of lines read
832  std::size_t lines_read = 0;
833 
834  /// conversion to size_t to preserve SAX interface
835  constexpr operator size_t() const
836  {
837  return chars_read_total;
838  }
839 };
840 
841 }
842 }
843 
844 
845 namespace nlohmann
846 {
847 namespace detail
848 {
849 ////////////////
850 // exceptions //
851 ////////////////
852 
853 /*!
854 @brief general exception of the @ref basic_json class
855 
856 This class is an extension of `std::exception` objects with a member @a id for
857 exception ids. It is used as the base class for all exceptions thrown by the
858 @ref basic_json class. This class can hence be used as "wildcard" to catch
859 exceptions.
860 
861 Subclasses:
862 - @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
863 - @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
864 - @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
865  a wrong type
866 - @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
867 - @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
868 
869 @internal
870 @note To have nothrow-copy-constructible exceptions, we internally use
871  `std::runtime_error` which can cope with arbitrary-length error messages.
872  Intermediate strings are built with static functions and then passed to
873  the actual constructor.
874 @endinternal
875 
876 @liveexample{The following code shows how arbitrary library exceptions can be
877 caught.,exception}
878 
879 @since version 3.0.0
880 */
881 class exception : public std::exception
882 {
883  public:
884  /// returns the explanatory string
885  const char* what() const noexcept override
886  {
887  return m.what();
888  }
889 
890  /// the id of the exception
891  const int id;
892 
893  protected:
894  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg) : id(id_), m(what_arg) {}
895 
896  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id_)
897  {
898  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id_) + "] ";
899  }
900 
901  private:
902  /// an exception object as storage for error messages
903  std::runtime_error m;
904 };
905 
906 /*!
907 @brief exception indicating a parse error
908 
909 This exception is thrown by the library when a parse error occurs. Parse errors
910 can occur during the deserialization of JSON text, CBOR, MessagePack, as well
911 as when using JSON Patch.
912 
913 Member @a byte holds the byte index of the last read character in the input
914 file.
915 
916 Exceptions have ids 1xx.
917 
918 name / id | example message | description
919 ------------------------------ | --------------- | -------------------------
920 json.exception.parse_error.101 | parse error at 2: unexpected end of input; expected string literal | This error indicates a syntax error while deserializing a JSON text. The error message describes that an unexpected token (character) was encountered, and the member @a byte indicates the error position.
921 json.exception.parse_error.102 | parse error at 14: missing or wrong low surrogate | JSON uses the `\uxxxx` format to describe Unicode characters. Code points above above 0xFFFF are split into two `\uxxxx` entries ("surrogate pairs"). This error indicates that the surrogate pair is incomplete or contains an invalid code point.
922 json.exception.parse_error.103 | parse error: code points above 0x10FFFF are invalid | Unicode supports code points up to 0x10FFFF. Code points above 0x10FFFF are invalid.
923 json.exception.parse_error.104 | parse error: JSON patch must be an array of objects | [RFC 6902](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) requires a JSON Patch document to be a JSON document that represents an array of objects.
924 json.exception.parse_error.105 | parse error: operation must have string member 'op' | An operation of a JSON Patch document must contain exactly one "op" member, whose value indicates the operation to perform. Its value must be one of "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or "test"; other values are errors.
925 json.exception.parse_error.106 | parse error: array index '01' must not begin with '0' | An array index in a JSON Pointer ([RFC 6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901)) may be `0` or any number without a leading `0`.
926 json.exception.parse_error.107 | parse error: JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/' - was: 'foo' | A JSON Pointer must be a Unicode string containing a sequence of zero or more reference tokens, each prefixed by a `/` character.
927 json.exception.parse_error.108 | parse error: escape character '~' must be followed with '0' or '1' | In a JSON Pointer, only `~0` and `~1` are valid escape sequences.
928 json.exception.parse_error.109 | parse error: array index 'one' is not a number | A JSON Pointer array index must be a number.
929 json.exception.parse_error.110 | parse error at 1: cannot read 2 bytes from vector | When parsing CBOR or MessagePack, the byte vector ends before the complete value has been read.
930 json.exception.parse_error.112 | parse error at 1: error reading CBOR; last byte: 0xF8 | Not all types of CBOR or MessagePack are supported. This exception occurs if an unsupported byte was read.
931 json.exception.parse_error.113 | parse error at 2: expected a CBOR string; last byte: 0x98 | While parsing a map key, a value that is not a string has been read.
932 json.exception.parse_error.114 | parse error: Unsupported BSON record type 0x0F | The parsing of the corresponding BSON record type is not implemented (yet).
933 
934 @note For an input with n bytes, 1 is the index of the first character and n+1
935  is the index of the terminating null byte or the end of file. This also
936  holds true when reading a byte vector (CBOR or MessagePack).
937 
938 @liveexample{The following code shows how a `parse_error` exception can be
939 caught.,parse_error}
940 
941 @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
942 @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
943 @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
944  a wrong type
945 @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
946 @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
947 
948 @since version 3.0.0
949 */
950 class parse_error : public exception
951 {
952  public:
953  /*!
954  @brief create a parse error exception
955  @param[in] id_ the id of the exception
956  @param[in] position the position where the error occurred (or with
957  chars_read_total=0 if the position cannot be
958  determined)
959  @param[in] what_arg the explanatory string
960  @return parse_error object
961  */
962  static parse_error create(int id_, const position_t& pos, const std::string& what_arg)
963  {
964  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id_) + "parse error" +
965  position_string(pos) + ": " + what_arg;
966  return parse_error(id_, pos.chars_read_total, w.c_str());
967  }
968 
969  static parse_error create(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg)
970  {
971  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id_) + "parse error" +
972  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at byte " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
973  ": " + what_arg;
974  return parse_error(id_, byte_, w.c_str());
975  }
976 
977  /*!
978  @brief byte index of the parse error
979 
980  The byte index of the last read character in the input file.
981 
982  @note For an input with n bytes, 1 is the index of the first character and
983  n+1 is the index of the terminating null byte or the end of file.
984  This also holds true when reading a byte vector (CBOR or MessagePack).
985  */
986  const std::size_t byte;
987 
988  private:
989  parse_error(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
990  : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_) {}
991 
992  static std::string position_string(const position_t& pos)
993  {
994  return " at line " + std::to_string(pos.lines_read + 1) +
995  ", column " + std::to_string(pos.chars_read_current_line);
996  }
997 };
998 
999 /*!
1000 @brief exception indicating errors with iterators
1001 
1002 This exception is thrown if iterators passed to a library function do not match
1003 the expected semantics.
1004 
1005 Exceptions have ids 2xx.
1006 
1007 name / id | example message | description
1008 ----------------------------------- | --------------- | -------------------------
1009 json.exception.invalid_iterator.201 | iterators are not compatible | The iterators passed to constructor @ref basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last) are not compatible, meaning they do not belong to the same container. Therefore, the range (@a first, @a last) is invalid.
1010 json.exception.invalid_iterator.202 | iterator does not fit current value | In an erase or insert function, the passed iterator @a pos does not belong to the JSON value for which the function was called. It hence does not define a valid position for the deletion/insertion.
1011 json.exception.invalid_iterator.203 | iterators do not fit current value | Either iterator passed to function @ref erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last) does not belong to the JSON value from which values shall be erased. It hence does not define a valid range to delete values from.
1012 json.exception.invalid_iterator.204 | iterators out of range | When an iterator range for a primitive type (number, boolean, or string) is passed to a constructor or an erase function, this range has to be exactly (@ref begin(), @ref end()), because this is the only way the single stored value is expressed. All other ranges are invalid.
1013 json.exception.invalid_iterator.205 | iterator out of range | When an iterator for a primitive type (number, boolean, or string) is passed to an erase function, the iterator has to be the @ref begin() iterator, because it is the only way to address the stored value. All other iterators are invalid.
1014 json.exception.invalid_iterator.206 | cannot construct with iterators from null | The iterators passed to constructor @ref basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last) belong to a JSON null value and hence to not define a valid range.
1015 json.exception.invalid_iterator.207 | cannot use key() for non-object iterators | The key() member function can only be used on iterators belonging to a JSON object, because other types do not have a concept of a key.
1016 json.exception.invalid_iterator.208 | cannot use operator[] for object iterators | The operator[] to specify a concrete offset cannot be used on iterators belonging to a JSON object, because JSON objects are unordered.
1017 json.exception.invalid_iterator.209 | cannot use offsets with object iterators | The offset operators (+, -, +=, -=) cannot be used on iterators belonging to a JSON object, because JSON objects are unordered.
1018 json.exception.invalid_iterator.210 | iterators do not fit | The iterator range passed to the insert function are not compatible, meaning they do not belong to the same container. Therefore, the range (@a first, @a last) is invalid.
1019 json.exception.invalid_iterator.211 | passed iterators may not belong to container | The iterator range passed to the insert function must not be a subrange of the container to insert to.
1020 json.exception.invalid_iterator.212 | cannot compare iterators of different containers | When two iterators are compared, they must belong to the same container.
1021 json.exception.invalid_iterator.213 | cannot compare order of object iterators | The order of object iterators cannot be compared, because JSON objects are unordered.
1022 json.exception.invalid_iterator.214 | cannot get value | Cannot get value for iterator: Either the iterator belongs to a null value or it is an iterator to a primitive type (number, boolean, or string), but the iterator is different to @ref begin().
1023 
1024 @liveexample{The following code shows how an `invalid_iterator` exception can be
1025 caught.,invalid_iterator}
1026 
1027 @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
1028 @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
1029 @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
1030  a wrong type
1031 @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
1032 @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
1033 
1034 @since version 3.0.0
1035 */
1036 class invalid_iterator : public exception
1037 {
1038  public:
1039  static invalid_iterator create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1040  {
1041  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id_) + what_arg;
1042  return invalid_iterator(id_, w.c_str());
1043  }
1044 
1045  private:
1046  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
1047  : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1048 };
1049 
1050 /*!
1051 @brief exception indicating executing a member function with a wrong type
1052 
1053 This exception is thrown in case of a type error; that is, a library function is
1054 executed on a JSON value whose type does not match the expected semantics.
1055 
1056 Exceptions have ids 3xx.
1057 
1058 name / id | example message | description
1059 ----------------------------- | --------------- | -------------------------
1060 json.exception.type_error.301 | cannot create object from initializer list | To create an object from an initializer list, the initializer list must consist only of a list of pairs whose first element is a string. When this constraint is violated, an array is created instead.
1061 json.exception.type_error.302 | type must be object, but is array | During implicit or explicit value conversion, the JSON type must be compatible to the target type. For instance, a JSON string can only be converted into string types, but not into numbers or boolean types.
1062 json.exception.type_error.303 | incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is object | To retrieve a reference to a value stored in a @ref basic_json object with @ref get_ref, the type of the reference must match the value type. For instance, for a JSON array, the @a ReferenceType must be @ref array_t&.
1063 json.exception.type_error.304 | cannot use at() with string | The @ref at() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1064 json.exception.type_error.305 | cannot use operator[] with string | The @ref operator[] member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1065 json.exception.type_error.306 | cannot use value() with string | The @ref value() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1066 json.exception.type_error.307 | cannot use erase() with string | The @ref erase() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1067 json.exception.type_error.308 | cannot use push_back() with string | The @ref push_back() and @ref operator+= member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1068 json.exception.type_error.309 | cannot use insert() with | The @ref insert() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1069 json.exception.type_error.310 | cannot use swap() with number | The @ref swap() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1070 json.exception.type_error.311 | cannot use emplace_back() with string | The @ref emplace_back() member function can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1071 json.exception.type_error.312 | cannot use update() with string | The @ref update() member functions can only be executed for certain JSON types.
1072 json.exception.type_error.313 | invalid value to unflatten | The @ref unflatten function converts an object whose keys are JSON Pointers back into an arbitrary nested JSON value. The JSON Pointers must not overlap, because then the resulting value would not be well defined.
1073 json.exception.type_error.314 | only objects can be unflattened | The @ref unflatten function only works for an object whose keys are JSON Pointers.
1074 json.exception.type_error.315 | values in object must be primitive | The @ref unflatten function only works for an object whose keys are JSON Pointers and whose values are primitive.
1075 json.exception.type_error.316 | invalid UTF-8 byte at index 10: 0x7E | The @ref dump function only works with UTF-8 encoded strings; that is, if you assign a `std::string` to a JSON value, make sure it is UTF-8 encoded. |
1076 json.exception.type_error.317 | JSON value cannot be serialized to requested format | The dynamic type of the object cannot be represented in the requested serialization format (e.g. a raw `true` or `null` JSON object cannot be serialized to BSON) |
1077 
1078 @liveexample{The following code shows how a `type_error` exception can be
1079 caught.,type_error}
1080 
1081 @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
1082 @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
1083 @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
1084 @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
1085 @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
1086 
1087 @since version 3.0.0
1088 */
1089 class type_error : public exception
1090 {
1091  public:
1092  static type_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1093  {
1094  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id_) + what_arg;
1095  return type_error(id_, w.c_str());
1096  }
1097 
1098  private:
1099  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1100 };
1101 
1102 /*!
1103 @brief exception indicating access out of the defined range
1104 
1105 This exception is thrown in case a library function is called on an input
1106 parameter that exceeds the expected range, for instance in case of array
1107 indices or nonexisting object keys.
1108 
1109 Exceptions have ids 4xx.
1110 
1111 name / id | example message | description
1112 ------------------------------- | --------------- | -------------------------
1113 json.exception.out_of_range.401 | array index 3 is out of range | The provided array index @a i is larger than @a size-1.
1114 json.exception.out_of_range.402 | array index '-' (3) is out of range | The special array index `-` in a JSON Pointer never describes a valid element of the array, but the index past the end. That is, it can only be used to add elements at this position, but not to read it.
1115 json.exception.out_of_range.403 | key 'foo' not found | The provided key was not found in the JSON object.
1116 json.exception.out_of_range.404 | unresolved reference token 'foo' | A reference token in a JSON Pointer could not be resolved.
1117 json.exception.out_of_range.405 | JSON pointer has no parent | The JSON Patch operations 'remove' and 'add' can not be applied to the root element of the JSON value.
1118 json.exception.out_of_range.406 | number overflow parsing '10E1000' | A parsed number could not be stored as without changing it to NaN or INF.
1119 json.exception.out_of_range.407 | number overflow serializing '9223372036854775808' | UBJSON and BSON only support integer numbers up to 9223372036854775807. |
1120 json.exception.out_of_range.408 | excessive array size: 8658170730974374167 | The size (following `#`) of an UBJSON array or object exceeds the maximal capacity. |
1121 json.exception.out_of_range.409 | BSON key cannot contain code point U+0000 (at byte 2) | Key identifiers to be serialized to BSON cannot contain code point U+0000, since the key is stored as zero-terminated c-string |
1122 
1123 @liveexample{The following code shows how an `out_of_range` exception can be
1124 caught.,out_of_range}
1125 
1126 @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
1127 @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
1128 @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
1129 @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
1130  a wrong type
1131 @sa @ref other_error for exceptions indicating other library errors
1132 
1133 @since version 3.0.0
1134 */
1135 class out_of_range : public exception
1136 {
1137  public:
1138  static out_of_range create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1139  {
1140  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id_) + what_arg;
1141  return out_of_range(id_, w.c_str());
1142  }
1143 
1144  private:
1145  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1146 };
1147 
1148 /*!
1149 @brief exception indicating other library errors
1150 
1151 This exception is thrown in case of errors that cannot be classified with the
1152 other exception types.
1153 
1154 Exceptions have ids 5xx.
1155 
1156 name / id | example message | description
1157 ------------------------------ | --------------- | -------------------------
1158 json.exception.other_error.501 | unsuccessful: {"op":"test","path":"/baz", "value":"bar"} | A JSON Patch operation 'test' failed. The unsuccessful operation is also printed.
1159 
1160 @sa @ref exception for the base class of the library exceptions
1161 @sa @ref parse_error for exceptions indicating a parse error
1162 @sa @ref invalid_iterator for exceptions indicating errors with iterators
1163 @sa @ref type_error for exceptions indicating executing a member function with
1164  a wrong type
1165 @sa @ref out_of_range for exceptions indicating access out of the defined range
1166 
1167 @liveexample{The following code shows how an `other_error` exception can be
1168 caught.,other_error}
1169 
1170 @since version 3.0.0
1171 */
1172 class other_error : public exception
1173 {
1174  public:
1175  static other_error create(int id_, const std::string& what_arg)
1176  {
1177  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id_) + what_arg;
1178  return other_error(id_, w.c_str());
1179  }
1180 
1181  private:
1182  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
1183 };
1184 } // namespace detail
1185 } // namespace nlohmann
1186 
1187 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1188 
1189 
1190 #include <array> // array
1191 #include <ciso646> // and
1192 #include <cstddef> // size_t
1193 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
1194 
1195 namespace nlohmann
1196 {
1197 namespace detail
1198 {
1199 ///////////////////////////
1200 // JSON type enumeration //
1201 ///////////////////////////
1202 
1203 /*!
1204 @brief the JSON type enumeration
1205 
1206 This enumeration collects the different JSON types. It is internally used to
1207 distinguish the stored values, and the functions @ref basic_json::is_null(),
1208 @ref basic_json::is_object(), @ref basic_json::is_array(),
1209 @ref basic_json::is_string(), @ref basic_json::is_boolean(),
1210 @ref basic_json::is_number() (with @ref basic_json::is_number_integer(),
1211 @ref basic_json::is_number_unsigned(), and @ref basic_json::is_number_float()),
1212 @ref basic_json::is_discarded(), @ref basic_json::is_primitive(), and
1213 @ref basic_json::is_structured() rely on it.
1214 
1215 @note There are three enumeration entries (number_integer, number_unsigned, and
1216 number_float), because the library distinguishes these three types for numbers:
1217 @ref basic_json::number_unsigned_t is used for unsigned integers,
1218 @ref basic_json::number_integer_t is used for signed integers, and
1219 @ref basic_json::number_float_t is used for floating-point numbers or to
1220 approximate integers which do not fit in the limits of their respective type.
1221 
1222 @sa @ref basic_json::basic_json(const value_t value_type) -- create a JSON
1223 value with the default value for a given type
1224 
1225 @since version 1.0.0
1226 */
1227 enum class value_t : std::uint8_t
1228 {
1229  null, ///< null value
1230  object, ///< object (unordered set of name/value pairs)
1231  array, ///< array (ordered collection of values)
1232  string, ///< string value
1233  boolean, ///< boolean value
1234  number_integer, ///< number value (signed integer)
1235  number_unsigned, ///< number value (unsigned integer)
1236  number_float, ///< number value (floating-point)
1237  discarded ///< discarded by the the parser callback function
1238 };
1239 
1240 /*!
1241 @brief comparison operator for JSON types
1242 
1243 Returns an ordering that is similar to Python:
1244 - order: null < boolean < number < object < array < string
1245 - furthermore, each type is not smaller than itself
1246 - discarded values are not comparable
1247 
1248 @since version 1.0.0
1249 */
1250 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
1251 {
1252  static constexpr std::array<std::uint8_t, 8> order = {{
1253  0 /* null */, 3 /* object */, 4 /* array */, 5 /* string */,
1254  1 /* boolean */, 2 /* integer */, 2 /* unsigned */, 2 /* float */
1255  }
1256  };
1257 
1258  const auto l_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs);
1259  const auto r_index = static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs);
1260  return l_index < order.size() and r_index < order.size() and order[l_index] < order[r_index];
1261 }
1262 } // namespace detail
1263 } // namespace nlohmann
1264 
1265 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/from_json.hpp>
1266 
1267 
1268 #include <algorithm> // transform
1269 #include <array> // array
1270 #include <ciso646> // and, not
1271 #include <forward_list> // forward_list
1272 #include <iterator> // inserter, front_inserter, end
1273 #include <map> // map
1274 #include <string> // string
1275 #include <tuple> // tuple, make_tuple
1276 #include <type_traits> // is_arithmetic, is_same, is_enum, underlying_type, is_convertible
1277 #include <unordered_map> // unordered_map
1278 #include <utility> // pair, declval
1279 #include <valarray> // valarray
1280 
1281 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
1282 
1283 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
1284 
1285 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
1286 
1287 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
1288 
1289 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1290 
1291 
1292 namespace nlohmann
1293 {
1294 namespace detail
1295 {
1296 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1297 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename std::nullptr_t& n)
1298 {
1299  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_null()))
1300  {
1301  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be null, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1302  }
1303  n = nullptr;
1304 }
1305 
1306 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
1307 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1308  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1309  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1310  int> = 0>
1311 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1312 {
1313  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1314  {
1315  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1316  {
1317  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1318  break;
1319  }
1320  case value_t::number_integer:
1321  {
1322  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1323  break;
1324  }
1325  case value_t::number_float:
1326  {
1327  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1328  break;
1329  }
1330 
1331  default:
1332  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1333  }
1334 }
1335 
1336 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1337 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
1338 {
1339  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_boolean()))
1340  {
1341  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1342  }
1343  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
1344 }
1345 
1346 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1347 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1348 {
1349  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1350  {
1351  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1352  }
1353  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1354 }
1355 
1356 template <
1357  typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleStringType,
1358  enable_if_t <
1359  is_constructible_string_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleStringType>::value and
1360  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
1361  ConstructibleStringType>::value,
1362  int > = 0 >
1363 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleStringType& s)
1364 {
1365  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1366  {
1367  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1368  }
1369 
1370  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1371 }
1372 
1373 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1374 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val)
1375 {
1376  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1377 }
1378 
1379 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1380 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val)
1381 {
1382  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1383 }
1384 
1385 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1386 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val)
1387 {
1388  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1389 }
1390 
1391 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
1392  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
1393 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e)
1394 {
1395  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
1396  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1397  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
1398 }
1399 
1400 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
1401 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
1402  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1403 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
1404 {
1405  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1406  {
1407  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1408  }
1409  std::transform(j.rbegin(), j.rend(),
1410  std::front_inserter(l), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1411  {
1412  return i.template get<T>();
1413  });
1414 }
1415 
1416 // valarray doesn't have an insert method
1417 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1418  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1419 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::valarray<T>& l)
1420 {
1421  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1422  {
1423  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1424  }
1425  l.resize(j.size());
1426  std::copy(j.m_value.array->begin(), j.m_value.array->end(), std::begin(l));
1427 }
1428 
1429 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1430 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr, priority_tag<3> /*unused*/)
1431 {
1432  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
1433 }
1434 
1435 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N>
1436 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, std::array<T, N>& arr,
1437  priority_tag<2> /*unused*/)
1438 -> decltype(j.template get<T>(), void())
1439 {
1440  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; ++i)
1441  {
1442  arr[i] = j.at(i).template get<T>();
1443  }
1444 }
1445 
1446 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
1447 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/)
1448 -> decltype(
1449  arr.reserve(std::declval<typename ConstructibleArrayType::size_type>()),
1450  j.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>(),
1451  void())
1452 {
1453  using std::end;
1454 
1455  arr.reserve(j.size());
1456  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1457  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1458  {
1459  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1460  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1461  return i.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>();
1462  });
1463 }
1464 
1465 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType>
1466 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr,
1467  priority_tag<0> /*unused*/)
1468 {
1469  using std::end;
1470 
1471  std::transform(
1472  j.begin(), j.end(), std::inserter(arr, end(arr)),
1473  [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1474  {
1475  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1476  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1477  return i.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>();
1478  });
1479 }
1480 
1481 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleArrayType,
1482  enable_if_t <
1483  is_constructible_array_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1484  not is_constructible_object_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1485  not is_constructible_string_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleArrayType>::value and
1486  not is_basic_json<ConstructibleArrayType>::value,
1487  int > = 0 >
1488 
1489 auto from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleArrayType& arr)
1490 -> decltype(from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<3> {}),
1491 j.template get<typename ConstructibleArrayType::value_type>(),
1492 void())
1493 {
1494  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1495  {
1496  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " +
1497  std::string(j.type_name())));
1498  }
1499 
1500  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<3> {});
1501 }
1502 
1503 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ConstructibleObjectType,
1504  enable_if_t<is_constructible_object_type<BasicJsonType, ConstructibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1505 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ConstructibleObjectType& obj)
1506 {
1507  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
1508  {
1509  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1510  }
1511 
1512  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
1513  using value_type = typename ConstructibleObjectType::value_type;
1514  std::transform(
1515  inner_object->begin(), inner_object->end(),
1516  std::inserter(obj, obj.begin()),
1517  [](typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type const & p)
1518  {
1519  return value_type(p.first, p.second.template get<typename ConstructibleObjectType::mapped_type>());
1520  });
1521 }
1522 
1523 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
1524 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
1525 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
1526 // an arithmetic type?
1527 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1528  enable_if_t <
1529  std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1530  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
1531  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
1532  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
1533  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1534  int> = 0>
1535 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1536 {
1537  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1538  {
1539  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1540  {
1541  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1542  break;
1543  }
1544  case value_t::number_integer:
1545  {
1546  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1547  break;
1548  }
1549  case value_t::number_float:
1550  {
1551  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1552  break;
1553  }
1554  case value_t::boolean:
1555  {
1556  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
1557  break;
1558  }
1559 
1560  default:
1561  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1562  }
1563 }
1564 
1565 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename A1, typename A2>
1566 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::pair<A1, A2>& p)
1567 {
1568  p = {j.at(0).template get<A1>(), j.at(1).template get<A2>()};
1569 }
1570 
1571 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
1572 void from_json_tuple_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...> /*unused*/)
1573 {
1574  t = std::make_tuple(j.at(Idx).template get<typename std::tuple_element<Idx, Tuple>::type>()...);
1575 }
1576 
1577 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1578 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::tuple<Args...>& t)
1579 {
1580  from_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
1581 }
1582 
1583 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename Key, typename Value, typename Compare, typename Allocator,
1584  typename = enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
1585  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, Key>::value>>
1586 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::map<Key, Value, Compare, Allocator>& m)
1587 {
1588  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1589  {
1590  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1591  }
1592  for (const auto& p : j)
1593  {
1594  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not p.is_array()))
1595  {
1596  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(p.type_name())));
1597  }
1598  m.emplace(p.at(0).template get<Key>(), p.at(1).template get<Value>());
1599  }
1600 }
1601 
1602 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename Key, typename Value, typename Hash, typename KeyEqual, typename Allocator,
1603  typename = enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
1604  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, Key>::value>>
1605 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::unordered_map<Key, Value, Hash, KeyEqual, Allocator>& m)
1606 {
1607  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1608  {
1609  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1610  }
1611  for (const auto& p : j)
1612  {
1613  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not p.is_array()))
1614  {
1615  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(p.type_name())));
1616  }
1617  m.emplace(p.at(0).template get<Key>(), p.at(1).template get<Value>());
1618  }
1619 }
1620 
1621 struct from_json_fn
1622 {
1623  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1624  auto operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1625  noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1626  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
1627  {
1628  return from_json(j, val);
1629  }
1630 };
1631 } // namespace detail
1632 
1633 /// namespace to hold default `from_json` function
1634 /// to see why this is required:
1635 /// http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2015/n4381.html
1636 namespace
1637 {
1638 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
1639 } // namespace
1640 } // namespace nlohmann
1641 
1642 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/to_json.hpp>
1643 
1644 
1645 #include <ciso646> // or, and, not
1646 #include <iterator> // begin, end
1647 #include <tuple> // tuple, get
1648 #include <type_traits> // is_same, is_constructible, is_floating_point, is_enum, underlying_type
1649 #include <utility> // move, forward, declval, pair
1650 #include <valarray> // valarray
1651 #include <vector> // vector
1652 
1653 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
1654 
1655 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
1656 
1657 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1658 
1659 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iteration_proxy.hpp>
1660 
1661 
1662 #include <cstddef> // size_t
1663 #include <string> // string, to_string
1664 #include <iterator> // input_iterator_tag
1665 #include <tuple> // tuple_size, get, tuple_element
1666 
1667 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
1668 
1669 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
1670 
1671 
1672 namespace nlohmann
1673 {
1674 namespace detail
1675 {
1676 template <typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy_value
1677 {
1678  public:
1679  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
1680  using value_type = iteration_proxy_value;
1681  using pointer = value_type * ;
1682  using reference = value_type & ;
1683  using iterator_category = std::input_iterator_tag;
1684 
1685  private:
1686  /// the iterator
1687  IteratorType anchor;
1688  /// an index for arrays (used to create key names)
1689  std::size_t array_index = 0;
1690  /// last stringified array index
1691  mutable std::size_t array_index_last = 0;
1692  /// a string representation of the array index
1693  mutable std::string array_index_str = "0";
1694  /// an empty string (to return a reference for primitive values)
1695  const std::string empty_str = "";
1696 
1697  public:
1698  explicit iteration_proxy_value(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it) {}
1699 
1700  /// dereference operator (needed for range-based for)
1701  iteration_proxy_value& operator*()
1702  {
1703  return *this;
1704  }
1705 
1706  /// increment operator (needed for range-based for)
1707  iteration_proxy_value& operator++()
1708  {
1709  ++anchor;
1710  ++array_index;
1711 
1712  return *this;
1713  }
1714 
1715  /// equality operator (needed for InputIterator)
1716  bool operator==(const iteration_proxy_value& o) const
1717  {
1718  return anchor == o.anchor;
1719  }
1720 
1721  /// inequality operator (needed for range-based for)
1722  bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_value& o) const
1723  {
1724  return anchor != o.anchor;
1725  }
1726 
1727  /// return key of the iterator
1728  const std::string& key() const
1729  {
1730  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
1731 
1732  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
1733  {
1734  // use integer array index as key
1735  case value_t::array:
1736  {
1737  if (array_index != array_index_last)
1738  {
1739  array_index_str = std::to_string(array_index);
1740  array_index_last = array_index;
1741  }
1742  return array_index_str;
1743  }
1744 
1745  // use key from the object
1746  case value_t::object:
1747  return anchor.key();
1748 
1749  // use an empty key for all primitive types
1750  default:
1751  return empty_str;
1752  }
1753  }
1754 
1755  /// return value of the iterator
1756  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
1757  {
1758  return anchor.value();
1759  }
1760 };
1761 
1762 /// proxy class for the items() function
1763 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy
1764 {
1765  private:
1766  /// the container to iterate
1767  typename IteratorType::reference container;
1768 
1769  public:
1770  /// construct iteration proxy from a container
1771  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont) noexcept
1772  : container(cont) {}
1773 
1774  /// return iterator begin (needed for range-based for)
1775  iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType> begin() noexcept
1776  {
1777  return iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType>(container.begin());
1778  }
1779 
1780  /// return iterator end (needed for range-based for)
1781  iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType> end() noexcept
1782  {
1783  return iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType>(container.end());
1784  }
1785 };
1786 // Structured Bindings Support
1787 // For further reference see https://blog.tartanllama.xyz/structured-bindings/
1788 // And see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/1391
1789 template <std::size_t N, typename IteratorType, enable_if_t<N == 0, int> = 0>
1790 auto get(const nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType>& i) -> decltype(i.key())
1791 {
1792  return i.key();
1793 }
1794 // Structured Bindings Support
1795 // For further reference see https://blog.tartanllama.xyz/structured-bindings/
1796 // And see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/1391
1797 template <std::size_t N, typename IteratorType, enable_if_t<N == 1, int> = 0>
1798 auto get(const nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType>& i) -> decltype(i.value())
1799 {
1800  return i.value();
1801 }
1802 } // namespace detail
1803 } // namespace nlohmann
1804 
1805 // The Addition to the STD Namespace is required to add
1806 // Structured Bindings Support to the iteration_proxy_value class
1807 // For further reference see https://blog.tartanllama.xyz/structured-bindings/
1808 // And see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/1391
1809 namespace std
1810 {
1811 template <typename IteratorType>
1812 class tuple_size<::nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType>>
1813  : public std::integral_constant<std::size_t, 2> {};
1814 
1815 template <std::size_t N, typename IteratorType>
1816 class tuple_element<N, ::nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType >>
1817 {
1818  public:
1819  using type = decltype(
1820  get<N>(std::declval <
1821  ::nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy_value<IteratorType >> ()));
1822 };
1823 }
1824 
1825 namespace nlohmann
1826 {
1827 namespace detail
1828 {
1829 //////////////////
1830 // constructors //
1831 //////////////////
1832 
1833 template<value_t> struct external_constructor;
1834 
1835 template<>
1836 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
1837 {
1838  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1839  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
1840  {
1841  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
1842  j.m_value = b;
1843  j.assert_invariant();
1844  }
1845 };
1846 
1847 template<>
1848 struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
1849 {
1850  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1851  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1852  {
1853  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1854  j.m_value = s;
1855  j.assert_invariant();
1856  }
1857 
1858  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1859  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
1860  {
1861  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1862  j.m_value = std::move(s);
1863  j.assert_invariant();
1864  }
1865 
1866  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleStringType,
1867  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleStringType, typename BasicJsonType::string_t>::value,
1868  int> = 0>
1869  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleStringType& str)
1870  {
1871  j.m_type = value_t::string;
1872  j.m_value.string = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::string_t>(str);
1873  j.assert_invariant();
1874  }
1875 };
1876 
1877 template<>
1878 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
1879 {
1880  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1881  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
1882  {
1883  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
1884  j.m_value = val;
1885  j.assert_invariant();
1886  }
1887 };
1888 
1889 template<>
1890 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>
1891 {
1892  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1893  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept
1894  {
1895  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
1896  j.m_value = val;
1897  j.assert_invariant();
1898  }
1899 };
1900 
1901 template<>
1902 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>
1903 {
1904  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1905  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept
1906  {
1907  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
1908  j.m_value = val;
1909  j.assert_invariant();
1910  }
1911 };
1912 
1913 template<>
1914 struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
1915 {
1916  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1917  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
1918  {
1919  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1920  j.m_value = arr;
1921  j.assert_invariant();
1922  }
1923 
1924  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1925  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
1926  {
1927  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1928  j.m_value = std::move(arr);
1929  j.assert_invariant();
1930  }
1931 
1932  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1933  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType, typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
1934  int> = 0>
1935  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1936  {
1937  using std::begin;
1938  using std::end;
1939  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1940  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
1941  j.assert_invariant();
1942  }
1943 
1944  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1945  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
1946  {
1947  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1948  j.m_value = value_t::array;
1949  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
1950  for (const bool x : arr)
1951  {
1952  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
1953  }
1954  j.assert_invariant();
1955  }
1956 
1957  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1958  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
1959  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
1960  {
1961  j.m_type = value_t::array;
1962  j.m_value = value_t::array;
1963  j.m_value.array->resize(arr.size());
1964  std::copy(std::begin(arr), std::end(arr), j.m_value.array->begin());
1965  j.assert_invariant();
1966  }
1967 };
1968 
1969 template<>
1970 struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
1971 {
1972  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1973  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)
1974  {
1975  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1976  j.m_value = obj;
1977  j.assert_invariant();
1978  }
1979 
1980  template<typename BasicJsonType>
1981  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
1982  {
1983  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1984  j.m_value = std::move(obj);
1985  j.assert_invariant();
1986  }
1987 
1988  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1989  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType, typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value, int> = 0>
1990  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1991  {
1992  using std::begin;
1993  using std::end;
1994 
1995  j.m_type = value_t::object;
1996  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
1997  j.assert_invariant();
1998  }
1999 };
2000 
2001 /////////////
2002 // to_json //
2003 /////////////
2004 
2005 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
2006  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
2007 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept
2008 {
2009  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
2010 }
2011 
2012 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
2013  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t, CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
2014 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s)
2015 {
2016  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
2017 }
2018 
2019 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2020 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
2021 {
2022  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, std::move(s));
2023 }
2024
