2025 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType,
2026  enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
2027 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept
2028 {
2029  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
2030 }
2031 
2032 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
2033  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value, int> = 0>
2034 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept
2035 {
2036  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
2037 }
2038 
2039 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
2040  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value, int> = 0>
2041 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept
2042 {
2043  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
2044 }
2045 
2046 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
2047  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
2048 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept
2049 {
2050  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
2051  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
2052 }
2053 
2054 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2055 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e)
2056 {
2057  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
2058 }
2059 
2060 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
2061  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType,
2062  CompatibleArrayType>::value and
2063  not is_compatible_object_type<
2064  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
2065  not is_compatible_string_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
2066  not is_basic_json<CompatibleArrayType>::value,
2067  int> = 0>
2068 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
2069 {
2070  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
2071 }
2072 
2073 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
2074  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
2075 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
2076 {
2077  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
2078 }
2079 
2080 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2081 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
2082 {
2083  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
2084 }
2085 
2086 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
2087  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value and not is_basic_json<CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
2088 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
2089 {
2090  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, obj);
2091 }
2092 
2093 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2094 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
2095 {
2096  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, std::move(obj));
2097 }
2098 
2099 template <
2100  typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
2101  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
2102  const T(&)[N]>::value,
2103  int> = 0 >
2104 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const T(&arr)[N])
2105 {
2106  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
2107 }
2108 
2109 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
2110 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::pair<Args...>& p)
2111 {
2112  j = { p.first, p.second };
2113 }
2114 
2115 // for https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/1134
2116 template < typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
2117  enable_if_t<std::is_same<T, iteration_proxy_value<typename BasicJsonType::iterator>>::value, int> = 0>
2118 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const T& b)
2119 {
2120  j = { {b.key(), b.value()} };
2121 }
2122 
2123 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
2124 void to_json_tuple_impl(BasicJsonType& j, const Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...> /*unused*/)
2125 {
2126  j = { std::get<Idx>(t)... };
2127 }
2128 
2129 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
2130 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::tuple<Args...>& t)
2131 {
2132  to_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
2133 }
2134 
2135 struct to_json_fn
2136 {
2137  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
2138  auto operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
2139  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
2140  {
2141  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
2142  }
2143 };
2144 } // namespace detail
2145 
2146 /// namespace to hold default `to_json` function
2147 namespace
2148 {
2149 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
2150 } // namespace
2151 } // namespace nlohmann
2152 
2153 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
2154 
2155 
2156 #include <cassert> // assert
2157 #include <cstddef> // size_t
2158 #include <cstring> // strlen
2159 #include <istream> // istream
2160 #include <iterator> // begin, end, iterator_traits, random_access_iterator_tag, distance, next
2161 #include <memory> // shared_ptr, make_shared, addressof
2162 #include <numeric> // accumulate
2163 #include <string> // string, char_traits
2164 #include <type_traits> // enable_if, is_base_of, is_pointer, is_integral, remove_pointer
2165 #include <utility> // pair, declval
2166 #include <cstdio> //FILE *
2167 
2168 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iterator_traits.hpp>
2169 
2170 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
2171 
2172 
2173 namespace nlohmann
2174 {
2175 namespace detail
2176 {
2177 /// the supported input formats
2178 enum class input_format_t { json, cbor, msgpack, ubjson, bson };
2179 
2180 ////////////////////
2181 // input adapters //
2182 ////////////////////
2183 
2184 /*!
2185 @brief abstract input adapter interface
2186 
2187 Produces a stream of std::char_traits<char>::int_type characters from a
2188 std::istream, a buffer, or some other input type. Accepts the return of
2189 exactly one non-EOF character for future input. The int_type characters
2190 returned consist of all valid char values as positive values (typically
2191 unsigned char), plus an EOF value outside that range, specified by the value
2192 of the function std::char_traits<char>::eof(). This value is typically -1, but
2193 could be any arbitrary value which is not a valid char value.
2194 */
2195 struct input_adapter_protocol
2196 {
2197  /// get a character [0,255] or std::char_traits<char>::eof().
2198  virtual std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() = 0;
2199  virtual ~input_adapter_protocol() = default;
2200 };
2201 
2202 /// a type to simplify interfaces
2203 using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter_protocol>;
2204 
2205 /*!
2206 Input adapter for stdio file access. This adapter read only 1 byte and do not use any
2207  buffer. This adapter is a very low level adapter.
2208 */
2209 class file_input_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2210 {
2211  public:
2212  explicit file_input_adapter(std::FILE* f) noexcept
2213  : m_file(f)
2214  {}
2215 
2216  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
2217  {
2218  return std::fgetc(m_file);
2219  }
2220  private:
2221  /// the file pointer to read from
2222  std::FILE* m_file;
2223 };
2224 
2225 
2226 /*!
2227 Input adapter for a (caching) istream. Ignores a UFT Byte Order Mark at
2228 beginning of input. Does not support changing the underlying std::streambuf
2229 in mid-input. Maintains underlying std::istream and std::streambuf to support
2230 subsequent use of standard std::istream operations to process any input
2231 characters following those used in parsing the JSON input. Clears the
2232 std::istream flags; any input errors (e.g., EOF) will be detected by the first
2233 subsequent call for input from the std::istream.
2234 */
2235 class input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2236 {
2237  public:
2238  ~input_stream_adapter() override
2239  {
2240  // clear stream flags; we use underlying streambuf I/O, do not
2241  // maintain ifstream flags, except eof
2242  is.clear(is.rdstate() & std::ios::eofbit);
2243  }
2244 
2245  explicit input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i)
2246  : is(i), sb(*i.rdbuf())
2247  {}
2248 
2249  // delete because of pointer members
2250  input_stream_adapter(const input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
2251  input_stream_adapter& operator=(input_stream_adapter&) = delete;
2252  input_stream_adapter(input_stream_adapter&&) = delete;
2253  input_stream_adapter& operator=(input_stream_adapter&&) = delete;
2254 
2255  // std::istream/std::streambuf use std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type, to
2256  // ensure that std::char_traits<char>::eof() and the character 0xFF do not
2257  // end up as the same value, eg. 0xFFFFFFFF.
2258  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() override
2259  {
2260  auto res = sb.sbumpc();
2261  // set eof manually, as we don't use the istream interface.
2262  if (res == EOF)
2263  {
2264  is.clear(is.rdstate() | std::ios::eofbit);
2265  }
2266  return res;
2267  }
2268 
2269  private:
2270  /// the associated input stream
2271  std::istream& is;
2272  std::streambuf& sb;
2273 };
2274 
2275 /// input adapter for buffer input
2276 class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2277 {
2278  public:
2279  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, const std::size_t l) noexcept
2280  : cursor(b), limit(b + l)
2281  {}
2282 
2283  // delete because of pointer members
2284  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
2285  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
2286  input_buffer_adapter(input_buffer_adapter&&) = delete;
2287  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&&) = delete;
2288  ~input_buffer_adapter() override = default;
2289 
2290  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
2291  {
2292  if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
2293  {
2294  return std::char_traits<char>::to_int_type(*(cursor++));
2295  }
2296 
2297  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2298  }
2299 
2300  private:
2301  /// pointer to the current character
2302  const char* cursor;
2303  /// pointer past the last character
2304  const char* const limit;
2305 };
2306 
2307 template<typename WideStringType, size_t T>
2308 struct wide_string_input_helper
2309 {
2310  // UTF-32
2311  static void fill_buffer(const WideStringType& str, size_t& current_wchar, std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4>& utf8_bytes, size_t& utf8_bytes_index, size_t& utf8_bytes_filled)
2312  {
2313  utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2314 
2315  if (current_wchar == str.size())
2316  {
2317  utf8_bytes[0] = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2318  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2319  }
2320  else
2321  {
2322  // get the current character
2323  const auto wc = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2324 
2325  // UTF-32 to UTF-8 encoding
2326  if (wc < 0x80)
2327  {
2328  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2329  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2330  }
2331  else if (wc <= 0x7FF)
2332  {
2333  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xC0 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x1F);
2334  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2335  utf8_bytes_filled = 2;
2336  }
2337  else if (wc <= 0xFFFF)
2338  {
2339  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xE0 | ((wc >> 12) & 0x0F);
2340  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2341  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2342  utf8_bytes_filled = 3;
2343  }
2344  else if (wc <= 0x10FFFF)
2345  {
2346  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xF0 | ((wc >> 18) & 0x07);
2347  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 12) & 0x3F);
2348  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2349  utf8_bytes[3] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2350  utf8_bytes_filled = 4;
2351  }
2352  else
2353  {
2354  // unknown character
2355  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2356  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2357  }
2358  }
2359  }
2360 };
2361 
2362 template<typename WideStringType>
2363 struct wide_string_input_helper<WideStringType, 2>
2364 {
2365  // UTF-16
2366  static void fill_buffer(const WideStringType& str, size_t& current_wchar, std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4>& utf8_bytes, size_t& utf8_bytes_index, size_t& utf8_bytes_filled)
2367  {
2368  utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2369 
2370  if (current_wchar == str.size())
2371  {
2372  utf8_bytes[0] = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2373  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2374  }
2375  else
2376  {
2377  // get the current character
2378  const auto wc = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2379 
2380  // UTF-16 to UTF-8 encoding
2381  if (wc < 0x80)
2382  {
2383  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2384  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2385  }
2386  else if (wc <= 0x7FF)
2387  {
2388  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xC0 | ((wc >> 6));
2389  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2390  utf8_bytes_filled = 2;
2391  }
2392  else if (0xD800 > wc or wc >= 0xE000)
2393  {
2394  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xE0 | ((wc >> 12));
2395  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((wc >> 6) & 0x3F);
2396  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | (wc & 0x3F);
2397  utf8_bytes_filled = 3;
2398  }
2399  else
2400  {
2401  if (current_wchar < str.size())
2402  {
2403  const auto wc2 = static_cast<int>(str[current_wchar++]);
2404  const int charcode = 0x10000 + (((wc & 0x3FF) << 10) | (wc2 & 0x3FF));
2405  utf8_bytes[0] = 0xf0 | (charcode >> 18);
2406  utf8_bytes[1] = 0x80 | ((charcode >> 12) & 0x3F);
2407  utf8_bytes[2] = 0x80 | ((charcode >> 6) & 0x3F);
2408  utf8_bytes[3] = 0x80 | (charcode & 0x3F);
2409  utf8_bytes_filled = 4;
2410  }
2411  else
2412  {
2413  // unknown character
2414  ++current_wchar;
2415  utf8_bytes[0] = wc;
2416  utf8_bytes_filled = 1;
2417  }
2418  }
2419  }
2420  }
2421 };
2422 
2423 template<typename WideStringType>
2424 class wide_string_input_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
2425 {
2426  public:
2427  explicit wide_string_input_adapter(const WideStringType& w) noexcept
2428  : str(w)
2429  {}
2430 
2431  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get_character() noexcept override
2432  {
2433  // check if buffer needs to be filled
2434  if (utf8_bytes_index == utf8_bytes_filled)
2435  {
2436  fill_buffer<sizeof(typename WideStringType::value_type)>();
2437 
2438  assert(utf8_bytes_filled > 0);
2439  assert(utf8_bytes_index == 0);
2440  }
2441 
2442  // use buffer
2443  assert(utf8_bytes_filled > 0);
2444  assert(utf8_bytes_index < utf8_bytes_filled);
2445  return utf8_bytes[utf8_bytes_index++];
2446  }
2447 
2448  private:
2449  template<size_t T>
2450  void fill_buffer()
2451  {
2452  wide_string_input_helper<WideStringType, T>::fill_buffer(str, current_wchar, utf8_bytes, utf8_bytes_index, utf8_bytes_filled);
2453  }
2454 
2455  /// the wstring to process
2456  const WideStringType& str;
2457 
2458  /// index of the current wchar in str
2459  std::size_t current_wchar = 0;
2460 
2461  /// a buffer for UTF-8 bytes
2462  std::array<std::char_traits<char>::int_type, 4> utf8_bytes = {{0, 0, 0, 0}};
2463 
2464  /// index to the utf8_codes array for the next valid byte
2465  std::size_t utf8_bytes_index = 0;
2466  /// number of valid bytes in the utf8_codes array
2467  std::size_t utf8_bytes_filled = 0;
2468 };
2469 
2470 class input_adapter
2471 {
2472  public:
2473  // native support
2474  input_adapter(std::FILE* file)
2475  : ia(std::make_shared<file_input_adapter>(file)) {}
2476  /// input adapter for input stream
2477  input_adapter(std::istream& i)
2478  : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i)) {}
2479 
2480  /// input adapter for input stream
2481  input_adapter(std::istream&& i)
2482  : ia(std::make_shared<input_stream_adapter>(i)) {}
2483 
2484  input_adapter(const std::wstring& ws)
2485  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::wstring>>(ws)) {}
2486 
2487  input_adapter(const std::u16string& ws)
2488  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::u16string>>(ws)) {}
2489 
2490  input_adapter(const std::u32string& ws)
2491  : ia(std::make_shared<wide_string_input_adapter<std::u32string>>(ws)) {}
2492 
2493  /// input adapter for buffer
2494  template<typename CharT,
2495  typename std::enable_if<
2496  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
2497  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
2498  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
2499  int>::type = 0>
2500  input_adapter(CharT b, std::size_t l)
2501  : ia(std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), l)) {}
2502 
2503  // derived support
2504 
2505  /// input adapter for string literal
2506  template<typename CharT,
2507  typename std::enable_if<
2508  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
2509  std::is_integral<typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
2510  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
2511  int>::type = 0>
2512  input_adapter(CharT b)
2513  : input_adapter(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
2514  std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b))) {}
2515 
2516  /// input adapter for iterator range with contiguous storage
2517  template<class IteratorType,
2518  typename std::enable_if<
2519  std::is_same<typename iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category, std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
2520  int>::type = 0>
2521  input_adapter(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
2522  {
2523 #ifndef NDEBUG
2524  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
2525  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
2526  const auto is_contiguous = std::accumulate(
2527  first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
2528  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val)
2529  {
2530  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
2531  return res;
2532  }).first;
2533  assert(is_contiguous);
2534 #endif
2535 
2536  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
2537  static_assert(
2538  sizeof(typename iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
2539  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
2540 
2541  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last));
2542  if (JSON_LIKELY(len > 0))
2543  {
2544  // there is at least one element: use the address of first
2545  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), len);
2546  }
2547  else
2548  {
2549  // the address of first cannot be used: use nullptr
2550  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(nullptr, len);
2551  }
2552  }
2553 
2554  /// input adapter for array
2555  template<class T, std::size_t N>
2556  input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
2557  : input_adapter(std::begin(array), std::end(array)) {}
2558 
2559  /// input adapter for contiguous container
2560  template<class ContiguousContainer, typename
2561  std::enable_if<not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
2562  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag, typename iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
2563  int>::type = 0>
2564  input_adapter(const ContiguousContainer& c)
2565  : input_adapter(std::begin(c), std::end(c)) {}
2566 
2567  operator input_adapter_t()
2568  {
2569  return ia;
2570  }
2571 
2572  private:
2573  /// the actual adapter
2574  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
2575 };
2576 } // namespace detail
2577 } // namespace nlohmann
2578 
2579 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/lexer.hpp>
2580 
2581 
2582 #include <clocale> // localeconv
2583 #include <cstddef> // size_t
2584 #include <cstdlib> // strtof, strtod, strtold, strtoll, strtoull
2585 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
2586 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
2587 #include <string> // char_traits, string
2588 #include <vector> // vector
2589 
2590 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
2591 
2592 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
2593 
2594 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/position_t.hpp>
2595 
2596 
2597 namespace nlohmann
2598 {
2599 namespace detail
2600 {
2601 ///////////
2602 // lexer //
2603 ///////////
2604 
2605 /*!
2606 @brief lexical analysis
2607 
2608 This class organizes the lexical analysis during JSON deserialization.
2609 */
2610 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2611 class lexer
2612 {
2613  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
2614  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
2615  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
2616  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
2617 
2618  public:
2619  /// token types for the parser
2620  enum class token_type
2621  {
2622  uninitialized, ///< indicating the scanner is uninitialized
2623  literal_true, ///< the `true` literal
2624  literal_false, ///< the `false` literal
2625  literal_null, ///< the `null` literal
2626  value_string, ///< a string -- use get_string() for actual value
2627  value_unsigned, ///< an unsigned integer -- use get_number_unsigned() for actual value
2628  value_integer, ///< a signed integer -- use get_number_integer() for actual value
2629  value_float, ///< an floating point number -- use get_number_float() for actual value
2630  begin_array, ///< the character for array begin `[`
2631  begin_object, ///< the character for object begin `{`
2632  end_array, ///< the character for array end `]`
2633  end_object, ///< the character for object end `}`
2634  name_separator, ///< the name separator `:`
2635  value_separator, ///< the value separator `,`
2636  parse_error, ///< indicating a parse error
2637  end_of_input, ///< indicating the end of the input buffer
2638  literal_or_value ///< a literal or the begin of a value (only for diagnostics)
2639  };
2640 
2641  /// return name of values of type token_type (only used for errors)
2642  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
2643  {
2644  switch (t)
2645  {
2646  case token_type::uninitialized:
2647  return "<uninitialized>";
2648  case token_type::literal_true:
2649  return "true literal";
2650  case token_type::literal_false:
2651  return "false literal";
2652  case token_type::literal_null:
2653  return "null literal";
2654  case token_type::value_string:
2655  return "string literal";
2656  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
2657  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
2658  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
2659  return "number literal";
2660  case token_type::begin_array:
2661  return "'['";
2662  case token_type::begin_object:
2663  return "'{'";
2664  case token_type::end_array:
2665  return "']'";
2666  case token_type::end_object:
2667  return "'}'";
2668  case token_type::name_separator:
2669  return "':'";
2670  case token_type::value_separator:
2671  return "','";
2672  case token_type::parse_error:
2673  return "<parse error>";
2674  case token_type::end_of_input:
2675  return "end of input";
2676  case token_type::literal_or_value:
2677  return "'[', '{', or a literal";
2678  // LCOV_EXCL_START
2679  default: // catch non-enum values
2680  return "unknown token";
2681  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
2682  }
2683  }
2684 
2685  explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t&& adapter)
2686  : ia(std::move(adapter)), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {}
2687 
2688  // delete because of pointer members
2689  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
2690  lexer(lexer&&) = delete;
2691  lexer& operator=(lexer&) = delete;
2692  lexer& operator=(lexer&&) = delete;
2693  ~lexer() = default;
2694 
2695  private:
2696  /////////////////////
2697  // locales
2698  /////////////////////
2699 
2700  /// return the locale-dependent decimal point
2701  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
2702  {
2703  const auto loc = localeconv();
2704  assert(loc != nullptr);
2705  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : *(loc->decimal_point);
2706  }
2707 
2708  /////////////////////
2709  // scan functions
2710  /////////////////////
2711 
2712  /*!
2713  @brief get codepoint from 4 hex characters following `\u`
2714 
2715  For input "\u c1 c2 c3 c4" the codepoint is:
2716  (c1 * 0x1000) + (c2 * 0x0100) + (c3 * 0x0010) + c4
2717  = (c1 << 12) + (c2 << 8) + (c3 << 4) + (c4 << 0)
2718 
2719  Furthermore, the possible characters '0'..'9', 'A'..'F', and 'a'..'f'
2720  must be converted to the integers 0x0..0x9, 0xA..0xF, 0xA..0xF, resp. The
2721  conversion is done by subtracting the offset (0x30, 0x37, and 0x57)
2722  between the ASCII value of the character and the desired integer value.
2723 
2724  @return codepoint (0x0000..0xFFFF) or -1 in case of an error (e.g. EOF or
2725  non-hex character)
2726  */
2727  int get_codepoint()
2728  {
2729  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
2730  assert(current == 'u');
2731  int codepoint = 0;
2732 
2733  const auto factors = { 12, 8, 4, 0 };
2734  for (const auto factor : factors)
2735  {
2736  get();
2737 
2738  if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
2739  {
2740  codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
2741  }
2742  else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
2743  {
2744  codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
2745  }
2746  else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
2747  {
2748  codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
2749  }
2750  else
2751  {
2752  return -1;
2753  }
2754  }
2755 
2756  assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
2757  return codepoint;
2758  }
2759 
2760  /*!
2761  @brief check if the next byte(s) are inside a given range
2762 
2763  Adds the current byte and, for each passed range, reads a new byte and
2764  checks if it is inside the range. If a violation was detected, set up an
2765  error message and return false. Otherwise, return true.
2766 
2767  @param[in] ranges list of integers; interpreted as list of pairs of
2768  inclusive lower and upper bound, respectively
2769 
2770  @pre The passed list @a ranges must have 2, 4, or 6 elements; that is,
2771  1, 2, or 3 pairs. This precondition is enforced by an assertion.
2772 
2773  @return true if and only if no range violation was detected
2774  */
2775  bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
2776  {
2777  assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
2778  add(current);
2779 
2780  for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
2781  {
2782  get();
2783  if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
2784  {
2785  add(current);
2786  }
2787  else
2788  {
2789  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
2790  return false;
2791  }
2792  }
2793 
2794  return true;
2795  }
2796 
2797  /*!
2798  @brief scan a string literal
2799 
2800  This function scans a string according to Sect. 7 of RFC 7159. While
2801  scanning, bytes are escaped and copied into buffer token_buffer. Then the
2802  function returns successfully, token_buffer is *not* null-terminated (as it
2803  may contain \0 bytes), and token_buffer.size() is the number of bytes in the
2804  string.
2805 
2806  @return token_type::value_string if string could be successfully scanned,
2807  token_type::parse_error otherwise
2808 
2809  @note In case of errors, variable error_message contains a textual
2810  description.
2811  */
2812  token_type scan_string()
2813  {
2814  // reset token_buffer (ignore opening quote)
2815  reset();
2816 
2817  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
2818  assert(current == '\"');
2819 
2820  while (true)
2821  {
2822  // get next character
2823  switch (get())
2824  {
2825  // end of file while parsing string
2826  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
2827  {
2828  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
2829  return token_type::parse_error;
2830  }
2831 
2832  // closing quote
2833  case '\"':
2834  {
2835  return token_type::value_string;
2836  }
2837 
2838  // escapes
2839  case '\\':
2840  {
2841  switch (get())
2842  {
2843  // quotation mark
2844  case '\"':
2845  add('\"');
2846  break;
2847  // reverse solidus
2848  case '\\':
2849  add('\\');
2850  break;
2851  // solidus
2852  case '/':
2853  add('/');
2854  break;
2855  // backspace
2856  case 'b':
2857  add('\b');
2858  break;
2859  // form feed
2860  case 'f':
2861  add('\f');
2862  break;
2863  // line feed
2864  case 'n':
2865  add('\n');
2866  break;
2867  // carriage return
2868  case 'r':
2869  add('\r');
2870  break;
2871  // tab
2872  case 't':
2873  add('\t');
2874  break;
2875 
2876  // unicode escapes
2877  case 'u':
2878  {
2879  const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
2880  int codepoint = codepoint1; // start with codepoint1
2881 
2882  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
2883  {
2884  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
2885  return token_type::parse_error;
2886  }
2887 
2888  // check if code point is a high surrogate
2889  if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
2890  {
2891  // expect next \uxxxx entry
2892  if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
2893  {
2894  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
2895 
2896  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
2897  {
2898  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
2899  return token_type::parse_error;
2900  }
2901 
2902  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
2903  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
2904  {
2905  // overwrite codepoint
2906  codepoint =
2907  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
2908  (codepoint1 << 10)
2909  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
2910  + codepoint2
2911  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
2912  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
2913  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
2914  - 0x35FDC00;
2915  }
2916  else
2917  {
2918  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
2919  return token_type::parse_error;
2920  }
2921  }
2922  else
2923  {
2924  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
2925  return token_type::parse_error;
2926  }
2927  }
2928  else
2929  {
2930  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
2931  {
2932  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
2933  return token_type::parse_error;
2934  }
2935  }
2936 
2937  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
2938  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
2939 
2940  // translate codepoint into bytes
2941  if (codepoint < 0x80)
2942  {
2943  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
2944  add(codepoint);
2945  }
2946  else if (codepoint <= 0x7FF)
2947  {
2948  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
2949  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
2950  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2951  }
2952  else if (codepoint <= 0xFFFF)
2953  {
2954  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2955  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
2956  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2957  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2958  }
2959  else
2960  {
2961  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2962  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
2963  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
2964  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2965  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2966  }
2967 
2968  break;
2969  }
2970 
2971  // other characters after escape
2972  default:
2973  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
2974  return token_type::parse_error;
2975  }
2976 
2977  break;
2978  }
2979 
2980  // invalid control characters
2981  case 0x00:
2982  {
2983  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0000 (NUL) must be escaped to \\u0000";
2984  return token_type::parse_error;
2985  }
2986 
2987  case 0x01:
2988  {
2989  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0001 (SOH) must be escaped to \\u0001";
2990  return token_type::parse_error;
2991  }
2992 
2993  case 0x02:
2994  {
2995  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0002 (STX) must be escaped to \\u0002";
2996  return token_type::parse_error;
2997  }
2998 
2999  case 0x03:
3000  {
3001  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0003 (ETX) must be escaped to \\u0003";
3002  return token_type::parse_error;
3003  }
3004 
3005  case 0x04:
3006  {
3007  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0004 (EOT) must be escaped to \\u0004";
3008  return token_type::parse_error;
3009  }
3010 
3011  case 0x05:
3012  {
3013  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0005 (ENQ) must be escaped to \\u0005";
3014  return token_type::parse_error;
3015  }
3016 
3017  case 0x06:
3018  {
3019  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0006 (ACK) must be escaped to \\u0006";
3020  return token_type::parse_error;
3021  }
3022 
3023  case 0x07:
3024  {
3025  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0007 (BEL) must be escaped to \\u0007";
3026  return token_type::parse_error;
3027  }
3028 
3029  case 0x08:
3030  {
3031  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0008 (BS) must be escaped to \\u0008 or \\b";
3032  return token_type::parse_error;
3033  }
3034 
3035  case 0x09:
3036  {
3037  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0009 (HT) must be escaped to \\u0009 or \\t";
3038  return token_type::parse_error;
3039  }
3040 
3041  case 0x0A:
3042  {
3043  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000A (LF) must be escaped to \\u000A or \\n";
3044  return token_type::parse_error;
3045  }
3046 
3047  case 0x0B:
3048  {
3049  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000B (VT) must be escaped to \\u000B";
3050  return token_type::parse_error;
3051  }
3052 
3053  case 0x0C:
3054  {
3055  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000C (FF) must be escaped to \\u000C or \\f";
3056  return token_type::parse_error;
3057  }
3058 
3059  case 0x0D:
3060  {
3061  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000D (CR) must be escaped to \\u000D or \\r";
3062  return token_type::parse_error;
3063  }
3064 
3065  case 0x0E:
3066  {
3067  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000E (SO) must be escaped to \\u000E";
3068  return token_type::parse_error;
3069  }
3070 
3071  case 0x0F:
3072  {
3073  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+000F (SI) must be escaped to \\u000F";
3074  return token_type::parse_error;
3075  }
3076 
3077  case 0x10:
3078  {
3079  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0010 (DLE) must be escaped to \\u0010";
3080  return token_type::parse_error;
3081  }
3082 
3083  case 0x11:
3084  {
3085  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0011 (DC1) must be escaped to \\u0011";
3086  return token_type::parse_error;
3087  }
3088 
3089  case 0x12:
3090  {
3091  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0012 (DC2) must be escaped to \\u0012";
3092  return token_type::parse_error;
3093  }
3094 
3095  case 0x13:
3096  {
3097  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0013 (DC3) must be escaped to \\u0013";
3098  return token_type::parse_error;
3099  }
3100 
3101  case 0x14:
3102  {
3103  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0014 (DC4) must be escaped to \\u0014";
3104  return token_type::parse_error;
3105  }
3106 
3107  case 0x15:
3108  {
3109  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0015 (NAK) must be escaped to \\u0015";
3110  return token_type::parse_error;
3111  }
3112 
3113  case 0x16:
3114  {
3115  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0016 (SYN) must be escaped to \\u0016";
3116  return token_type::parse_error;
3117  }
3118 
3119  case 0x17:
3120  {
3121  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0017 (ETB) must be escaped to \\u0017";
3122  return token_type::parse_error;
3123  }
3124 
3125  case 0x18:
3126  {
3127  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0018 (CAN) must be escaped to \\u0018";
3128  return token_type::parse_error;
3129  }
3130 
3131  case 0x19:
3132  {
3133  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+0019 (EM) must be escaped to \\u0019";
3134  return token_type::parse_error;
3135  }
3136 
3137  case 0x1A:
3138  {
3139  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001A (SUB) must be escaped to \\u001A";
3140  return token_type::parse_error;
3141  }
3142 
3143  case 0x1B:
3144  {
3145  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001B (ESC) must be escaped to \\u001B";
3146  return token_type::parse_error;
3147  }
3148 
3149  case 0x1C:
3150  {
3151  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001C (FS) must be escaped to \\u001C";
3152  return token_type::parse_error;
3153  }
3154 
3155  case 0x1D:
3156  {
3157  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001D (GS) must be escaped to \\u001D";
3158  return token_type::parse_error;
3159  }
3160 
3161  case 0x1E:
3162  {
3163  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001E (RS) must be escaped to \\u001E";
3164  return token_type::parse_error;
3165  }
3166 
3167  case 0x1F:
3168  {
3169  error_message = "invalid string: control character U+001F (US) must be escaped to \\u001F";
3170  return token_type::parse_error;
3171  }
3172 
3173  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
3174  case 0x20:
3175  case 0x21:
3176  case 0x23:
3177  case 0x24:
3178  case 0x25:
3179  case 0x26:
3180  case 0x27:
3181  case 0x28:
3182  case 0x29:
3183  case 0x2A:
3184  case 0x2B:
3185  case 0x2C:
3186  case 0x2D:
3187  case 0x2E:
3188  case 0x2F:
3189  case 0x30:
3190  case 0x31:
3191  case 0x32:
3192  case 0x33:
3193  case 0x34:
3194  case 0x35:
3195  case 0x36:
3196  case 0x37:
3197  case 0x38:
3198  case 0x39:
3199  case 0x3A:
3200  case 0x3B:
3201  case 0x3C:
3202  case 0x3D:
3203  case 0x3E:
3204  case 0x3F:
3205  case 0x40:
3206  case 0x41:
3207  case 0x42:
3208  case 0x43:
3209  case 0x44:
3210  case 0x45:
3211  case 0x46:
3212  case 0x47:
3213  case 0x48:
3214  case 0x49:
3215  case 0x4A:
3216  case 0x4B:
3217  case 0x4C:
3218  case 0x4D:
3219  case 0x4E:
3220  case 0x4F:
3221  case 0x50:
3222  case 0x51:
3223  case 0x52:
3224  case 0x53:
3225  case 0x54:
3226  case 0x55:
3227  case 0x56:
3228  case 0x57:
3229  case 0x58:
3230  case 0x59:
3231  case 0x5A:
3232  case 0x5B:
3233  case 0x5D:
3234  case 0x5E:
3235  case 0x5F:
3236  case 0x60:
3237  case 0x61:
3238  case 0x62:
3239  case 0x63:
3240  case 0x64:
3241  case 0x65:
3242  case 0x66:
3243  case 0x67:
3244  case 0x68:
3245  case 0x69:
3246  case 0x6A:
3247  case 0x6B:
3248  case 0x6C:
3249  case 0x6D:
3250  case 0x6E:
3251  case 0x6F:
3252  case 0x70:
3253  case 0x71:
3254  case 0x72:
3255  case 0x73:
3256  case 0x74:
3257  case 0x75:
3258  case 0x76:
3259  case 0x77:
3260  case 0x78:
3261  case 0x79:
3262  case 0x7A:
3263  case 0x7B:
3264  case 0x7C:
3265  case 0x7D:
3266  case 0x7E:
3267  case 0x7F:
3268  {
3269  add(current);
3270  break;
3271  }
3272 
3273  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
3274  case 0xC2:
3275  case 0xC3:
3276  case 0xC4:
3277  case 0xC5:
3278  case 0xC6:
3279  case 0xC7:
3280  case 0xC8:
3281  case 0xC9:
3282  case 0xCA:
3283  case 0xCB:
3284  case 0xCC:
3285  case 0xCD:
3286  case 0xCE:
3287  case 0xCF:
3288  case 0xD0:
3289  case 0xD1:
3290  case 0xD2:
3291  case 0xD3:
3292  case 0xD4:
3293  case 0xD5:
3294  case 0xD6:
3295  case 0xD7:
3296  case 0xD8:
3297  case 0xD9:
3298  case 0xDA:
3299  case 0xDB:
3300  case 0xDC:
3301  case 0xDD:
3302  case 0xDE:
3303  case 0xDF:
3304  {
3305  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF})))
3306  {
3307  return token_type::parse_error;
3308  }
3309  break;
3310  }
3311 
3312  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
3313  case 0xE0:
3314  {
3315  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0xA0, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3316  {
3317  return token_type::parse_error;
3318  }
3319  break;
3320  }
3321 
3322  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
3323  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
3324  case 0xE1:
3325  case 0xE2:
3326  case 0xE3:
3327  case 0xE4:
3328  case 0xE5:
3329  case 0xE6:
3330  case 0xE7:
3331  case 0xE8:
3332  case 0xE9:
3333  case 0xEA:
3334  case 0xEB:
3335  case 0xEC:
3336  case 0xEE:
3337  case 0xEF:
3338  {
3339  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3340  {
3341  return token_type::parse_error;
3342  }
3343  break;
3344  }
3345 
3346  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
3347  case 0xED:
3348  {
3349  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x9F, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3350  {
3351  return token_type::parse_error;
3352  }
3353  break;
3354  }
3355 
3356  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
3357  case 0xF0:
3358  {
3359  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x90, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3360  {
3361  return token_type::parse_error;
3362  }
3363  break;
3364  }
3365 
3366  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
3367  case 0xF1:
3368  case 0xF2:
3369  case 0xF3:
3370  {
3371  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3372  {
3373  return token_type::parse_error;
3374  }
3375  break;
3376  }
3377 
3378  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
3379  case 0xF4:
3380  {
3381  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
3382  {
3383  return token_type::parse_error;
3384  }
3385  break;
3386  }
3387 
3388  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
3389  default:
3390  {
3391  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
3392  return token_type::parse_error;
3393  }
3394  }
3395  }
3396  }
3397 
3398  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3399  {
3400  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
3401  }
3402 
3403  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3404  {
3405  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
3406  }
3407 
3408  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
3409  {
3410  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
3411  }
3412 
3413  /*!
3414  @brief scan a number literal
3415 
3416  This function scans a string according to Sect. 6 of RFC 7159.
3417 
3418  The function is realized with a deterministic finite state machine derived
3419  from the grammar described in RFC 7159. Starting in state "init", the
3420  input is read and used to determined the next state. Only state "done"
3421  accepts the number. State "error" is a trap state to model errors. In the
3422  table below, "anything" means any character but the ones listed before.
3423 
3424  state | 0 | 1-9 | e E | + | - | . | anything
3425  ---------|----------|----------|----------|---------|---------|----------|-----------
3426  init | zero | any1 | [error] | [error] | minus | [error] | [error]
3427  minus | zero | any1 | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error]
3428  zero | done | done | exponent | done | done | decimal1 | done
3429  any1 | any1 | any1 | exponent | done | done | decimal1 | done
3430  decimal1 | decimal2 | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error]
3431  decimal2 | decimal2 | decimal2 | exponent | done | done | done | done
3432  exponent | any2 | any2 | [error] | sign | sign | [error] | [error]
3433  sign | any2 | any2 | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error] | [error]
3434  any2 | any2 | any2 | done | done | done | done | done
3435 
3436  The state machine is realized with one label per state (prefixed with
3437  "scan_number_") and `goto` statements between them. The state machine
3438  contains cycles, but any cycle can be left when EOF is read. Therefore,
3439  the function is guaranteed to terminate.
3440 
3441  During scanning, the read bytes are stored in token_buffer. This string is
3442  then converted to a signed integer, an unsigned integer, or a
3443  floating-point number.
3444 
3445  @return token_type::value_unsigned, token_type::value_integer, or
3446  token_type::value_float if number could be successfully scanned,
3447  token_type::parse_error otherwise
3448 
3449  @note The scanner is independent of the current locale. Internally, the
3450  locale's decimal point is used instead of `.` to work with the
3451  locale-dependent converters.
3452  */
3453  token_type scan_number() // lgtm [cpp/use-of-goto]
3454  {
3455  // reset token_buffer to store the number's bytes
3456  reset();
3457 
3458  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
3459  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
3460  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
3461 
3462  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
3463  switch (current)
3464  {
3465  case '-':
3466  {
3467  add(current);
3468  goto scan_number_minus;
3469  }
3470 
3471  case '0':
3472  {
3473  add(current);
3474  goto scan_number_zero;
3475  }
3476 
3477  case '1':
3478  case '2':
3479  case '3':
3480  case '4':
3481  case '5':
3482  case '6':
3483  case '7':
3484  case '8':
3485  case '9':
3486  {
3487  add(current);
3488  goto scan_number_any1;
3489  }
3490 
3491  // LCOV_EXCL_START
3492  default:
3493  {
3494  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
3495  assert(false);
3496  }
3497  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
3498  }
3499 
3500 scan_number_minus:
3501  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
3502  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
3503  switch (get())
3504  {
3505  case '0':
3506  {
3507  add(current);
3508  goto scan_number_zero;
3509  }
3510 
3511  case '1':
3512  case '2':
3513  case '3':
3514  case '4':
3515  case '5':
3516  case '6':
3517  case '7':
3518  case '8':
3519  case '9':
3520  {
3521  add(current);
3522  goto scan_number_any1;
3523  }
3524 
3525  default:
3526  {
3527  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
3528  return token_type::parse_error;
3529  }
3530  }
3531 
3532 scan_number_zero:
3533  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
3534  switch (get())
3535  {
3536  case '.':
3537  {
3538  add(decimal_point_char);
3539  goto scan_number_decimal1;
3540  }
3541 
3542  case 'e':
3543  case 'E':
3544  {
3545  add(current);
3546  goto scan_number_exponent;
3547  }
3548 
3549  default:
3550  goto scan_number_done;
3551  }
3552 
3553 scan_number_any1:
3554  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
3555  switch (get())
3556  {
3557  case '0':
3558  case '1':
3559  case '2':
3560  case '3':
3561  case '4':
3562  case '5':
3563  case '6':
3564  case '7':
3565  case '8':
3566  case '9':
3567  {
3568  add(current);
3569  goto scan_number_any1;
3570  }
3571 
3572  case '.':
3573  {
3574  add(decimal_point_char);
3575  goto scan_number_decimal1;
3576  }
3577 
3578  case 'e':
3579  case 'E':
3580  {
3581  add(current);
3582  goto scan_number_exponent;
3583  }
3584 
3585  default:
3586  goto scan_number_done;
3587  }
3588 
3589 scan_number_decimal1:
3590  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
3591  number_type = token_type::value_float;
3592  switch (get())
3593  {
3594  case '0':
3595  case '1':
3596  case '2':
3597  case '3':
3598  case '4':
3599  case '5':
3600  case '6':
3601  case '7':
3602  case '8':
3603  case '9':
3604  {
3605  add(current);
3606  goto scan_number_decimal2;
3607  }
3608 
3609  default:
3610  {
3611  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
3612  return token_type::parse_error;
3613  }
3614  }
3615 
3616 scan_number_decimal2:
3617  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
3618  switch (get())
3619  {
3620  case '0':
3621  case '1':
3622  case '2':
3623  case '3':
3624  case '4':
3625  case '5':
3626  case '6':
3627  case '7':
3628  case '8':
3629  case '9':
3630  {
3631  add(current);
3632  goto scan_number_decimal2;
3633  }
3634 
3635  case 'e':
3636  case 'E':
3637  {
3638  add(current);
3639  goto scan_number_exponent;
3640  }
3641 
3642  default:
3643  goto scan_number_done;
3644  }
3645 
3646 scan_number_exponent:
3647  // we just parsed an exponent
3648  number_type = token_type::value_float;
3649  switch (get())
3650  {
3651  case '+':
3652  case '-':
3653  {
3654  add(current);
3655  goto scan_number_sign;
3656  }
3657 
3658  case '0':
3659  case '1':
3660  case '2':
3661  case '3':
3662  case '4':
3663  case '5':
3664  case '6':
3665  case '7':
3666  case '8':
3667  case '9':
3668  {
3669  add(current);
3670  goto scan_number_any2;
3671  }
3672 
3673  default:
3674  {
3675  error_message =
3676  "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
3677  return token_type::parse_error;
3678  }
3679  }
3680 
3681 scan_number_sign:
3682  // we just parsed an exponent sign
3683  switch (get())
3684  {
3685  case '0':
3686  case '1':
3687  case '2':
3688  case '3':
3689  case '4':
3690  case '5':
3691  case '6':
3692  case '7':
3693  case '8':
3694  case '9':
3695  {
3696  add(current);
3697  goto scan_number_any2;
3698  }
3699 
3700  default:
3701  {
3702  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
3703  return token_type::parse_error;
3704  }
3705  }
3706 
3707 scan_number_any2:
3708  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
3709  switch (get())
3710  {
3711  case '0':
3712  case '1':
3713  case '2':
3714  case '3':
3715  case '4':
3716  case '5':
3717  case '6':
3718  case '7':
3719  case '8':
3720  case '9':
3721  {
3722  add(current);
3723  goto scan_number_any2;
3724  }
3725 
3726  default:
3727  goto scan_number_done;
3728  }
3729 
3730 scan_number_done:
3731  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
3732  // we are done scanning a number)
3733  unget();
3734 
3735  char* endptr = nullptr;
3736  errno = 0;
3737 
3738  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
3739  if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
3740  {
3741  const auto x = std::strtoull(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
3742 
3743  // we checked the number format before
3744  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3745 
3746  if (errno == 0)
3747  {
3748  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
3749  if (value_unsigned == x)
3750  {
3751  return token_type::value_unsigned;
3752  }
3753  }
3754  }
3755  else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
3756  {
3757  const auto x = std::strtoll(token_buffer.data(), &endptr, 10);
3758 
3759  // we checked the number format before
3760  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3761 
3762  if (errno == 0)
3763  {
3764  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
3765  if (value_integer == x)
3766  {
3767  return token_type::value_integer;
3768  }
3769  }
3770  }
3771 
3772  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if an
3773  // integer conversion above failed
3774  strtof(value_float, token_buffer.data(), &endptr);
3775 
3776  // we checked the number format before
3777  assert(endptr == token_buffer.data() + token_buffer.size());
3778 
3779  return token_type::value_float;
3780  }
3781 
3782  /*!
3783  @param[in] literal_text the literal text to expect
3784  @param[in] length the length of the passed literal text
3785  @param[in] return_type the token type to return on success
3786  */
3787  token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
3788  token_type return_type)
3789  {
3790  assert(current == literal_text[0]);
3791  for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
3792  {
3793  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
3794  {
3795  error_message = "invalid literal";
3796  return token_type::parse_error;
3797  }
3798  }
3799  return return_type;
3800  }
3801 
3802  /////////////////////
3803  // input management
3804  /////////////////////
3805 
3806  /// reset token_buffer; current character is beginning of token
3807  void reset() noexcept
3808  {
3809  token_buffer.clear();
3810  token_string.clear();
3811  token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
3812  }
3813 
3814  /*
3815  @brief get next character from the input
3816 
3817  This function provides the interface to the used input adapter. It does
3818  not throw in case the input reached EOF, but returns a
3819  `std::char_traits<char>::eof()` in that case. Stores the scanned characters
3820  for use in error messages.
3821 
3822  @return character read from the input
3823  */
3824  std::char_traits<char>::int_type get()
3825  {
3826  ++position.chars_read_total;
3827  ++position.chars_read_current_line;
3828 
3829  if (next_unget)
3830  {
3831  // just reset the next_unget variable and work with current
3832  next_unget = false;
3833  }
3834  else
3835  {
3836  current = ia->get_character();
3837  }
3838 
3839  if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
3840  {
3841  token_string.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(current));
3842  }
3843 
3844  if (current == '\n')
3845  {
3846  ++position.lines_read;
3847  position.chars_read_current_line = 0;
3848  }
3849 
3850  return current;
3851  }
3852 
3853  /*!
3854  @brief unget current character (read it again on next get)
3855 
3856  We implement unget by setting variable next_unget to true. The input is not
3857  changed - we just simulate ungetting by modifying chars_read_total,
3858  chars_read_current_line, and token_string. The next call to get() will
3859  behave as if the unget character is read again.
3860  */
3861  void unget()
3862  {
3863  next_unget = true;
3864 
3865  --position.chars_read_total;
3866 
3867  // in case we "unget" a newline, we have to also decrement the lines_read
3868  if (position.chars_read_current_line == 0)
3869  {
3870  if (position.lines_read > 0)
3871  {
3872  --position.lines_read;
3873  }
3874  }
3875  else
3876  {
3877  --position.chars_read_current_line;
3878  }
3879 
3880  if (JSON_LIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
3881  {
3882  assert(token_string.size() != 0);
3883  token_string.pop_back();
3884  }
3885  }
3886 
3887  /// add a character to token_buffer
3888  void add(int c)
3889  {
3890  token_buffer.push_back(std::char_traits<char>::to_char_type(c));
3891  }
3892 
3893  public:
3894  /////////////////////
3895  // value getters
3896  /////////////////////
3897 
3898  /// return integer value
3899  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept
3900  {
3901  return value_integer;
3902  }
3903 
3904  /// return unsigned integer value
3905  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept
3906  {
3907  return value_unsigned;
3908  }
3909 
3910  /// return floating-point value
3911  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept
3912  {
3913  return value_float;
3914  }
3915 
3916  /// return current string value (implicitly resets the token; useful only once)
3917  string_t& get_string()
3918  {
3919  return token_buffer;
3920  }
3921 
3922  /////////////////////
3923  // diagnostics
3924  /////////////////////
3925 
3926  /// return position of last read token
3927  constexpr position_t get_position() const noexcept
3928  {
3929  return position;
3930  }
3931 
3932  /// return the last read token (for errors only). Will never contain EOF
3933  /// (an arbitrary value that is not a valid char value, often -1), because
3934  /// 255 may legitimately occur. May contain NUL, which should be escaped.
3935  std::string get_token_string() const
3936  {
3937  // escape control characters
3938  std::string result;
3939  for (const auto c : token_string)
3940  {
3941  if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1F')
3942  {
3943  // escape control characters
3944  char cs[9];
3945  (std::snprintf)(cs, 9, "<U+%.4X>", static_cast<unsigned char>(c));
3946  result += cs;
3947  }
3948  else
3949  {
3950  // add character as is
3951  result.push_back(c);
3952  }
3953  }
3954 
3955  return result;
3956  }
3957 
3958  /// return syntax error message
3959  constexpr const char* get_error_message() const noexcept
3960  {
3961  return error_message;
3962  }
3963 
3964  /////////////////////
3965  // actual scanner
3966  /////////////////////
3967 
3968  /*!
3969  @brief skip the UTF-8 byte order mark
3970  @return true iff there is no BOM or the correct BOM has been skipped
3971  */
3972  bool skip_bom()
3973  {
3974  if (get() == 0xEF)
3975  {
3976  // check if we completely parse the BOM
3977  return get() == 0xBB and get() == 0xBF;
3978  }
3979 
3980  // the first character is not the beginning of the BOM; unget it to
3981  // process is later
3982  unget();
3983  return true;
3984  }
3985 
3986  token_type scan()
3987  {
3988  // initially, skip the BOM
3989  if (position.chars_read_total == 0 and not skip_bom())
3990  {
3991  error_message = "invalid BOM; must be 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF if given";
3992  return token_type::parse_error;
3993  }
3994 
3995  // read next character and ignore whitespace
3996  do
3997  {
3998  get();
3999  }
4000  while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
4001 
4002  switch (current)
4003  {
4004  // structural characters
4005  case '[':
4006  return token_type::begin_array;
4007  case ']':
4008  return token_type::end_array;
4009  case '{':
4010  return token_type::begin_object;
4011  case '}':
4012  return token_type::end_object;
4013  case ':':
4014  return token_type::name_separator;
4015  case ',':
4016  return token_type::value_separator;
4017 
4018  // literals
4019  case 't':
4020  return scan_literal("true", 4, token_type::literal_true);
4021  case 'f':
4022  return scan_literal("false", 5, token_type::literal_false);
4023  case 'n':
4024  return scan_literal("null", 4, token_type::literal_null);
4025 
4026  // string
4027  case '\"':
4028  return scan_string();
4029 
4030  // number
4031  case '-':
4032  case '0':
4033  case '1':
4034  case '2':
4035  case '3':
4036  case '4':
4037  case '5':
4038  case '6':
4039  case '7':
4040  case '8':
4041  case '9':
4042  return scan_number();
4043 
4044  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
4045  // string literals)
4046  case '\0':
4047  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
4048  return token_type::end_of_input;
4049 
4050  // error
4051  default:
4052  error_message = "invalid literal";
4053  return token_type::parse_error;
4054  }
4055  }
4056 
4057  private:
4058  /// input adapter
4059  detail::input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
4060 
4061  /// the current character
4062  std::char_traits<char>::int_type current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
4063 
4064  /// whether the next get() call should just return current
4065  bool next_unget = false;
4066 
4067  /// the start position of the current token
4068  position_t position;
4069 
4070  /// raw input token string (for error messages)
4071  std::vector<char> token_string {};
4072 
4073  /// buffer for variable-length tokens (numbers, strings)
4074  string_t token_buffer {};
4075 
4076  /// a description of occurred lexer errors
4077  const char* error_message = "";
4078 
4079  // number values
4080  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
4081  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
4082  number_float_t value_float = 0;
4083 
4084  /// the decimal point
4085  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
4086 };
4087 } // namespace detail
4088 } // namespace nlohmann
4089 
4090 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/parser.hpp>
4091 
4092 
4093 #include <cassert> // assert
4094 #include <cmath> // isfinite
4095 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
4096 #include <functional> // function
4097 #include <string> // string
4098 #include <utility> // move
4099 
4100 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
4101 
4102 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
4103 
4104 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/is_sax.hpp>
4105 
4106 
4107 #include <cstdint> // size_t
4108 #include <utility> // declval
4109 
4110 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/detected.hpp>
4111 
4112 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
4113 
4114 
4115 namespace nlohmann
4116 {
4117 namespace detail
4118 {
4119 template <typename T>
4120 using null_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().null());
4121 
4122 template <typename T>
4123 using boolean_function_t =
4124  decltype(std::declval<T&>().boolean(std::declval<bool>()));
4125 
4126 template <typename T, typename Integer>
4127 using number_integer_function_t =
4128  decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_integer(std::declval<Integer>()));
4129 
4130 template <typename T, typename Unsigned>
4131 using number_unsigned_function_t =
4132  decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_unsigned(std::declval<Unsigned>()));
4133 
4134 template <typename T, typename Float, typename String>
4135 using number_float_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().number_float(
4136  std::declval<Float>(), std::declval<const String&>()));
4137 
4138 template <typename T, typename String>
4139 using string_function_t =
4140  decltype(std::declval<T&>().string(std::declval<String&>()));
4141 
4142 template <typename T>
4143 using start_object_function_t =
4144  decltype(std::declval<T&>().start_object(std::declval<std::size_t>()));
4145 
4146 template <typename T, typename String>
4147 using key_function_t =
4148  decltype(std::declval<T&>().key(std::declval<String&>()));
4149 
4150 template <typename T>
4151 using end_object_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().end_object());
4152 
4153 template <typename T>
4154 using start_array_function_t =
4155  decltype(std::declval<T&>().start_array(std::declval<std::size_t>()));
4156 
4157 template <typename T>
4158 using end_array_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().end_array());
4159 
4160 template <typename T, typename Exception>
4161 using parse_error_function_t = decltype(std::declval<T&>().parse_error(
4162  std::declval<std::size_t>(), std::declval<const std::string&>(),
4163  std::declval<const Exception&>()));
4164 
4165 template <typename SAX, typename BasicJsonType>
4166 struct is_sax
4167 {
4168  private:
4169  static_assert(is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value,
4170  "BasicJsonType must be of type basic_json<...>");
4171 
4172  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4173  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4174  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4175  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4176  using exception_t = typename BasicJsonType::exception;
4177 
4178  public:
4179  static constexpr bool value =
4180  is_detected_exact<bool, null_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4181  is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4182  is_detected_exact<bool, number_integer_function_t, SAX,
4183  number_integer_t>::value &&
4184  is_detected_exact<bool, number_unsigned_function_t, SAX,
4185  number_unsigned_t>::value &&
4186  is_detected_exact<bool, number_float_function_t, SAX, number_float_t,
4187  string_t>::value &&
4188  is_detected_exact<bool, string_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value &&
4189  is_detected_exact<bool, start_object_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4190  is_detected_exact<bool, key_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value &&
4191  is_detected_exact<bool, end_object_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4192  is_detected_exact<bool, start_array_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4193  is_detected_exact<bool, end_array_function_t, SAX>::value &&
4194  is_detected_exact<bool, parse_error_function_t, SAX, exception_t>::value;
4195 };
4196 
4197 template <typename SAX, typename BasicJsonType>
4198 struct is_sax_static_asserts
4199 {
4200  private:
4201  static_assert(is_basic_json<BasicJsonType>::value,
4202  "BasicJsonType must be of type basic_json<...>");
4203 
4204  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4205  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4206  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4207  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4208  using exception_t = typename BasicJsonType::exception;
4209 
4210  public:
4211  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, null_function_t, SAX>::value,
4212  "Missing/invalid function: bool null()");
4213  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value,
4214  "Missing/invalid function: bool boolean(bool)");
4215  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, boolean_function_t, SAX>::value,
4216  "Missing/invalid function: bool boolean(bool)");
4217  static_assert(
4218  is_detected_exact<bool, number_integer_function_t, SAX,
4219  number_integer_t>::value,
4220  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_integer(number_integer_t)");
4221  static_assert(
4222  is_detected_exact<bool, number_unsigned_function_t, SAX,
4223  number_unsigned_t>::value,
4224  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t)");
4225  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, number_float_function_t, SAX,
4226  number_float_t, string_t>::value,
4227  "Missing/invalid function: bool number_float(number_float_t, const string_t&)");
4228  static_assert(
4229  is_detected_exact<bool, string_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value,
4230  "Missing/invalid function: bool string(string_t&)");
4231  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, start_object_function_t, SAX>::value,
4232  "Missing/invalid function: bool start_object(std::size_t)");
4233  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, key_function_t, SAX, string_t>::value,
4234  "Missing/invalid function: bool key(string_t&)");
4235  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, end_object_function_t, SAX>::value,
4236  "Missing/invalid function: bool end_object()");
4237  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, start_array_function_t, SAX>::value,
4238  "Missing/invalid function: bool start_array(std::size_t)");
4239  static_assert(is_detected_exact<bool, end_array_function_t, SAX>::value,
4240  "Missing/invalid function: bool end_array()");
4241  static_assert(
4242  is_detected_exact<bool, parse_error_function_t, SAX, exception_t>::value,
4243  "Missing/invalid function: bool parse_error(std::size_t, const "
4244  "std::string&, const exception&)");
4245 };
4246 } // namespace detail
4247 } // namespace nlohmann
4248 
4249 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
4250 
4251 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/json_sax.hpp>
4252 
4253 
4254 #include <cassert>
4255 #include <cstddef>
4256 #include <string>
4257 #include <vector>
4258 
4259 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
4260 
4261 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
4262 
4263 
4264 namespace nlohmann
4265 {
4266 
4267 /*!
4268 @brief SAX interface
4269 
4270 This class describes the SAX interface used by @ref nlohmann::json::sax_parse.
4271 Each function is called in different situations while the input is parsed. The
4272 boolean return value informs the parser whether to continue processing the
4273 input.
4274 */
4275 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4276 struct json_sax
4277 {
4278  /// type for (signed) integers
4279  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4280  /// type for unsigned integers
4281  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4282  /// type for floating-point numbers
4283  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4284  /// type for strings
4285  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4286 
4287  /*!
4288  @brief a null value was read
4289  @return whether parsing should proceed
4290  */
4291  virtual bool null() = 0;
4292 
4293  /*!
4294  @brief a boolean value was read
4295  @param[in] val boolean value
4296  @return whether parsing should proceed
4297  */
4298  virtual bool boolean(bool val) = 0;
4299 
4300  /*!
4301  @brief an integer number was read
4302  @param[in] val integer value
4303  @return whether parsing should proceed
4304  */
4305  virtual bool number_integer(number_integer_t val) = 0;
4306 
4307  /*!
4308  @brief an unsigned integer number was read
4309  @param[in] val unsigned integer value
4310  @return whether parsing should proceed
4311  */
4312  virtual bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val) = 0;
4313 
4314  /*!
4315  @brief an floating-point number was read
4316  @param[in] val floating-point value
4317  @param[in] s raw token value
4318  @return whether parsing should proceed
4319  */
4320  virtual bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& s) = 0;
4321 
4322  /*!
4323  @brief a string was read
4324  @param[in] val string value
4325  @return whether parsing should proceed
4326  @note It is safe to move the passed string.
4327  */
4328  virtual bool string(string_t& val) = 0;
4329 
4330  /*!
4331  @brief the beginning of an object was read
4332  @param[in] elements number of object elements or -1 if unknown
4333  @return whether parsing should proceed
4334  @note binary formats may report the number of elements
4335  */
4336  virtual bool start_object(std::size_t elements) = 0;
4337 
4338  /*!
4339  @brief an object key was read
4340  @param[in] val object key
4341  @return whether parsing should proceed
4342  @note It is safe to move the passed string.
4343  */
4344  virtual bool key(string_t& val) = 0;
4345 
4346  /*!
4347  @brief the end of an object was read
4348  @return whether parsing should proceed
4349  */
4350  virtual bool end_object() = 0;
4351 
4352  /*!
4353  @brief the beginning of an array was read
4354  @param[in] elements number of array elements or -1 if unknown
4355  @return whether parsing should proceed
4356  @note binary formats may report the number of elements
4357  */
4358  virtual bool start_array(std::size_t elements) = 0;
4359 
4360  /*!
4361  @brief the end of an array was read
4362  @return whether parsing should proceed
4363  */
4364  virtual bool end_array() = 0;
4365 
4366  /*!
4367  @brief a parse error occurred
4368  @param[in] position the position in the input where the error occurs
4369  @param[in] last_token the last read token
4370  @param[in] ex an exception object describing the error
4371  @return whether parsing should proceed (must return false)
4372  */
4373  virtual bool parse_error(std::size_t position,
4374  const std::string& last_token,
4375  const detail::exception& ex) = 0;
4376 
4377  virtual ~json_sax() = default;
4378 };
4379 
4380 
4381 namespace detail
4382 {
4383 /*!
4384 @brief SAX implementation to create a JSON value from SAX events
4385 
4386 This class implements the @ref json_sax interface and processes the SAX events
4387 to create a JSON value which makes it basically a DOM parser. The structure or
4388 hierarchy of the JSON value is managed by the stack `ref_stack` which contains
4389 a pointer to the respective array or object for each recursion depth.
4390 
4391 After successful parsing, the value that is passed by reference to the
4392 constructor contains the parsed value.
4393 
4394 @tparam BasicJsonType the JSON type
4395 */
4396 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4397 class json_sax_dom_parser
4398 {
4399  public:
4400  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4401  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4402  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4403  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4404 
4405  /*!
4406  @param[in, out] r reference to a JSON value that is manipulated while
4407  parsing
4408  @param[in] allow_exceptions_ whether parse errors yield exceptions
4409  */
4410  explicit json_sax_dom_parser(BasicJsonType& r, const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
4411  : root(r), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
4412  {}
4413 
4414  bool null()
4415  {
4416  handle_value(nullptr);
4417  return true;
4418  }
4419 
4420  bool boolean(bool val)
4421  {
4422  handle_value(val);
4423  return true;
4424  }
4425 
4426  bool number_integer(number_integer_t val)
4427  {
4428  handle_value(val);
4429  return true;
4430  }
4431 
4432  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val)
4433  {
4434  handle_value(val);
4435  return true;
4436  }
4437 
4438  bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4439  {
4440  handle_value(val);
4441  return true;
4442  }
4443 
4444  bool string(string_t& val)
4445  {
4446  handle_value(val);
4447  return true;
4448  }
4449 
4450  bool start_object(std::size_t len)
4451  {
4452  ref_stack.push_back(handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::object));
4453 
4454  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4455  {
4456  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4457  "excessive object size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4458  }
4459 
4460  return true;
4461  }
4462 
4463  bool key(string_t& val)
4464  {
4465  // add null at given key and store the reference for later
4466  object_element = &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.object->operator[](val));
4467  return true;
4468  }
4469 
4470  bool end_object()
4471  {
4472  ref_stack.pop_back();
4473  return true;
4474  }
4475 
4476  bool start_array(std::size_t len)
4477  {
4478  ref_stack.push_back(handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::array));
4479 
4480  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4481  {
4482  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4483  "excessive array size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4484  }
4485 
4486  return true;
4487  }
4488 
4489  bool end_array()
4490  {
4491  ref_stack.pop_back();
4492  return true;
4493  }
4494 
4495  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/,
4496  const detail::exception& ex)
4497  {
4498  errored = true;
4499  if (allow_exceptions)
4500  {
4501  // determine the proper exception type from the id
4502  switch ((ex.id / 100) % 100)
4503  {
4504  case 1:
4505  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::parse_error*>(&ex));
4506  case 4:
4507  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::out_of_range*>(&ex));
4508  // LCOV_EXCL_START
4509  case 2:
4510  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::invalid_iterator*>(&ex));
4511  case 3:
4512  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::type_error*>(&ex));
4513  case 5:
4514  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::other_error*>(&ex));
4515  default:
4516  assert(false);
4517  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
4518  }
4519  }
4520  return false;
4521  }
4522 
4523  constexpr bool is_errored() const
4524  {
4525  return errored;
4526  }
4527 
4528  private:
4529  /*!
4530  @invariant If the ref stack is empty, then the passed value will be the new
4531  root.
4532  @invariant If the ref stack contains a value, then it is an array or an
4533  object to which we can add elements
4534  */
4535  template<typename Value>
4536  BasicJsonType* handle_value(Value&& v)
4537  {
4538  if (ref_stack.empty())
4539  {
4540  root = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4541  return &root;
4542  }
4543 
4544  assert(ref_stack.back()->is_array() or ref_stack.back()->is_object());
4545 
4546  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4547  {
4548  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Value>(v));
4549  return &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->back());
4550  }
4551  else
4552  {
4553  assert(object_element);
4554  *object_element = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4555  return object_element;
4556  }
4557  }
4558 
4559  /// the parsed JSON value
4560  BasicJsonType& root;
4561  /// stack to model hierarchy of values
4562  std::vector<BasicJsonType*> ref_stack;
4563  /// helper to hold the reference for the next object element
4564  BasicJsonType* object_element = nullptr;
4565  /// whether a syntax error occurred
4566  bool errored = false;
4567  /// whether to throw exceptions in case of errors
4568  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
4569 };
4570 
4571 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4572 class json_sax_dom_callback_parser
4573 {
4574  public:
4575  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4576  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4577  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4578  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4579  using parser_callback_t = typename BasicJsonType::parser_callback_t;
4580  using parse_event_t = typename BasicJsonType::parse_event_t;
4581 
4582  json_sax_dom_callback_parser(BasicJsonType& r,
4583  const parser_callback_t cb,
4584  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
4585  : root(r), callback(cb), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
4586  {
4587  keep_stack.push_back(true);
4588  }
4589 
4590  bool null()
4591  {
4592  handle_value(nullptr);
4593  return true;
4594  }
4595 
4596  bool boolean(bool val)
4597  {
4598  handle_value(val);
4599  return true;
4600  }
4601 
4602  bool number_integer(number_integer_t val)
4603  {
4604  handle_value(val);
4605  return true;
4606  }
4607 
4608  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t val)
4609  {
4610  handle_value(val);
4611  return true;
4612  }
4613 
4614  bool number_float(number_float_t val, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4615  {
4616  handle_value(val);
4617  return true;
4618  }
4619 
4620  bool string(string_t& val)
4621  {
4622  handle_value(val);
4623  return true;
4624  }
4625 
4626  bool start_object(std::size_t len)
4627  {
4628  // check callback for object start
4629  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::object_start, discarded);
4630  keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4631 
4632  auto val = handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::object, true);
4633  ref_stack.push_back(val.second);
4634 
4635  // check object limit
4636  if (ref_stack.back())
4637  {
4638  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4639  {
4640  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4641  "excessive object size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4642  }
4643  }
4644 
4645  return true;
4646  }
4647 
4648  bool key(string_t& val)
4649  {
4650  BasicJsonType k = BasicJsonType(val);
4651 
4652  // check callback for key
4653  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::key, k);
4654  key_keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4655 
4656  // add discarded value at given key and store the reference for later
4657  if (keep and ref_stack.back())
4658  {
4659  object_element = &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.object->operator[](val) = discarded);
4660  }
4661 
4662  return true;
4663  }
4664 
4665  bool end_object()
4666  {
4667  if (ref_stack.back())
4668  {
4669  if (not callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()) - 1, parse_event_t::object_end, *ref_stack.back()))
4670  {
4671  // discard object
4672  *ref_stack.back() = discarded;
4673  }
4674  }
4675 
4676  assert(not ref_stack.empty());
4677  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4678  ref_stack.pop_back();
4679  keep_stack.pop_back();
4680 
4681  if (not ref_stack.empty() and ref_stack.back())
4682  {
4683  // remove discarded value
4684  if (ref_stack.back()->is_object())
4685  {
4686  for (auto it = ref_stack.back()->begin(); it != ref_stack.back()->end(); ++it)
4687  {
4688  if (it->is_discarded())
4689  {
4690  ref_stack.back()->erase(it);
4691  break;
4692  }
4693  }
4694  }
4695  }
4696 
4697  return true;
4698  }
4699 
4700  bool start_array(std::size_t len)
4701  {
4702  const bool keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::array_start, discarded);
4703  keep_stack.push_back(keep);
4704 
4705  auto val = handle_value(BasicJsonType::value_t::array, true);
4706  ref_stack.push_back(val.second);
4707 
4708  // check array limit
4709  if (ref_stack.back())
4710  {
4711  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len != std::size_t(-1) and len > ref_stack.back()->max_size()))
4712  {
4713  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(408,
4714  "excessive array size: " + std::to_string(len)));
4715  }
4716  }
4717 
4718  return true;
4719  }
4720 
4721  bool end_array()
4722  {
4723  bool keep = true;
4724 
4725  if (ref_stack.back())
4726  {
4727  keep = callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()) - 1, parse_event_t::array_end, *ref_stack.back());
4728  if (not keep)
4729  {
4730  // discard array
4731  *ref_stack.back() = discarded;
4732  }
4733  }
4734 
4735  assert(not ref_stack.empty());
4736  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4737  ref_stack.pop_back();
4738  keep_stack.pop_back();
4739 
4740  // remove discarded value
