4741  if (not keep and not ref_stack.empty())
4742  {
4743  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4744  {
4745  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->pop_back();
4746  }
4747  }
4748 
4749  return true;
4750  }
4751 
4752  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/,
4753  const detail::exception& ex)
4754  {
4755  errored = true;
4756  if (allow_exceptions)
4757  {
4758  // determine the proper exception type from the id
4759  switch ((ex.id / 100) % 100)
4760  {
4761  case 1:
4762  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::parse_error*>(&ex));
4763  case 4:
4764  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::out_of_range*>(&ex));
4765  // LCOV_EXCL_START
4766  case 2:
4767  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::invalid_iterator*>(&ex));
4768  case 3:
4769  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::type_error*>(&ex));
4770  case 5:
4771  JSON_THROW(*reinterpret_cast<const detail::other_error*>(&ex));
4772  default:
4773  assert(false);
4774  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
4775  }
4776  }
4777  return false;
4778  }
4779 
4780  constexpr bool is_errored() const
4781  {
4782  return errored;
4783  }
4784 
4785  private:
4786  /*!
4787  @param[in] v value to add to the JSON value we build during parsing
4788  @param[in] skip_callback whether we should skip calling the callback
4789  function; this is required after start_array() and
4790  start_object() SAX events, because otherwise we would call the
4791  callback function with an empty array or object, respectively.
4792 
4793  @invariant If the ref stack is empty, then the passed value will be the new
4794  root.
4795  @invariant If the ref stack contains a value, then it is an array or an
4796  object to which we can add elements
4797 
4798  @return pair of boolean (whether value should be kept) and pointer (to the
4799  passed value in the ref_stack hierarchy; nullptr if not kept)
4800  */
4801  template<typename Value>
4802  std::pair<bool, BasicJsonType*> handle_value(Value&& v, const bool skip_callback = false)
4803  {
4804  assert(not keep_stack.empty());
4805 
4806  // do not handle this value if we know it would be added to a discarded
4807  // container
4808  if (not keep_stack.back())
4809  {
4810  return {false, nullptr};
4811  }
4812 
4813  // create value
4814  auto value = BasicJsonType(std::forward<Value>(v));
4815 
4816  // check callback
4817  const bool keep = skip_callback or callback(static_cast<int>(ref_stack.size()), parse_event_t::value, value);
4818 
4819  // do not handle this value if we just learnt it shall be discarded
4820  if (not keep)
4821  {
4822  return {false, nullptr};
4823  }
4824 
4825  if (ref_stack.empty())
4826  {
4827  root = std::move(value);
4828  return {true, &root};
4829  }
4830 
4831  // skip this value if we already decided to skip the parent
4832  // (https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/971#issuecomment-413678360)
4833  if (not ref_stack.back())
4834  {
4835  return {false, nullptr};
4836  }
4837 
4838  // we now only expect arrays and objects
4839  assert(ref_stack.back()->is_array() or ref_stack.back()->is_object());
4840 
4841  if (ref_stack.back()->is_array())
4842  {
4843  ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->push_back(std::move(value));
4844  return {true, &(ref_stack.back()->m_value.array->back())};
4845  }
4846  else
4847  {
4848  // check if we should store an element for the current key
4849  assert(not key_keep_stack.empty());
4850  const bool store_element = key_keep_stack.back();
4851  key_keep_stack.pop_back();
4852 
4853  if (not store_element)
4854  {
4855  return {false, nullptr};
4856  }
4857 
4858  assert(object_element);
4859  *object_element = std::move(value);
4860  return {true, object_element};
4861  }
4862  }
4863 
4864  /// the parsed JSON value
4865  BasicJsonType& root;
4866  /// stack to model hierarchy of values
4867  std::vector<BasicJsonType*> ref_stack;
4868  /// stack to manage which values to keep
4869  std::vector<bool> keep_stack;
4870  /// stack to manage which object keys to keep
4871  std::vector<bool> key_keep_stack;
4872  /// helper to hold the reference for the next object element
4873  BasicJsonType* object_element = nullptr;
4874  /// whether a syntax error occurred
4875  bool errored = false;
4876  /// callback function
4877  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
4878  /// whether to throw exceptions in case of errors
4879  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
4880  /// a discarded value for the callback
4881  BasicJsonType discarded = BasicJsonType::value_t::discarded;
4882 };
4883 
4884 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4885 class json_sax_acceptor
4886 {
4887  public:
4888  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4889  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4890  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4891  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4892 
4893  bool null()
4894  {
4895  return true;
4896  }
4897 
4898  bool boolean(bool /*unused*/)
4899  {
4900  return true;
4901  }
4902 
4903  bool number_integer(number_integer_t /*unused*/)
4904  {
4905  return true;
4906  }
4907 
4908  bool number_unsigned(number_unsigned_t /*unused*/)
4909  {
4910  return true;
4911  }
4912 
4913  bool number_float(number_float_t /*unused*/, const string_t& /*unused*/)
4914  {
4915  return true;
4916  }
4917 
4918  bool string(string_t& /*unused*/)
4919  {
4920  return true;
4921  }
4922 
4923  bool start_object(std::size_t /*unused*/ = std::size_t(-1))
4924  {
4925  return true;
4926  }
4927 
4928  bool key(string_t& /*unused*/)
4929  {
4930  return true;
4931  }
4932 
4933  bool end_object()
4934  {
4935  return true;
4936  }
4937 
4938  bool start_array(std::size_t /*unused*/ = std::size_t(-1))
4939  {
4940  return true;
4941  }
4942 
4943  bool end_array()
4944  {
4945  return true;
4946  }
4947 
4948  bool parse_error(std::size_t /*unused*/, const std::string& /*unused*/, const detail::exception& /*unused*/)
4949  {
4950  return false;
4951  }
4952 };
4953 } // namespace detail
4954 
4955 } // namespace nlohmann
4956 
4957 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/lexer.hpp>
4958 
4959 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
4960 
4961 
4962 namespace nlohmann
4963 {
4964 namespace detail
4965 {
4966 ////////////
4967 // parser //
4968 ////////////
4969 
4970 /*!
4971 @brief syntax analysis
4972 
4973 This class implements a recursive decent parser.
4974 */
4975 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4976 class parser
4977 {
4978  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4979  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4980  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
4981  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
4982  using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
4983  using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
4984 
4985  public:
4986  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
4987  {
4988  /// the parser read `{` and started to process a JSON object
4989  object_start,
4990  /// the parser read `}` and finished processing a JSON object
4991  object_end,
4992  /// the parser read `[` and started to process a JSON array
4993  array_start,
4994  /// the parser read `]` and finished processing a JSON array
4995  array_end,
4996  /// the parser read a key of a value in an object
4997  key,
4998  /// the parser finished reading a JSON value
4999  value
5000  };
5001 
5002  using parser_callback_t =
5003  std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
5004 
5005  /// a parser reading from an input adapter
5006  explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t&& adapter,
5007  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
5008  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
5009  : callback(cb), m_lexer(std::move(adapter)), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
5010  {
5011  // read first token
5012  get_token();
5013  }
5014 
5015  /*!
5016  @brief public parser interface
5017 
5018  @param[in] strict whether to expect the last token to be EOF
5019  @param[in,out] result parsed JSON value
5020 
5021  @throw parse_error.101 in case of an unexpected token
5022  @throw parse_error.102 if to_unicode fails or surrogate error
5023  @throw parse_error.103 if to_unicode fails
5024  */
5025  void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
5026  {
5027  if (callback)
5028  {
5029  json_sax_dom_callback_parser<BasicJsonType> sdp(result, callback, allow_exceptions);
5030  sax_parse_internal(&sdp);
5031  result.assert_invariant();
5032 
5033  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
5034  if (strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
5035  {
5036  sdp.parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5037  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5038  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5039  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
5040  }
5041 
5042  // in case of an error, return discarded value
5043  if (sdp.is_errored())
5044  {
5045  result = value_t::discarded;
5046  return;
5047  }
5048 
5049  // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
5050  // function
5051  if (result.is_discarded())
5052  {
5053  result = nullptr;
5054  }
5055  }
5056  else
5057  {
5058  json_sax_dom_parser<BasicJsonType> sdp(result, allow_exceptions);
5059  sax_parse_internal(&sdp);
5060  result.assert_invariant();
5061 
5062  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
5063  if (strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
5064  {
5065  sdp.parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5066  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5067  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5068  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
5069  }
5070 
5071  // in case of an error, return discarded value
5072  if (sdp.is_errored())
5073  {
5074  result = value_t::discarded;
5075  return;
5076  }
5077  }
5078  }
5079 
5080  /*!
5081  @brief public accept interface
5082 
5083  @param[in] strict whether to expect the last token to be EOF
5084  @return whether the input is a proper JSON text
5085  */
5086  bool accept(const bool strict = true)
5087  {
5088  json_sax_acceptor<BasicJsonType> sax_acceptor;
5089  return sax_parse(&sax_acceptor, strict);
5090  }
5091 
5092  template <typename SAX>
5093  bool sax_parse(SAX* sax, const bool strict = true)
5094  {
5095  (void)detail::is_sax_static_asserts<SAX, BasicJsonType> {};
5096  const bool result = sax_parse_internal(sax);
5097 
5098  // strict mode: next byte must be EOF
5099  if (result and strict and (get_token() != token_type::end_of_input))
5100  {
5101  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5102  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5103  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5104  exception_message(token_type::end_of_input, "value")));
5105  }
5106 
5107  return result;
5108  }
5109 
5110  private:
5111  template <typename SAX>
5112  bool sax_parse_internal(SAX* sax)
5113  {
5114  // stack to remember the hierarchy of structured values we are parsing
5115  // true = array; false = object
5116  std::vector<bool> states;
5117  // value to avoid a goto (see comment where set to true)
5118  bool skip_to_state_evaluation = false;
5119 
5120  while (true)
5121  {
5122  if (not skip_to_state_evaluation)
5123  {
5124  // invariant: get_token() was called before each iteration
5125  switch (last_token)
5126  {
5127  case token_type::begin_object:
5128  {
5129  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
5130  {
5131  return false;
5132  }
5133 
5134  // closing } -> we are done
5135  if (get_token() == token_type::end_object)
5136  {
5137  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_object()))
5138  {
5139  return false;
5140  }
5141  break;
5142  }
5143 
5144  // parse key
5145  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(last_token != token_type::value_string))
5146  {
5147  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5148  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5149  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5150  exception_message(token_type::value_string, "object key")));
5151  }
5152  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->key(m_lexer.get_string())))
5153  {
5154  return false;
5155  }
5156 
5157  // parse separator (:)
5158  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::name_separator))
5159  {
5160  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5161  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5162  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5163  exception_message(token_type::name_separator, "object separator")));
5164  }
5165 
5166  // remember we are now inside an object
5167  states.push_back(false);
5168 
5169  // parse values
5170  get_token();
5171  continue;
5172  }
5173 
5174  case token_type::begin_array:
5175  {
5176  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
5177  {
5178  return false;
5179  }
5180 
5181  // closing ] -> we are done
5182  if (get_token() == token_type::end_array)
5183  {
5184  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_array()))
5185  {
5186  return false;
5187  }
5188  break;
5189  }
5190 
5191  // remember we are now inside an array
5192  states.push_back(true);
5193 
5194  // parse values (no need to call get_token)
5195  continue;
5196  }
5197 
5198  case token_type::value_float:
5199  {
5200  const auto res = m_lexer.get_number_float();
5201 
5202  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(res)))
5203  {
5204  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5205  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5206  out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" + m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
5207  }
5208  else
5209  {
5210  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_float(res, m_lexer.get_string())))
5211  {
5212  return false;
5213  }
5214  break;
5215  }
5216  }
5217 
5218  case token_type::literal_false:
5219  {
5220  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->boolean(false)))
5221  {
5222  return false;
5223  }
5224  break;
5225  }
5226 
5227  case token_type::literal_null:
5228  {
5229  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->null()))
5230  {
5231  return false;
5232  }
5233  break;
5234  }
5235 
5236  case token_type::literal_true:
5237  {
5238  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->boolean(true)))
5239  {
5240  return false;
5241  }
5242  break;
5243  }
5244 
5245  case token_type::value_integer:
5246  {
5247  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_integer(m_lexer.get_number_integer())))
5248  {
5249  return false;
5250  }
5251  break;
5252  }
5253 
5254  case token_type::value_string:
5255  {
5256  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->string(m_lexer.get_string())))
5257  {
5258  return false;
5259  }
5260  break;
5261  }
5262 
5263  case token_type::value_unsigned:
5264  {
5265  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->number_unsigned(m_lexer.get_number_unsigned())))
5266  {
5267  return false;
5268  }
5269  break;
5270  }
5271 
5272  case token_type::parse_error:
5273  {
5274  // using "uninitialized" to avoid "expected" message
5275  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5276  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5277  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5278  exception_message(token_type::uninitialized, "value")));
5279  }
5280 
5281  default: // the last token was unexpected
5282  {
5283  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5284  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5285  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5286  exception_message(token_type::literal_or_value, "value")));
5287  }
5288  }
5289  }
5290  else
5291  {
5292  skip_to_state_evaluation = false;
5293  }
5294 
5295  // we reached this line after we successfully parsed a value
5296  if (states.empty())
5297  {
5298  // empty stack: we reached the end of the hierarchy: done
5299  return true;
5300  }
5301  else
5302  {
5303  if (states.back()) // array
5304  {
5305  // comma -> next value
5306  if (get_token() == token_type::value_separator)
5307  {
5308  // parse a new value
5309  get_token();
5310  continue;
5311  }
5312 
5313  // closing ]
5314  if (JSON_LIKELY(last_token == token_type::end_array))
5315  {
5316  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_array()))
5317  {
5318  return false;
5319  }
5320 
5321  // We are done with this array. Before we can parse a
5322  // new value, we need to evaluate the new state first.
5323  // By setting skip_to_state_evaluation to false, we
5324  // are effectively jumping to the beginning of this if.
5325  assert(not states.empty());
5326  states.pop_back();
5327  skip_to_state_evaluation = true;
5328  continue;
5329  }
5330  else
5331  {
5332  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5333  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5334  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5335  exception_message(token_type::end_array, "array")));
5336  }
5337  }
5338  else // object
5339  {
5340  // comma -> next value
5341  if (get_token() == token_type::value_separator)
5342  {
5343  // parse key
5344  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::value_string))
5345  {
5346  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5347  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5348  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5349  exception_message(token_type::value_string, "object key")));
5350  }
5351  else
5352  {
5353  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->key(m_lexer.get_string())))
5354  {
5355  return false;
5356  }
5357  }
5358 
5359  // parse separator (:)
5360  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get_token() != token_type::name_separator))
5361  {
5362  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5363  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5364  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5365  exception_message(token_type::name_separator, "object separator")));
5366  }
5367 
5368  // parse values
5369  get_token();
5370  continue;
5371  }
5372 
5373  // closing }
5374  if (JSON_LIKELY(last_token == token_type::end_object))
5375  {
5376  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->end_object()))
5377  {
5378  return false;
5379  }
5380 
5381  // We are done with this object. Before we can parse a
5382  // new value, we need to evaluate the new state first.
5383  // By setting skip_to_state_evaluation to false, we
5384  // are effectively jumping to the beginning of this if.
5385  assert(not states.empty());
5386  states.pop_back();
5387  skip_to_state_evaluation = true;
5388  continue;
5389  }
5390  else
5391  {
5392  return sax->parse_error(m_lexer.get_position(),
5393  m_lexer.get_token_string(),
5394  parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(),
5395  exception_message(token_type::end_object, "object")));
5396  }
5397  }
5398  }
5399  }
5400  }
5401 
5402  /// get next token from lexer
5403  token_type get_token()
5404  {
5405  return (last_token = m_lexer.scan());
5406  }
5407 
5408  std::string exception_message(const token_type expected, const std::string& context)
5409  {
5410  std::string error_msg = "syntax error ";
5411 
5412  if (not context.empty())
5413  {
5414  error_msg += "while parsing " + context + " ";
5415  }
5416 
5417  error_msg += "- ";
5418 
5419  if (last_token == token_type::parse_error)
5420  {
5421  error_msg += std::string(m_lexer.get_error_message()) + "; last read: '" +
5422  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
5423  }
5424  else
5425  {
5426  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(last_token));
5427  }
5428 
5429  if (expected != token_type::uninitialized)
5430  {
5431  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(expected));
5432  }
5433 
5434  return error_msg;
5435  }
5436 
5437  private:
5438  /// callback function
5439  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
5440  /// the type of the last read token
5441  token_type last_token = token_type::uninitialized;
5442  /// the lexer
5443  lexer_t m_lexer;
5444  /// whether to throw exceptions in case of errors
5445  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
5446 };
5447 } // namespace detail
5448 } // namespace nlohmann
5449 
5450 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5451 
5452 
5453 #include <cstddef> // ptrdiff_t
5454 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
5455 
5456 namespace nlohmann
5457 {
5458 namespace detail
5459 {
5460 /*
5461 @brief an iterator for primitive JSON types
5462 
5463 This class models an iterator for primitive JSON types (boolean, number,
5464 string). It's only purpose is to allow the iterator/const_iterator classes
5465 to "iterate" over primitive values. Internally, the iterator is modeled by
5466 a `difference_type` variable. Value begin_value (`0`) models the begin,
5467 end_value (`1`) models past the end.
5468 */
5469 class primitive_iterator_t
5470 {
5471  private:
5472  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
5473  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
5474  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
5475 
5476  /// iterator as signed integer type
5477  difference_type m_it = (std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::min)();
5478 
5479  public:
5480  constexpr difference_type get_value() const noexcept
5481  {
5482  return m_it;
5483  }
5484 
5485  /// set iterator to a defined beginning
5486  void set_begin() noexcept
5487  {
5488  m_it = begin_value;
5489  }
5490 
5491  /// set iterator to a defined past the end
5492  void set_end() noexcept
5493  {
5494  m_it = end_value;
5495  }
5496 
5497  /// return whether the iterator can be dereferenced
5498  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
5499  {
5500  return m_it == begin_value;
5501  }
5502 
5503  /// return whether the iterator is at end
5504  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
5505  {
5506  return m_it == end_value;
5507  }
5508 
5509  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5510  {
5511  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
5512  }
5513 
5514  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5515  {
5516  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
5517  }
5518 
5519  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type n) noexcept
5520  {
5521  auto result = *this;
5522  result += n;
5523  return result;
5524  }
5525 
5526  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
5527  {
5528  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
5529  }
5530 
5531  primitive_iterator_t& operator++() noexcept
5532  {
5533  ++m_it;
5534  return *this;
5535  }
5536 
5537  primitive_iterator_t const operator++(int) noexcept
5538  {
5539  auto result = *this;
5540  ++m_it;
5541  return result;
5542  }
5543 
5544  primitive_iterator_t& operator--() noexcept
5545  {
5546  --m_it;
5547  return *this;
5548  }
5549 
5550  primitive_iterator_t const operator--(int) noexcept
5551  {
5552  auto result = *this;
5553  --m_it;
5554  return result;
5555  }
5556 
5557  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n) noexcept
5558  {
5559  m_it += n;
5560  return *this;
5561  }
5562 
5563  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n) noexcept
5564  {
5565  m_it -= n;
5566  return *this;
5567  }
5568 };
5569 } // namespace detail
5570 } // namespace nlohmann
5571 
5572 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
5573 
5574 
5575 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5576 
5577 
5578 namespace nlohmann
5579 {
5580 namespace detail
5581 {
5582 /*!
5583 @brief an iterator value
5584 
5585 @note This structure could easily be a union, but MSVC currently does not allow
5586 unions members with complex constructors, see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/pull/105.
5587 */
5588 template<typename BasicJsonType> struct internal_iterator
5589 {
5590  /// iterator for JSON objects
5591  typename BasicJsonType::object_t::iterator object_iterator {};
5592  /// iterator for JSON arrays
5593  typename BasicJsonType::array_t::iterator array_iterator {};
5594  /// generic iterator for all other types
5595  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator {};
5596 };
5597 } // namespace detail
5598 } // namespace nlohmann
5599 
5600 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iter_impl.hpp>
5601 
5602 
5603 #include <ciso646> // not
5604 #include <iterator> // iterator, random_access_iterator_tag, bidirectional_iterator_tag, advance, next
5605 #include <type_traits> // conditional, is_const, remove_const
5606 
5607 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
5608 
5609 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/internal_iterator.hpp>
5610 
5611 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/primitive_iterator.hpp>
5612 
5613 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
5614 
5615 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/cpp_future.hpp>
5616 
5617 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/type_traits.hpp>
5618 
5619 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
5620 
5621 
5622 namespace nlohmann
5623 {
5624 namespace detail
5625 {
5626 // forward declare, to be able to friend it later on
5627 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy;
5628 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy_value;
5629 
5630 /*!
5631 @brief a template for a bidirectional iterator for the @ref basic_json class
5632 This class implements a both iterators (iterator and const_iterator) for the
5633 @ref basic_json class.
5634 @note An iterator is called *initialized* when a pointer to a JSON value has
5635  been set (e.g., by a constructor or a copy assignment). If the iterator is
5636  default-constructed, it is *uninitialized* and most methods are undefined.
5637  **The library uses assertions to detect calls on uninitialized iterators.**
5638 @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
5639 -
5640 [BidirectionalIterator](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/named_req/BidirectionalIterator):
5641  The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e.
5642  incremented and decremented).
5643 @since version 1.0.0, simplified in version 2.0.9, change to bidirectional
5644  iterators in version 3.0.0 (see https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/593)
5645 */
5646 template<typename BasicJsonType>
5647 class iter_impl
5648 {
5649  /// allow basic_json to access private members
5650  friend iter_impl<typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, const BasicJsonType>::type>;
5651  friend BasicJsonType;
5652  friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>;
5653  friend iteration_proxy_value<iter_impl>;
5654 
5655  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
5656  using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
5657  // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json
5658  static_assert(is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value,
5659  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
5660 
5661  public:
5662 
5663  /// The std::iterator class template (used as a base class to provide typedefs) is deprecated in C++17.
5664  /// The C++ Standard has never required user-defined iterators to derive from std::iterator.
5665  /// A user-defined iterator should provide publicly accessible typedefs named
5666  /// iterator_category, value_type, difference_type, pointer, and reference.
5667  /// Note that value_type is required to be non-const, even for constant iterators.
5668  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
5669 
5670  /// the type of the values when the iterator is dereferenced
5671  using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type;
5672  /// a type to represent differences between iterators
5673  using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type;
5674  /// defines a pointer to the type iterated over (value_type)
5675  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
5676  typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer,
5677  typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type;
5678  /// defines a reference to the type iterated over (value_type)
5679  using reference =
5680  typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
5681  typename BasicJsonType::const_reference,
5682  typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type;
5683 
5684  /// default constructor
5685  iter_impl() = default;
5686 
5687  /*!
5688  @brief constructor for a given JSON instance
5689  @param[in] object pointer to a JSON object for this iterator
5690  @pre object != nullptr
5691  @post The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5692  */
5693  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
5694  {
5695  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5696 
5697  switch (m_object->m_type)
5698  {
5699  case value_t::object:
5700  {
5701  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
5702  break;
5703  }
5704 
5705  case value_t::array:
5706  {
5707  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
5708  break;
5709  }
5710 
5711  default:
5712  {
5713  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
5714  break;
5715  }
5716  }
5717  }
5718 
5719  /*!
5720  @note The conventional copy constructor and copy assignment are implicitly
5721  defined. Combined with the following converting constructor and
5722  assignment, they support: (1) copy from iterator to iterator, (2)
5723  copy from const iterator to const iterator, and (3) conversion from
5724  iterator to const iterator. However conversion from const iterator
5725  to iterator is not defined.
5726  */
5727 
5728  /*!
5729  @brief converting constructor
5730  @param[in] other non-const iterator to copy from
5731  @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
5732  */
5733  iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
5734  : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {}
5735 
5736  /*!
5737  @brief converting assignment
5738  @param[in,out] other non-const iterator to copy from
5739  @return const/non-const iterator
5740  @note It is not checked whether @a other is initialized.
5741  */
5742  iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
5743  {
5744  m_object = other.m_object;
5745  m_it = other.m_it;
5746  return *this;
5747  }
5748 
5749  private:
5750  /*!
5751  @brief set the iterator to the first value
5752  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5753  */
5754  void set_begin() noexcept
5755  {
5756  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5757 
5758  switch (m_object->m_type)
5759  {
5760  case value_t::object:
5761  {
5762  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
5763  break;
5764  }
5765 
5766  case value_t::array:
5767  {
5768  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
5769  break;
5770  }
5771 
5772  case value_t::null:
5773  {
5774  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
5775  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
5776  break;
5777  }
5778 
5779  default:
5780  {
5781  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
5782  break;
5783  }
5784  }
5785  }
5786 
5787  /*!
5788  @brief set the iterator past the last value
5789  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5790  */
5791  void set_end() noexcept
5792  {
5793  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5794 
5795  switch (m_object->m_type)
5796  {
5797  case value_t::object:
5798  {
5799  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
5800  break;
5801  }
5802 
5803  case value_t::array:
5804  {
5805  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
5806  break;
5807  }
5808 
5809  default:
5810  {
5811  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
5812  break;
5813  }
5814  }
5815  }
5816 
5817  public:
5818  /*!
5819  @brief return a reference to the value pointed to by the iterator
5820  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5821  */
5822  reference operator*() const
5823  {
5824  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5825 
5826  switch (m_object->m_type)
5827  {
5828  case value_t::object:
5829  {
5830  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
5831  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
5832  }
5833 
5834  case value_t::array:
5835  {
5836  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
5837  return *m_it.array_iterator;
5838  }
5839 
5840  case value_t::null:
5841  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5842 
5843  default:
5844  {
5845  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
5846  {
5847  return *m_object;
5848  }
5849 
5850  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5851  }
5852  }
5853  }
5854 
5855  /*!
5856  @brief dereference the iterator
5857  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5858  */
5859  pointer operator->() const
5860  {
5861  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5862 
5863  switch (m_object->m_type)
5864  {
5865  case value_t::object:
5866  {
5867  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
5868  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
5869  }
5870 
5871  case value_t::array:
5872  {
5873  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
5874  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
5875  }
5876 
5877  default:
5878  {
5879  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
5880  {
5881  return m_object;
5882  }
5883 
5884  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
5885  }
5886  }
5887  }
5888 
5889  /*!
5890  @brief post-increment (it++)
5891  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5892  */
5893  iter_impl const operator++(int)
5894  {
5895  auto result = *this;
5896  ++(*this);
5897  return result;
5898  }
5899 
5900  /*!
5901  @brief pre-increment (++it)
5902  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5903  */
5904  iter_impl& operator++()
5905  {
5906  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5907 
5908  switch (m_object->m_type)
5909  {
5910  case value_t::object:
5911  {
5912  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
5913  break;
5914  }
5915 
5916  case value_t::array:
5917  {
5918  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
5919  break;
5920  }
5921 
5922  default:
5923  {
5924  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
5925  break;
5926  }
5927  }
5928 
5929  return *this;
5930  }
5931 
5932  /*!
5933  @brief post-decrement (it--)
5934  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5935  */
5936  iter_impl const operator--(int)
5937  {
5938  auto result = *this;
5939  --(*this);
5940  return result;
5941  }
5942 
5943  /*!
5944  @brief pre-decrement (--it)
5945  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5946  */
5947  iter_impl& operator--()
5948  {
5949  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5950 
5951  switch (m_object->m_type)
5952  {
5953  case value_t::object:
5954  {
5955  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
5956  break;
5957  }
5958 
5959  case value_t::array:
5960  {
5961  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
5962  break;
5963  }
5964 
5965  default:
5966  {
5967  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
5968  break;
5969  }
5970  }
5971 
5972  return *this;
5973  }
5974 
5975  /*!
5976  @brief comparison: equal
5977  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
5978  */
5979  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
5980  {
5981  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
5982  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
5983  {
5984  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
5985  }
5986 
5987  assert(m_object != nullptr);
5988 
5989  switch (m_object->m_type)
5990  {
5991  case value_t::object:
5992  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
5993 
5994  case value_t::array:
5995  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
5996 
5997  default:
5998  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
5999  }
6000  }
6001 
6002  /*!
6003  @brief comparison: not equal
6004  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6005  */
6006  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
6007  {
6008  return not operator==(other);
6009  }
6010 
6011  /*!
6012  @brief comparison: smaller
6013  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6014  */
6015  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const
6016  {
6017  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
6018  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
6019  {
6020  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
6021  }
6022 
6023  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6024 
6025  switch (m_object->m_type)
6026  {
6027  case value_t::object:
6028  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
6029 
6030  case value_t::array:
6031  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
6032 
6033  default:
6034  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
6035  }
6036  }
6037 
6038  /*!
6039  @brief comparison: less than or equal
6040  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6041  */
6042  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
6043  {
6044  return not other.operator < (*this);
6045  }
6046 
6047  /*!
6048  @brief comparison: greater than
6049  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6050  */
6051  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const
6052  {
6053  return not operator<=(other);
6054  }
6055 
6056  /*!
6057  @brief comparison: greater than or equal
6058  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6059  */
6060  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
6061  {
6062  return not operator<(other);
6063  }
6064 
6065  /*!
6066  @brief add to iterator
6067  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6068  */
6069  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
6070  {
6071  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6072 
6073  switch (m_object->m_type)
6074  {
6075  case value_t::object:
6076  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
6077 
6078  case value_t::array:
6079  {
6080  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
6081  break;
6082  }
6083 
6084  default:
6085  {
6086  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
6087  break;
6088  }
6089  }
6090 
6091  return *this;
6092  }
6093 
6094  /*!
6095  @brief subtract from iterator
6096  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6097  */
6098  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i)
6099  {
6100  return operator+=(-i);
6101  }
6102 
6103  /*!
6104  @brief add to iterator
6105  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6106  */
6107  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i) const
6108  {
6109  auto result = *this;
6110  result += i;
6111  return result;
6112  }
6113 
6114  /*!
6115  @brief addition of distance and iterator
6116  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6117  */
6118  friend iter_impl operator+(difference_type i, const iter_impl& it)
6119  {
6120  auto result = it;
6121  result += i;
6122  return result;
6123  }
6124 
6125  /*!
6126  @brief subtract from iterator
6127  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6128  */
6129  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i) const
6130  {
6131  auto result = *this;
6132  result -= i;
6133  return result;
6134  }
6135 
6136  /*!
6137  @brief return difference
6138  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6139  */
6140  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const
6141  {
6142  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6143 
6144  switch (m_object->m_type)
6145  {
6146  case value_t::object:
6147  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
6148 
6149  case value_t::array:
6150  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
6151 
6152  default:
6153  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
6154  }
6155  }
6156 
6157  /*!
6158  @brief access to successor
6159  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6160  */
6161  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
6162  {
6163  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6164 
6165  switch (m_object->m_type)
6166  {
6167  case value_t::object:
6168  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
6169 
6170  case value_t::array:
6171  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
6172 
6173  case value_t::null:
6174  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
6175 
6176  default:
6177  {
6178  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n))
6179  {
6180  return *m_object;
6181  }
6182 
6183  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
6184  }
6185  }
6186  }
6187 
6188  /*!
6189  @brief return the key of an object iterator
6190  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6191  */
6192  const typename object_t::key_type& key() const
6193  {
6194  assert(m_object != nullptr);
6195 
6196  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_object->is_object()))
6197  {
6198  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
6199  }
6200 
6201  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
6202  }
6203 
6204  /*!
6205  @brief return the value of an iterator
6206  @pre The iterator is initialized; i.e. `m_object != nullptr`.
6207  */
6208  reference value() const
6209  {
6210  return operator*();
6211  }
6212 
6213  private:
6214  /// associated JSON instance
6215  pointer m_object = nullptr;
6216  /// the actual iterator of the associated instance
6217  internal_iterator<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type> m_it;
6218 };
6219 } // namespace detail
6220 } // namespace nlohmann
6221 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/iteration_proxy.hpp>
6222 
6223 // #include <nlohmann/detail/iterators/json_reverse_iterator.hpp>
6224 
6225 
6226 #include <cstddef> // ptrdiff_t
6227 #include <iterator> // reverse_iterator
6228 #include <utility> // declval
6229 
6230 namespace nlohmann
6231 {
6232 namespace detail
6233 {
6234 //////////////////////
6235 // reverse_iterator //
6236 //////////////////////
6237 
6238 /*!
6239 @brief a template for a reverse iterator class
6240 
6241 @tparam Base the base iterator type to reverse. Valid types are @ref
6242 iterator (to create @ref reverse_iterator) and @ref const_iterator (to
6243 create @ref const_reverse_iterator).
6244 
6245 @requirement The class satisfies the following concept requirements:
6246 -
6247 [BidirectionalIterator](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/named_req/BidirectionalIterator):
6248  The iterator that can be moved can be moved in both directions (i.e.
6249  incremented and decremented).
6250 - [OutputIterator](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/named_req/OutputIterator):
6251  It is possible to write to the pointed-to element (only if @a Base is
6252  @ref iterator).
6253 
6254 @since version 1.0.0
6255 */
6256 template<typename Base>
6257 class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
6258 {
6259  public:
6260  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
6261  /// shortcut to the reverse iterator adapter
6262  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
6263  /// the reference type for the pointed-to element
6264  using reference = typename Base::reference;
6265 
6266  /// create reverse iterator from iterator
6267  explicit json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
6268  : base_iterator(it) {}
6269 
6270  /// create reverse iterator from base class
6271  explicit json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {}
6272 
6273  /// post-increment (it++)
6274  json_reverse_iterator const operator++(int)
6275  {
6276  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator++(1));
6277  }
6278 
6279  /// pre-increment (++it)
6280  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
6281  {
6282  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator++());
6283  }
6284 
6285  /// post-decrement (it--)
6286  json_reverse_iterator const operator--(int)
6287  {
6288  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator--(1));
6289  }
6290 
6291  /// pre-decrement (--it)
6292  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
6293  {
6294  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator--());
6295  }
6296 
6297  /// add to iterator
6298  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
6299  {
6300  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator+=(i));
6301  }
6302 
6303  /// add to iterator
6304  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
6305  {
6306  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator+(i));
6307  }
6308 
6309  /// subtract from iterator
6310  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
6311  {
6312  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator-(i));
6313  }
6314 
6315  /// return difference
6316  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
6317  {
6318  return base_iterator(*this) - base_iterator(other);
6319  }
6320 
6321  /// access to successor
6322  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
6323  {
6324  return *(this->operator+(n));
6325  }
6326 
6327  /// return the key of an object iterator
6328  auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Base>().key())
6329  {
6330  auto it = --this->base();
6331  return it.key();
6332  }
6333 
6334  /// return the value of an iterator
6335  reference value() const
6336  {
6337  auto it = --this->base();
6338  return it.operator * ();
6339  }
6340 };
6341 } // namespace detail
6342 } // namespace nlohmann
6343 
6344 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/output_adapters.hpp>
6345 
6346 
6347 #include <algorithm> // copy
6348 #include <cstddef> // size_t
6349 #include <ios> // streamsize
6350 #include <iterator> // back_inserter
6351 #include <memory> // shared_ptr, make_shared
6352 #include <ostream> // basic_ostream
6353 #include <string> // basic_string
6354 #include <vector> // vector
6355 
6356 namespace nlohmann
6357 {
6358 namespace detail
6359 {
6360 /// abstract output adapter interface
6361 template<typename CharType> struct output_adapter_protocol
6362 {
6363  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
6364  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) = 0;
6365  virtual ~output_adapter_protocol() = default;
6366 };
6367 
6368 /// a type to simplify interfaces
6369 template<typename CharType>
6370 using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter_protocol<CharType>>;
6371 
6372 /// output adapter for byte vectors
6373 template<typename CharType>
6374 class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6375 {
6376  public:
6377  explicit output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec) noexcept
6378  : v(vec)
6379  {}
6380 
6381  void write_character(CharType c) override
6382  {
6383  v.push_back(c);
6384  }
6385 
6386  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6387  {
6388  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
6389  }
6390 
6391  private:
6392  std::vector<CharType>& v;
6393 };
6394 
6395 /// output adapter for output streams
6396 template<typename CharType>
6397 class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6398 {
6399  public:
6400  explicit output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s) noexcept
6401  : stream(s)
6402  {}
6403 
6404  void write_character(CharType c) override
6405  {
6406  stream.put(c);
6407  }
6408 
6409  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6410  {
6411  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
6412  }
6413 
6414  private:
6415  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
6416 };
6417 
6418 /// output adapter for basic_string
6419 template<typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
6420 class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
6421 {
6422  public:
6423  explicit output_string_adapter(StringType& s) noexcept
6424  : str(s)
6425  {}
6426 
6427  void write_character(CharType c) override
6428  {
6429  str.push_back(c);
6430  }
6431 
6432  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
6433  {
6434  str.append(s, length);
6435  }
6436 
6437  private:
6438  StringType& str;
6439 };
6440 
6441 template<typename CharType, typename StringType = std::basic_string<CharType>>
6442 class output_adapter
6443 {
6444  public:
6445  output_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
6446  : oa(std::make_shared<output_vector_adapter<CharType>>(vec)) {}
6447 
6448  output_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
6449  : oa(std::make_shared<output_stream_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
6450 
6451  output_adapter(StringType& s)
6452  : oa(std::make_shared<output_string_adapter<CharType, StringType>>(s)) {}
6453 
6454  operator output_adapter_t<CharType>()
6455  {
6456  return oa;
6457  }
6458 
6459  private:
6460  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
6461 };
6462 } // namespace detail
6463 } // namespace nlohmann
6464 
6465 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/binary_reader.hpp>
6466 
6467 
6468 #include <algorithm> // generate_n
6469 #include <array> // array
6470 #include <cassert> // assert
6471 #include <cmath> // ldexp
6472 #include <cstddef> // size_t
6473 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t
6474 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
6475 #include <cstring> // memcpy
6476 #include <iterator> // back_inserter
6477 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
6478 #include <string> // char_traits, string
6479 #include <utility> // make_pair, move
6480 
6481 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/input_adapters.hpp>
6482 
6483 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/json_sax.hpp>
6484 
6485 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
6486 
6487 // #include <nlohmann/detail/macro_scope.hpp>
6488 
6489 // #include <nlohmann/detail/meta/is_sax.hpp>
6490 
6491 // #include <nlohmann/detail/value_t.hpp>
6492 
6493 
6494 namespace nlohmann
6495 {
6496 namespace detail
6497 {
6498 ///////////////////
6499 // binary reader //
6500 ///////////////////
6501 
6502 /*!
6503 @brief deserialization of CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON values
6504 */
6505 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename SAX = json_sax_dom_parser<BasicJsonType>>
6506 class binary_reader
6507 {
6508  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
6509  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
6510  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
6511  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
6512  using json_sax_t = SAX;
6513 
6514  public:
6515  /*!
6516  @brief create a binary reader
6517 
6518  @param[in] adapter input adapter to read from
6519  */
6520  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(std::move(adapter))
6521  {
6522  (void)detail::is_sax_static_asserts<SAX, BasicJsonType> {};
6523  assert(ia);
6524  }
6525 
6526  /*!
6527  @param[in] format the binary format to parse
6528  @param[in] sax_ a SAX event processor
6529  @param[in] strict whether to expect the input to be consumed completed
6530 
6531  @return
6532  */
6533  bool sax_parse(const input_format_t format,
6534  json_sax_t* sax_,
6535  const bool strict = true)
6536  {
6537  sax = sax_;
6538  bool result = false;
6539 
6540  switch (format)
6541  {
6542  case input_format_t::bson:
6543  result = parse_bson_internal();
6544  break;
6545 
6546  case input_format_t::cbor:
6547  result = parse_cbor_internal();
6548  break;
6549 
6550  case input_format_t::msgpack:
6551  result = parse_msgpack_internal();
6552  break;
6553 
6554  case input_format_t::ubjson:
6555  result = parse_ubjson_internal();
6556  break;
6557 
6558  // LCOV_EXCL_START
6559  default:
6560  assert(false);
6561  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
6562  }
6563 
6564  // strict mode: next byte must be EOF
6565  if (result and strict)
6566  {
6567  if (format == input_format_t::ubjson)
6568  {
6569  get_ignore_noop();
6570  }
6571  else
6572  {
6573  get();
6574  }
6575 
6576  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
6577  {
6578  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, get_token_string(),
6579  parse_error::create(110, chars_read, exception_message(format, "expected end of input; last byte: 0x" + get_token_string(), "value")));
6580  }
6581  }
6582 
6583  return result;
6584  }
6585 
6586  /*!
6587  @brief determine system byte order
6588 
6589  @return true if and only if system's byte order is little endian
6590 
6591  @note from http://stackoverflow.com/a/1001328/266378
6592  */
6593  static constexpr bool little_endianess(int num = 1) noexcept
6594  {
6595  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
6596  }
6597 
6598  private:
6599  //////////
6600  // BSON //
6601  //////////
6602 
6603  /*!
6604  @brief Reads in a BSON-object and passes it to the SAX-parser.
6605  @return whether a valid BSON-value was passed to the SAX parser
6606  */
6607  bool parse_bson_internal()
6608  {
6609  std::int32_t document_size;
6610  get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, document_size);
6611 
6612  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
6613  {
6614  return false;
6615  }
6616 
6617  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_list(/*is_array*/false)))
6618  {
6619  return false;
6620  }
6621 
6622  return sax->end_object();
6623  }
6624 
6625  /*!
6626  @brief Parses a C-style string from the BSON input.
6627  @param[in, out] result A reference to the string variable where the read
6628  string is to be stored.
6629  @return `true` if the \x00-byte indicating the end of the string was
6630  encountered before the EOF; false` indicates an unexpected EOF.
6631  */
6632  bool get_bson_cstr(string_t& result)
6633  {
6634  auto out = std::back_inserter(result);
6635  while (true)
6636  {
6637  get();
6638  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::bson, "cstring")))
6639  {
6640  return false;
6641  }
6642  if (current == 0x00)
6643  {
6644  return true;
6645  }
6646  *out++ = static_cast<char>(current);
6647  }
6648 
6649  return true;
6650  }
6651 
6652  /*!
6653  @brief Parses a zero-terminated string of length @a len from the BSON
6654  input.
6655  @param[in] len The length (including the zero-byte at the end) of the
6656  string to be read.
6657  @param[in, out] result A reference to the string variable where the read
6658  string is to be stored.
6659  @tparam NumberType The type of the length @a len
6660  @pre len >= 1
6661  @return `true` if the string was successfully parsed
6662  */
6663  template<typename NumberType>
6664  bool get_bson_string(const NumberType len, string_t& result)
6665  {
6666  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(len < 1))
6667  {
6668  auto last_token = get_token_string();
6669  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::bson, "string length must be at least 1, is " + std::to_string(len), "string")));
6670  }
6671 
6672  return get_string(input_format_t::bson, len - static_cast<NumberType>(1), result) and get() != std::char_traits<char>::eof();
6673  }
6674 
6675  /*!
6676  @brief Read a BSON document element of the given @a element_type.
6677  @param[in] element_type The BSON element type, c.f. http://bsonspec.org/spec.html
6678  @param[in] element_type_parse_position The position in the input stream,
6679  where the `element_type` was read.
6680  @warning Not all BSON element types are supported yet. An unsupported
6681  @a element_type will give rise to a parse_error.114:
6682  Unsupported BSON record type 0x...
6683  @return whether a valid BSON-object/array was passed to the SAX parser
6684  */
6685  bool parse_bson_element_internal(const int element_type,
6686  const std::size_t element_type_parse_position)
6687  {
6688  switch (element_type)
6689  {
6690  case 0x01: // double
6691  {
6692  double number;
6693  return get_number<double, true>(input_format_t::bson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
6694  }
6695 
6696  case 0x02: // string
6697  {
6698  std::int32_t len;
6699  string_t value;
6700  return get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, len) and get_bson_string(len, value) and sax->string(value);
6701  }
6702 
6703  case 0x03: // object
6704  {
6705  return parse_bson_internal();
6706  }
6707 
6708  case 0x04: // array
6709  {
6710  return parse_bson_array();
6711  }
6712 
6713  case 0x08: // boolean
6714  {
6715  return sax->boolean(get() != 0);
6716  }
6717 
6718  case 0x0A: // null
6719  {
6720  return sax->null();
6721  }
6722 
6723  case 0x10: // int32
6724  {
6725  std::int32_t value;
6726  return get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, value) and sax->number_integer(value);
6727  }
6728 
6729  case 0x12: // int64
6730  {
6731  std::int64_t value;
6732  return get_number<std::int64_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, value) and sax->number_integer(value);
6733  }
6734 
6735  default: // anything else not supported (yet)
6736  {
6737  char cr[3];
6738  (std::snprintf)(cr, sizeof(cr), "%.2hhX", static_cast<unsigned char>(element_type));
6739  return sax->parse_error(element_type_parse_position, std::string(cr), parse_error::create(114, element_type_parse_position, "Unsupported BSON record type 0x" + std::string(cr)));
6740  }
6741  }
6742  }
6743 
6744  /*!
6745  @brief Read a BSON element list (as specified in the BSON-spec)
6746 
6747  The same binary layout is used for objects and arrays, hence it must be
6748  indicated with the argument @a is_array which one is expected
6749  (true --> array, false --> object).
6750 
6751  @param[in] is_array Determines if the element list being read is to be
6752  treated as an object (@a is_array == false), or as an
6753  array (@a is_array == true).
6754  @return whether a valid BSON-object/array was passed to the SAX parser
6755  */
6756  bool parse_bson_element_list(const bool is_array)
6757  {
6758  string_t key;
6759  while (int element_type = get())
6760  {
6761  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::bson, "element list")))
6762  {
6763  return false;
6764  }
6765 
6766  const std::size_t element_type_parse_position = chars_read;
6767  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_bson_cstr(key)))
6768  {
6769  return false;
6770  }
6771 
6772  if (not is_array)
6773  {
6774  if (not sax->key(key))
6775  {
6776  return false;
6777  }
6778  }
6779 
6780  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_internal(element_type, element_type_parse_position)))
6781  {
6782  return false;
6783  }
6784 
6785  // get_bson_cstr only appends
6786  key.clear();
6787  }
6788 
6789  return true;
6790  }
6791 
6792  /*!
6793  @brief Reads an array from the BSON input and passes it to the SAX-parser.
6794  @return whether a valid BSON-array was passed to the SAX parser
6795  */
6796  bool parse_bson_array()
6797  {
6798  std::int32_t document_size;
6799  get_number<std::int32_t, true>(input_format_t::bson, document_size);
6800 
6801  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
6802  {
6803  return false;
6804  }
6805 
6806  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_bson_element_list(/*is_array*/true)))
6807  {
6808  return false;
6809  }
6810 
6811  return sax->end_array();
6812  }
6813 
6814  //////////
6815  // CBOR //
6816  //////////
6817 
6818  /*!
6819  @param[in] get_char whether a new character should be retrieved from the
6820  input (true, default) or whether the last read
6821  character should be considered instead
6822 
6823  @return whether a valid CBOR value was passed to the SAX parser
6824  */
6825  bool parse_cbor_internal(const bool get_char = true)
6826  {
6827  switch (get_char ? get() : current)
6828  {
6829  // EOF
6830  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
6831  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "value");
6832 
6833  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
6834  case 0x00:
6835  case 0x01:
6836  case 0x02:
6837  case 0x03:
6838  case 0x04:
6839  case 0x05:
6840  case 0x06:
6841  case 0x07:
6842  case 0x08:
6843  case 0x09:
6844  case 0x0A:
6845  case 0x0B:
6846  case 0x0C:
6847  case 0x0D:
6848  case 0x0E:
6849  case 0x0F:
6850  case 0x10:
6851  case 0x11:
6852  case 0x12:
6853  case 0x13:
6854  case 0x14:
6855  case 0x15:
6856  case 0x16:
6857  case 0x17:
6858  return sax->number_unsigned(static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current));
6859 
6860  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
6861  {
6862  uint8_t number;
6863  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6864  }
6865 
6866  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
6867  {
6868  uint16_t number;
6869  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6870  }
6871 
6872  case 0x1A: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
6873  {
6874  uint32_t number;
6875  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6876  }
6877 
6878  case 0x1B: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
6879  {
6880  uint64_t number;
6881  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
6882  }
6883 
6884  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
6885  case 0x20:
6886  case 0x21:
6887  case 0x22:
6888  case 0x23:
6889  case 0x24:
6890  case 0x25:
6891  case 0x26:
6892  case 0x27:
6893  case 0x28:
6894  case 0x29:
6895  case 0x2A:
6896  case 0x2B:
6897  case 0x2C:
6898  case 0x2D:
6899  case 0x2E:
6900  case 0x2F:
6901  case 0x30:
6902  case 0x31:
6903  case 0x32:
6904  case 0x33:
6905  case 0x34:
6906  case 0x35:
6907  case 0x36:
6908  case 0x37:
6909  return sax->number_integer(static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current));
6910 
6911  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
6912  {
6913  uint8_t number;
6914  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6915  }
6916 
6917  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
6918  {
6919  uint16_t number;
6920  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6921  }
6922 
6923  case 0x3A: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
6924  {
6925  uint32_t number;
6926  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - number);
6927  }
6928 
6929  case 0x3B: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
6930  {
6931  uint64_t number;
6932  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_integer(static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1)
6933  - static_cast<number_integer_t>(number));
6934  }
6935 
6936  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
6937  case 0x60:
6938  case 0x61:
6939  case 0x62:
6940  case 0x63:
6941  case 0x64:
6942  case 0x65:
6943  case 0x66:
6944  case 0x67:
6945  case 0x68:
6946  case 0x69:
6947  case 0x6A:
6948  case 0x6B:
6949  case 0x6C:
6950  case 0x6D:
6951  case 0x6E:
6952  case 0x6F:
6953  case 0x70:
6954  case 0x71:
6955  case 0x72:
6956  case 0x73:
6957  case 0x74:
6958  case 0x75:
6959  case 0x76:
6960  case 0x77:
6961  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
6962  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
6963  case 0x7A: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
6964  case 0x7B: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
6965  case 0x7F: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
6966  {
6967  string_t s;
6968  return get_cbor_string(s) and sax->string(s);
6969  }
6970 
6971  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
6972  case 0x80:
6973  case 0x81:
6974  case 0x82:
6975  case 0x83:
6976  case 0x84:
6977  case 0x85:
6978  case 0x86:
6979  case 0x87:
6980  case 0x88:
6981  case 0x89:
6982  case 0x8A:
6983  case 0x8B:
6984  case 0x8C:
6985  case 0x8D:
6986  case 0x8E:
6987  case 0x8F:
6988  case 0x90:
6989  case 0x91:
6990  case 0x92:
6991  case 0x93:
6992  case 0x94:
6993  case 0x95:
6994  case 0x96:
6995  case 0x97:
6996  return get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x1F));
6997 
6998  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
6999  {
7000  uint8_t len;
7001  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7002  }
7003 
7004  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7005  {
7006  uint16_t len;
7007  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7008  }
7009 
7010  case 0x9A: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7011  {
7012  uint32_t len;
7013  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7014  }
7015 
7016  case 0x9B: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7017  {
7018  uint64_t len;
7019  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7020  }
7021 
7022  case 0x9F: // array (indefinite length)
7023  return get_cbor_array(std::size_t(-1));
7024 
7025  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
7026  case 0xA0:
7027  case 0xA1:
7028  case 0xA2:
7029  case 0xA3:
7030  case 0xA4:
7031  case 0xA5:
7032  case 0xA6:
7033  case 0xA7:
7034  case 0xA8:
7035  case 0xA9:
7036  case 0xAA:
7037  case 0xAB:
7038  case 0xAC:
7039  case 0xAD:
7040  case 0xAE:
7041  case 0xAF:
7042  case 0xB0:
7043  case 0xB1:
7044  case 0xB2:
7045  case 0xB3:
7046  case 0xB4:
7047  case 0xB5:
7048  case 0xB6:
7049  case 0xB7:
7050  return get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x1F));
7051 
7052  case 0xB8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7053  {
7054  uint8_t len;
7055  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7056  }
7057 
7058  case 0xB9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7059  {
7060  uint16_t len;
7061  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7062  }
7063 
7064  case 0xBA: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7065  {
7066  uint32_t len;
7067  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7068  }
7069 
7070  case 0xBB: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7071  {
7072  uint64_t len;
7073  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_cbor_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7074  }
7075 
7076  case 0xBF: // map (indefinite length)
7077  return get_cbor_object(std::size_t(-1));
7078 
7079  case 0xF4: // false
7080  return sax->boolean(false);
7081 
7082  case 0xF5: // true
7083  return sax->boolean(true);
7084 
7085  case 0xF6: // null
7086  return sax->null();
7087 
7088  case 0xF9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
7089  {
7090  const int byte1_raw = get();
7091  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "number")))
7092  {
7093  return false;
7094  }
7095  const int byte2_raw = get();
7096  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "number")))
7097  {
7098  return false;
7099  }
7100 
7101  const auto byte1 = static_cast<unsigned char>(byte1_raw);
7102  const auto byte2 = static_cast<unsigned char>(byte2_raw);
7103 
7104  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
7105  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
7106  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
7107  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
7108  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
7109  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
7110  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
7111  // is shown in Fig. 3.
7112  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
7113  const double val = [&half]
7114  {
7115  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1F;
7116  const int mant = half & 0x3FF;
7117  assert(0 <= exp and exp <= 32);
7118  assert(0 <= mant and mant <= 1024);
7119  switch (exp)
7120  {
7121  case 0:
7122  return std::ldexp(mant, -24);
7123  case 31:
7124  return (mant == 0)
7125  ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
7126  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
7127  default:
7128  return std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
7129  }
7130  }();
7131  return sax->number_float((half & 0x8000) != 0
7132  ? static_cast<number_float_t>(-val)
7133  : static_cast<number_float_t>(val), "");
7134  }
7135 
7136  case 0xFA: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
7137  {
7138  float number;
7139  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7140  }
7141 
7142  case 0xFB: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
7143  {
7144  double number;
7145  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7146  }
7147 
7148  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
7149  {
7150  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7151  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::cbor, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
7152  }
7153  }
7154  }
7155 
7156  /*!
7157  @brief reads a CBOR string
7158 
7159  This function first reads starting bytes to determine the expected
7160  string length and then copies this number of bytes into a string.
7161  Additionally, CBOR's strings with indefinite lengths are supported.
7162 
7163  @param[out] result created string
7164 
7165  @return whether string creation completed
7166  */
7167  bool get_cbor_string(string_t& result)
7168  {
7169  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::cbor, "string")))
7170  {
7171  return false;
7172  }
7173 
7174  switch (current)
7175  {
7176  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
7177  case 0x60:
7178  case 0x61:
7179  case 0x62:
7180  case 0x63:
7181  case 0x64:
7182  case 0x65:
7183  case 0x66:
7184  case 0x67:
7185  case 0x68:
7186  case 0x69:
7187  case 0x6A:
7188  case 0x6B:
7189  case 0x6C:
7190  case 0x6D:
7191  case 0x6E:
7192  case 0x6F:
7193  case 0x70:
7194  case 0x71:
7195  case 0x72:
7196  case 0x73:
7197  case 0x74:
7198  case 0x75:
7199  case 0x76:
7200  case 0x77:
7201  {
7202  return get_string(input_format_t::cbor, current & 0x1F, result);
7203  }
7204 
7205  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
7206  {
7207  uint8_t len;
7208  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7209  }
7210 
7211  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
7212  {
7213  uint16_t len;
7214  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7215  }
7216 
7217  case 0x7A: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
7218  {
7219  uint32_t len;
7220  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7221  }
7222 
7223  case 0x7B: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
7224  {
7225  uint64_t len;
7226  return get_number(input_format_t::cbor, len) and get_string(input_format_t::cbor, len, result);
7227  }
7228 
7229  case 0x7F: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
7230  {
7231  while (get() != 0xFF)
7232  {
7233  string_t chunk;
7234  if (not get_cbor_string(chunk))
7235  {
7236  return false;
7237  }
7238  result.append(chunk);
7239  }
7240  return true;
7241  }
7242 
7243  default:
7244  {
7245  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7246  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::cbor, "expected length specification (0x60-0x7B) or indefinite string type (0x7F); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7247  }
7248  }
7249  }
7250 
7251  /*!
7252  @param[in] len the length of the array or std::size_t(-1) for an
7253  array of indefinite size
7254  @return whether array creation completed
7255  */
7256  bool get_cbor_array(const std::size_t len)
7257  {
7258  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(len)))
7259  {
7260  return false;
7261  }
7262 
7263  if (len != std::size_t(-1))
7264  {
7265  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7266  {
7267  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7268  {
7269  return false;
7270  }
7271  }
7272  }
7273  else
7274  {
7275  while (get() != 0xFF)
7276  {
7277  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal(false)))
7278  {
7279  return false;
7280  }
7281  }
7282  }
7283 
7284  return sax->end_array();
7285  }
7286 
7287  /*!
7288  @param[in] len the length of the object or std::size_t(-1) for an
7289  object of indefinite size
7290  @return whether object creation completed
7291  */
7292  bool get_cbor_object(const std::size_t len)
7293  {
7294  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(len)))
7295  {
7296  return false;
7297  }
7298 
7299  string_t key;
7300  if (len != std::size_t(-1))
7301  {
7302  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7303  {
7304  get();
7305  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_cbor_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7306  {
7307  return false;
7308  }
7309 
7310  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7311  {
7312  return false;
7313  }
7314  key.clear();
7315  }
7316  }
7317  else
7318  {
7319  while (get() != 0xFF)
7320  {
7321  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_cbor_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7322  {
7323  return false;
7324  }
7325 
7326  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_cbor_internal()))
7327  {
7328  return false;
7329  }
7330  key.clear();
7331  }
7332  }
7333 
7334  return sax->end_object();
7335  }
7336 
7337  /////////////
7338  // MsgPack //
7339  /////////////
7340 
7341  /*!
7342  @return whether a valid MessagePack value was passed to the SAX parser
7343  */
7344  bool parse_msgpack_internal()
7345  {
7346  switch (get())
7347  {
7348  // EOF
7349  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
7350  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::msgpack, "value");
7351 
7352  // positive fixint
7353  case 0x00:
7354  case 0x01:
7355  case 0x02:
7356  case 0x03:
7357  case 0x04:
7358  case 0x05:
7359  case 0x06:
7360  case 0x07:
7361  case 0x08:
7362  case 0x09:
7363  case 0x0A:
7364  case 0x0B:
7365  case 0x0C:
7366  case 0x0D:
7367  case 0x0E:
7368  case 0x0F:
7369  case 0x10:
7370  case 0x11:
7371  case 0x12:
7372  case 0x13:
7373  case 0x14:
7374  case 0x15:
7375  case 0x16:
7376  case 0x17:
7377  case 0x18:
7378  case 0x19:
7379  case 0x1A:
7380  case 0x1B:
7381  case 0x1C:
7382  case 0x1D:
7383  case 0x1E:
7384  case 0x1F:
7385  case 0x20:
7386  case 0x21:
7387  case 0x22:
7388  case 0x23:
7389  case 0x24:
7390  case 0x25:
7391  case 0x26:
7392  case 0x27:
7393  case 0x28:
7394  case 0x29:
7395  case 0x2A:
7396  case 0x2B:
7397  case 0x2C:
7398  case 0x2D:
7399  case 0x2E:
7400  case 0x2F:
7401  case 0x30:
7402  case 0x31:
7403  case 0x32:
7404  case 0x33:
7405  case 0x34:
7406  case 0x35:
7407  case 0x36:
7408  case 0x37:
7409  case 0x38:
7410  case 0x39:
7411  case 0x3A:
7412  case 0x3B:
7413  case 0x3C:
7414  case 0x3D:
7415  case 0x3E:
7416  case 0x3F:
7417  case 0x40:
7418  case 0x41:
7419  case 0x42:
7420  case 0x43:
7421  case 0x44:
7422  case 0x45:
7423  case 0x46:
7424  case 0x47:
7425  case 0x48:
7426  case 0x49:
7427  case 0x4A:
7428  case 0x4B:
7429  case 0x4C:
7430  case 0x4D:
7431  case 0x4E:
7432  case 0x4F:
7433  case 0x50:
7434  case 0x51:
7435  case 0x52:
7436  case 0x53:
7437  case 0x54:
7438  case 0x55:
7439  case 0x56:
7440  case 0x57:
7441  case 0x58:
7442  case 0x59:
7443  case 0x5A:
7444  case 0x5B:
7445  case 0x5C:
7446  case 0x5D:
7447  case 0x5E:
7448  case 0x5F:
7449  case 0x60:
7450  case 0x61:
7451  case 0x62:
7452  case 0x63:
7453  case 0x64:
7454  case 0x65:
7455  case 0x66:
7456  case 0x67:
7457  case 0x68:
7458  case 0x69:
7459  case 0x6A:
7460  case 0x6B:
7461  case 0x6C:
7462  case 0x6D:
7463  case 0x6E:
7464  case 0x6F:
7465  case 0x70:
7466  case 0x71:
7467  case 0x72:
7468  case 0x73:
7469  case 0x74:
7470  case 0x75:
7471  case 0x76:
7472  case 0x77:
7473  case 0x78:
7474  case 0x79:
7475  case 0x7A:
7476  case 0x7B:
7477  case 0x7C:
7478  case 0x7D:
7479  case 0x7E:
7480  case 0x7F:
7481  return sax->number_unsigned(static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current));
7482 
7483  // fixmap
7484  case 0x80:
7485  case 0x81:
7486  case 0x82:
7487  case 0x83:
7488  case 0x84:
7489  case 0x85:
7490  case 0x86:
7491  case 0x87:
7492  case 0x88:
7493  case 0x89:
7494  case 0x8A:
7495  case 0x8B:
7496  case 0x8C:
7497  case 0x8D:
7498  case 0x8E:
7499  case 0x8F:
7500  return get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x0F));
7501 
7502  // fixarray
7503  case 0x90:
7504  case 0x91:
7505  case 0x92:
7506  case 0x93:
7507  case 0x94:
7508  case 0x95:
7509  case 0x96:
7510  case 0x97:
7511  case 0x98:
7512  case 0x99:
7513  case 0x9A:
7514  case 0x9B:
7515  case 0x9C:
7516  case 0x9D:
7517  case 0x9E:
7518  case 0x9F:
7519  return get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(current & 0x0F));
7520 
7521  // fixstr
7522  case 0xA0:
7523  case 0xA1:
7524  case 0xA2:
7525  case 0xA3:
7526  case 0xA4:
7527  case 0xA5:
7528  case 0xA6:
7529  case 0xA7:
7530  case 0xA8:
7531  case 0xA9:
7532  case 0xAA:
7533  case 0xAB:
7534  case 0xAC:
7535  case 0xAD:
7536  case 0xAE:
7537  case 0xAF:
7538  case 0xB0:
7539  case 0xB1:
7540  case 0xB2:
7541  case 0xB3:
7542  case 0xB4:
7543  case 0xB5:
7544  case 0xB6:
7545  case 0xB7:
7546  case 0xB8:
7547  case 0xB9:
7548  case 0xBA:
7549  case 0xBB:
7550  case 0xBC:
7551  case 0xBD:
7552  case 0xBE:
7553  case 0xBF:
7554  {
7555  string_t s;
7556  return get_msgpack_string(s) and sax->string(s);
7557  }
7558 
7559  case 0xC0: // nil
7560  return sax->null();
7561 
7562  case 0xC2: // false
7563  return sax->boolean(false);
7564 
7565  case 0xC3: // true
7566  return sax->boolean(true);
7567 
7568  case 0xCA: // float 32
7569  {
7570  float number;
7571  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7572  }
7573 
7574  case 0xCB: // float 64
7575  {
7576  double number;
7577  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
7578  }
7579 
7580  case 0xCC: // uint 8
7581  {
7582  uint8_t number;
7583  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7584  }
7585 
7586  case 0xCD: // uint 16
7587  {
7588  uint16_t number;
7589  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7590  }
7591 
7592  case 0xCE: // uint 32
7593  {
7594  uint32_t number;
7595  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7596  }
7597 
7598  case 0xCF: // uint 64
7599  {
7600  uint64_t number;
7601  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
7602  }
7603 
7604  case 0xD0: // int 8
7605  {
7606  int8_t number;
7607  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7608  }
7609 
7610  case 0xD1: // int 16
7611  {
7612  int16_t number;
7613  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7614  }
7615 
7616  case 0xD2: // int 32
7617  {
7618  int32_t number;
7619  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7620  }
7621 
7622  case 0xD3: // int 64
7623  {
7624  int64_t number;
7625  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
7626  }
7627 
7628  case 0xD9: // str 8
7629  case 0xDA: // str 16
7630  case 0xDB: // str 32
7631  {
7632  string_t s;
7633  return get_msgpack_string(s) and sax->string(s);
7634  }
7635 
7636  case 0xDC: // array 16
7637  {
7638  uint16_t len;
7639  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7640  }
7641 
7642  case 0xDD: // array 32
7643  {
7644  uint32_t len;
7645  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_array(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7646  }
7647 
7648  case 0xDE: // map 16
7649  {
7650  uint16_t len;
7651  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7652  }
7653 
7654  case 0xDF: // map 32
7655  {
7656  uint32_t len;
7657  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_msgpack_object(static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
7658  }
7659 
7660  // negative fixint
7661  case 0xE0:
7662  case 0xE1:
7663  case 0xE2:
7664  case 0xE3:
7665  case 0xE4:
7666  case 0xE5:
7667  case 0xE6:
7668  case 0xE7:
7669  case 0xE8:
7670  case 0xE9:
7671  case 0xEA:
7672  case 0xEB:
7673  case 0xEC:
7674  case 0xED:
7675  case 0xEE:
7676  case 0xEF:
7677  case 0xF0:
7678  case 0xF1:
7679  case 0xF2:
7680  case 0xF3:
7681  case 0xF4:
7682  case 0xF5:
7683  case 0xF6:
7684  case 0xF7:
7685  case 0xF8:
7686  case 0xF9:
7687  case 0xFA:
7688  case 0xFB:
7689  case 0xFC:
7690  case 0xFD:
7691  case 0xFE:
