7692  case 0xFF:
7693  return sax->number_integer(static_cast<int8_t>(current));
7694 
7695  default: // anything else
7696  {
7697  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7698  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::msgpack, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
7699  }
7700  }
7701  }
7702 
7703  /*!
7704  @brief reads a MessagePack string
7705 
7706  This function first reads starting bytes to determine the expected
7707  string length and then copies this number of bytes into a string.
7708 
7709  @param[out] result created string
7710 
7711  @return whether string creation completed
7712  */
7713  bool get_msgpack_string(string_t& result)
7714  {
7715  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::msgpack, "string")))
7716  {
7717  return false;
7718  }
7719 
7720  switch (current)
7721  {
7722  // fixstr
7723  case 0xA0:
7724  case 0xA1:
7725  case 0xA2:
7726  case 0xA3:
7727  case 0xA4:
7728  case 0xA5:
7729  case 0xA6:
7730  case 0xA7:
7731  case 0xA8:
7732  case 0xA9:
7733  case 0xAA:
7734  case 0xAB:
7735  case 0xAC:
7736  case 0xAD:
7737  case 0xAE:
7738  case 0xAF:
7739  case 0xB0:
7740  case 0xB1:
7741  case 0xB2:
7742  case 0xB3:
7743  case 0xB4:
7744  case 0xB5:
7745  case 0xB6:
7746  case 0xB7:
7747  case 0xB8:
7748  case 0xB9:
7749  case 0xBA:
7750  case 0xBB:
7751  case 0xBC:
7752  case 0xBD:
7753  case 0xBE:
7754  case 0xBF:
7755  {
7756  return get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, current & 0x1F, result);
7757  }
7758 
7759  case 0xD9: // str 8
7760  {
7761  uint8_t len;
7762  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7763  }
7764 
7765  case 0xDA: // str 16
7766  {
7767  uint16_t len;
7768  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7769  }
7770 
7771  case 0xDB: // str 32
7772  {
7773  uint32_t len;
7774  return get_number(input_format_t::msgpack, len) and get_string(input_format_t::msgpack, len, result);
7775  }
7776 
7777  default:
7778  {
7779  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7780  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::msgpack, "expected length specification (0xA0-0xBF, 0xD9-0xDB); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7781  }
7782  }
7783  }
7784 
7785  /*!
7786  @param[in] len the length of the array
7787  @return whether array creation completed
7788  */
7789  bool get_msgpack_array(const std::size_t len)
7790  {
7791  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(len)))
7792  {
7793  return false;
7794  }
7795 
7796  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7797  {
7798  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_msgpack_internal()))
7799  {
7800  return false;
7801  }
7802  }
7803 
7804  return sax->end_array();
7805  }
7806 
7807  /*!
7808  @param[in] len the length of the object
7809  @return whether object creation completed
7810  */
7811  bool get_msgpack_object(const std::size_t len)
7812  {
7813  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(len)))
7814  {
7815  return false;
7816  }
7817 
7818  string_t key;
7819  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < len; ++i)
7820  {
7821  get();
7822  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_msgpack_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
7823  {
7824  return false;
7825  }
7826 
7827  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_msgpack_internal()))
7828  {
7829  return false;
7830  }
7831  key.clear();
7832  }
7833 
7834  return sax->end_object();
7835  }
7836 
7837  ////////////
7838  // UBJSON //
7839  ////////////
7840 
7841  /*!
7842  @param[in] get_char whether a new character should be retrieved from the
7843  input (true, default) or whether the last read
7844  character should be considered instead
7845 
7846  @return whether a valid UBJSON value was passed to the SAX parser
7847  */
7848  bool parse_ubjson_internal(const bool get_char = true)
7849  {
7850  return get_ubjson_value(get_char ? get_ignore_noop() : current);
7851  }
7852 
7853  /*!
7854  @brief reads a UBJSON string
7855 
7856  This function is either called after reading the 'S' byte explicitly
7857  indicating a string, or in case of an object key where the 'S' byte can be
7858  left out.
7859 
7860  @param[out] result created string
7861  @param[in] get_char whether a new character should be retrieved from the
7862  input (true, default) or whether the last read
7863  character should be considered instead
7864 
7865  @return whether string creation completed
7866  */
7867  bool get_ubjson_string(string_t& result, const bool get_char = true)
7868  {
7869  if (get_char)
7870  {
7871  get(); // TODO: may we ignore N here?
7872  }
7873 
7874  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value")))
7875  {
7876  return false;
7877  }
7878 
7879  switch (current)
7880  {
7881  case 'U':
7882  {
7883  uint8_t len;
7884  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7885  }
7886 
7887  case 'i':
7888  {
7889  int8_t len;
7890  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7891  }
7892 
7893  case 'I':
7894  {
7895  int16_t len;
7896  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7897  }
7898 
7899  case 'l':
7900  {
7901  int32_t len;
7902  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7903  }
7904 
7905  case 'L':
7906  {
7907  int64_t len;
7908  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, len) and get_string(input_format_t::ubjson, len, result);
7909  }
7910 
7911  default:
7912  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7913  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected length type specification (U, i, I, l, L); last byte: 0x" + last_token, "string")));
7914  }
7915  }
7916 
7917  /*!
7918  @param[out] result determined size
7919  @return whether size determination completed
7920  */
7921  bool get_ubjson_size_value(std::size_t& result)
7922  {
7923  switch (get_ignore_noop())
7924  {
7925  case 'U':
7926  {
7927  uint8_t number;
7928  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7929  {
7930  return false;
7931  }
7932  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7933  return true;
7934  }
7935 
7936  case 'i':
7937  {
7938  int8_t number;
7939  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7940  {
7941  return false;
7942  }
7943  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7944  return true;
7945  }
7946 
7947  case 'I':
7948  {
7949  int16_t number;
7950  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7951  {
7952  return false;
7953  }
7954  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7955  return true;
7956  }
7957 
7958  case 'l':
7959  {
7960  int32_t number;
7961  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7962  {
7963  return false;
7964  }
7965  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7966  return true;
7967  }
7968 
7969  case 'L':
7970  {
7971  int64_t number;
7972  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number)))
7973  {
7974  return false;
7975  }
7976  result = static_cast<std::size_t>(number);
7977  return true;
7978  }
7979 
7980  default:
7981  {
7982  auto last_token = get_token_string();
7983  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected length type specification (U, i, I, l, L) after '#'; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "size")));
7984  }
7985  }
7986  }
7987 
7988  /*!
7989  @brief determine the type and size for a container
7990 
7991  In the optimized UBJSON format, a type and a size can be provided to allow
7992  for a more compact representation.
7993 
7994  @param[out] result pair of the size and the type
7995 
7996  @return whether pair creation completed
7997  */
7998  bool get_ubjson_size_type(std::pair<std::size_t, int>& result)
7999  {
8000  result.first = string_t::npos; // size
8001  result.second = 0; // type
8002 
8003  get_ignore_noop();
8004 
8005  if (current == '$')
8006  {
8007  result.second = get(); // must not ignore 'N', because 'N' maybe the type
8008  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "type")))
8009  {
8010  return false;
8011  }
8012 
8013  get_ignore_noop();
8014  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current != '#'))
8015  {
8016  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value")))
8017  {
8018  return false;
8019  }
8020  auto last_token = get_token_string();
8021  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "expected '#' after type information; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "size")));
8022  }
8023 
8024  return get_ubjson_size_value(result.first);
8025  }
8026  else if (current == '#')
8027  {
8028  return get_ubjson_size_value(result.first);
8029  }
8030  return true;
8031  }
8032 
8033  /*!
8034  @param prefix the previously read or set type prefix
8035  @return whether value creation completed
8036  */
8037  bool get_ubjson_value(const int prefix)
8038  {
8039  switch (prefix)
8040  {
8041  case std::char_traits<char>::eof(): // EOF
8042  return unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "value");
8043 
8044  case 'T': // true
8045  return sax->boolean(true);
8046  case 'F': // false
8047  return sax->boolean(false);
8048 
8049  case 'Z': // null
8050  return sax->null();
8051 
8052  case 'U':
8053  {
8054  uint8_t number;
8055  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_unsigned(number);
8056  }
8057 
8058  case 'i':
8059  {
8060  int8_t number;
8061  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
8062  }
8063 
8064  case 'I':
8065  {
8066  int16_t number;
8067  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
8068  }
8069 
8070  case 'l':
8071  {
8072  int32_t number;
8073  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
8074  }
8075 
8076  case 'L':
8077  {
8078  int64_t number;
8079  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_integer(number);
8080  }
8081 
8082  case 'd':
8083  {
8084  float number;
8085  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
8086  }
8087 
8088  case 'D':
8089  {
8090  double number;
8091  return get_number(input_format_t::ubjson, number) and sax->number_float(static_cast<number_float_t>(number), "");
8092  }
8093 
8094  case 'C': // char
8095  {
8096  get();
8097  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(input_format_t::ubjson, "char")))
8098  {
8099  return false;
8100  }
8101  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current > 127))
8102  {
8103  auto last_token = get_token_string();
8104  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(113, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "byte after 'C' must be in range 0x00..0x7F; last byte: 0x" + last_token, "char")));
8105  }
8106  string_t s(1, static_cast<char>(current));
8107  return sax->string(s);
8108  }
8109 
8110  case 'S': // string
8111  {
8112  string_t s;
8113  return get_ubjson_string(s) and sax->string(s);
8114  }
8115 
8116  case '[': // array
8117  return get_ubjson_array();
8118 
8119  case '{': // object
8120  return get_ubjson_object();
8121 
8122  default: // anything else
8123  {
8124  auto last_token = get_token_string();
8125  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, last_token, parse_error::create(112, chars_read, exception_message(input_format_t::ubjson, "invalid byte: 0x" + last_token, "value")));
8126  }
8127  }
8128  }
8129 
8130  /*!
8131  @return whether array creation completed
8132  */
8133  bool get_ubjson_array()
8134  {
8135  std::pair<std::size_t, int> size_and_type;
8136  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_size_type(size_and_type)))
8137  {
8138  return false;
8139  }
8140 
8141  if (size_and_type.first != string_t::npos)
8142  {
8143  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(size_and_type.first)))
8144  {
8145  return false;
8146  }
8147 
8148  if (size_and_type.second != 0)
8149  {
8150  if (size_and_type.second != 'N')
8151  {
8152  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8153  {
8154  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_value(size_and_type.second)))
8155  {
8156  return false;
8157  }
8158  }
8159  }
8160  }
8161  else
8162  {
8163  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8164  {
8165  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8166  {
8167  return false;
8168  }
8169  }
8170  }
8171  }
8172  else
8173  {
8174  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_array(std::size_t(-1))))
8175  {
8176  return false;
8177  }
8178 
8179  while (current != ']')
8180  {
8181  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal(false)))
8182  {
8183  return false;
8184  }
8185  get_ignore_noop();
8186  }
8187  }
8188 
8189  return sax->end_array();
8190  }
8191 
8192  /*!
8193  @return whether object creation completed
8194  */
8195  bool get_ubjson_object()
8196  {
8197  std::pair<std::size_t, int> size_and_type;
8198  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_size_type(size_and_type)))
8199  {
8200  return false;
8201  }
8202 
8203  string_t key;
8204  if (size_and_type.first != string_t::npos)
8205  {
8206  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(size_and_type.first)))
8207  {
8208  return false;
8209  }
8210 
8211  if (size_and_type.second != 0)
8212  {
8213  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8214  {
8215  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
8216  {
8217  return false;
8218  }
8219  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_value(size_and_type.second)))
8220  {
8221  return false;
8222  }
8223  key.clear();
8224  }
8225  }
8226  else
8227  {
8228  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size_and_type.first; ++i)
8229  {
8230  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key) or not sax->key(key)))
8231  {
8232  return false;
8233  }
8234  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8235  {
8236  return false;
8237  }
8238  key.clear();
8239  }
8240  }
8241  }
8242  else
8243  {
8244  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not sax->start_object(std::size_t(-1))))
8245  {
8246  return false;
8247  }
8248 
8249  while (current != '}')
8250  {
8251  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not get_ubjson_string(key, false) or not sax->key(key)))
8252  {
8253  return false;
8254  }
8255  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not parse_ubjson_internal()))
8256  {
8257  return false;
8258  }
8259  get_ignore_noop();
8260  key.clear();
8261  }
8262  }
8263 
8264  return sax->end_object();
8265  }
8266 
8267  ///////////////////////
8268  // Utility functions //
8269  ///////////////////////
8270 
8271  /*!
8272  @brief get next character from the input
8273 
8274  This function provides the interface to the used input adapter. It does
8275  not throw in case the input reached EOF, but returns a -'ve valued
8276  `std::char_traits<char>::eof()` in that case.
8277 
8278  @return character read from the input
8279  */
8280  int get()
8281  {
8282  ++chars_read;
8283  return (current = ia->get_character());
8284  }
8285 
8286  /*!
8287  @return character read from the input after ignoring all 'N' entries
8288  */
8289  int get_ignore_noop()
8290  {
8291  do
8292  {
8293  get();
8294  }
8295  while (current == 'N');
8296 
8297  return current;
8298  }
8299 
8300  /*
8301  @brief read a number from the input
8302 
8303  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
8304  @param[in] format the current format (for diagnostics)
8305  @param[out] result number of type @a NumberType
8306 
8307  @return whether conversion completed
8308 
8309  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
8310  bytes in CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON are stored in network order
8311  (big endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
8312  */
8313  template<typename NumberType, bool InputIsLittleEndian = false>
8314  bool get_number(const input_format_t format, NumberType& result)
8315  {
8316  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
8317  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
8318  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(NumberType); ++i)
8319  {
8320  get();
8321  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(format, "number")))
8322  {
8323  return false;
8324  }
8325 
8326  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
8327  if (is_little_endian && !InputIsLittleEndian)
8328  {
8329  vec[sizeof(NumberType) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
8330  }
8331  else
8332  {
8333  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8334  }
8335  }
8336 
8337  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
8338  std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
8339  return true;
8340  }
8341 
8342  /*!
8343  @brief create a string by reading characters from the input
8344 
8345  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
8346  @param[in] format the current format (for diagnostics)
8347  @param[in] len number of characters to read
8348  @param[out] result string created by reading @a len bytes
8349 
8350  @return whether string creation completed
8351 
8352  @note We can not reserve @a len bytes for the result, because @a len
8353  may be too large. Usually, @ref unexpect_eof() detects the end of
8354  the input before we run out of string memory.
8355  */
8356  template<typename NumberType>
8357  bool get_string(const input_format_t format,
8358  const NumberType len,
8359  string_t& result)
8360  {
8361  bool success = true;
8362  std::generate_n(std::back_inserter(result), len, [this, &success, &format]()
8363  {
8364  get();
8365  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not unexpect_eof(format, "string")))
8366  {
8367  success = false;
8368  }
8369  return static_cast<char>(current);
8370  });
8371  return success;
8372  }
8373 
8374  /*!
8375  @param[in] format the current format (for diagnostics)
8376  @param[in] context further context information (for diagnostics)
8377  @return whether the last read character is not EOF
8378  */
8379  bool unexpect_eof(const input_format_t format, const char* context) const
8380  {
8381  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
8382  {
8383  return sax->parse_error(chars_read, "<end of file>",
8384  parse_error::create(110, chars_read, exception_message(format, "unexpected end of input", context)));
8385  }
8386  return true;
8387  }
8388 
8389  /*!
8390  @return a string representation of the last read byte
8391  */
8392  std::string get_token_string() const
8393  {
8394  char cr[3];
8395  (std::snprintf)(cr, 3, "%.2hhX", static_cast<unsigned char>(current));
8396  return std::string{cr};
8397  }
8398 
8399  /*!
8400  @param[in] format the current format
8401  @param[in] detail a detailed error message
8402  @param[in] context further contect information
8403  @return a message string to use in the parse_error exceptions
8404  */
8405  std::string exception_message(const input_format_t format,
8406  const std::string& detail,
8407  const std::string& context) const
8408  {
8409  std::string error_msg = "syntax error while parsing ";
8410 
8411  switch (format)
8412  {
8413  case input_format_t::cbor:
8414  error_msg += "CBOR";
8415  break;
8416 
8417  case input_format_t::msgpack:
8418  error_msg += "MessagePack";
8419  break;
8420 
8421  case input_format_t::ubjson:
8422  error_msg += "UBJSON";
8423  break;
8424 
8425  case input_format_t::bson:
8426  error_msg += "BSON";
8427  break;
8428 
8429  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8430  default:
8431  assert(false);
8432  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8433  }
8434 
8435  return error_msg + " " + context + ": " + detail;
8436  }
8437 
8438  private:
8439  /// input adapter
8440  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
8441 
8442  /// the current character
8443  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
8444 
8445  /// the number of characters read
8446  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
8447 
8448  /// whether we can assume little endianess
8449  const bool is_little_endian = little_endianess();
8450 
8451  /// the SAX parser
8452  json_sax_t* sax = nullptr;
8453 };
8454 } // namespace detail
8455 } // namespace nlohmann
8456 
8457 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/binary_writer.hpp>
8458 
8459 
8460 #include <algorithm> // reverse
8461 #include <array> // array
8462 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t
8463 #include <cstring> // memcpy
8464 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
8465 
8466 // #include <nlohmann/detail/input/binary_reader.hpp>
8467 
8468 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/output_adapters.hpp>
8469 
8470 
8471 namespace nlohmann
8472 {
8473 namespace detail
8474 {
8475 ///////////////////
8476 // binary writer //
8477 ///////////////////
8478 
8479 /*!
8480 @brief serialization to CBOR and MessagePack values
8481 */
8482 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
8483 class binary_writer
8484 {
8485  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
8486 
8487  public:
8488  /*!
8489  @brief create a binary writer
8490 
8491  @param[in] adapter output adapter to write to
8492  */
8493  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<CharType> adapter) : oa(adapter)
8494  {
8495  assert(oa);
8496  }
8497 
8498  /*!
8499  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
8500  @pre j.type() == value_t::object
8501  */
8502  void write_bson(const BasicJsonType& j)
8503  {
8504  switch (j.type())
8505  {
8506  case value_t::object:
8507  {
8508  write_bson_object(*j.m_value.object);
8509  break;
8510  }
8511 
8512  default:
8513  {
8514  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(317, "to serialize to BSON, top-level type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
8515  }
8516  }
8517  }
8518 
8519  /*!
8520  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
8521  */
8522  void write_cbor(const BasicJsonType& j)
8523  {
8524  switch (j.type())
8525  {
8526  case value_t::null:
8527  {
8528  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xF6));
8529  break;
8530  }
8531 
8532  case value_t::boolean:
8533  {
8534  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
8535  ? to_char_type(0xF5)
8536  : to_char_type(0xF4));
8537  break;
8538  }
8539 
8540  case value_t::number_integer:
8541  {
8542  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
8543  {
8544  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
8545  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
8546  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
8547  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
8548  {
8549  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8550  }
8551  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8552  {
8553  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x18));
8554  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8555  }
8556  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8557  {
8558  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x19));
8559  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8560  }
8561  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8562  {
8563  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1A));
8564  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8565  }
8566  else
8567  {
8568  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1B));
8569  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8570  }
8571  }
8572  else
8573  {
8574  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
8575  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
8576  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
8577  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
8578  {
8579  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
8580  }
8581  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8582  {
8583  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x38));
8584  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
8585  }
8586  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8587  {
8588  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x39));
8589  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
8590  }
8591  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8592  {
8593  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x3A));
8594  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
8595  }
8596  else
8597  {
8598  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x3B));
8599  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
8600  }
8601  }
8602  break;
8603  }
8604 
8605  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8606  {
8607  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
8608  {
8609  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8610  }
8611  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8612  {
8613  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x18));
8614  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8615  }
8616  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8617  {
8618  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x19));
8619  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8620  }
8621  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8622  {
8623  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1A));
8624  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8625  }
8626  else
8627  {
8628  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x1B));
8629  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
8630  }
8631  break;
8632  }
8633 
8634  case value_t::number_float:
8635  {
8636  oa->write_character(get_cbor_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float));
8637  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
8638  break;
8639  }
8640 
8641  case value_t::string:
8642  {
8643  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
8644  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
8645  if (N <= 0x17)
8646  {
8647  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
8648  }
8649  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8650  {
8651  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x78));
8652  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8653  }
8654  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8655  {
8656  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x79));
8657  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8658  }
8659  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8660  {
8661  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x7A));
8662  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8663  }
8664  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8665  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8666  {
8667  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x7B));
8668  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8669  }
8670  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8671 
8672  // step 2: write the string
8673  oa->write_characters(
8674  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
8675  j.m_value.string->size());
8676  break;
8677  }
8678 
8679  case value_t::array:
8680  {
8681  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
8682  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
8683  if (N <= 0x17)
8684  {
8685  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
8686  }
8687  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8688  {
8689  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x98));
8690  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8691  }
8692  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8693  {
8694  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x99));
8695  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8696  }
8697  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8698  {
8699  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x9A));
8700  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8701  }
8702  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8703  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8704  {
8705  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x9B));
8706  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8707  }
8708  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8709 
8710  // step 2: write each element
8711  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
8712  {
8713  write_cbor(el);
8714  }
8715  break;
8716  }
8717 
8718  case value_t::object:
8719  {
8720  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
8721  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
8722  if (N <= 0x17)
8723  {
8724  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xA0 + N));
8725  }
8726  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8727  {
8728  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xB8));
8729  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8730  }
8731  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8732  {
8733  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xB9));
8734  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8735  }
8736  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8737  {
8738  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xBA));
8739  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8740  }
8741  // LCOV_EXCL_START
8742  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8743  {
8744  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xBB));
8745  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
8746  }
8747  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
8748 
8749  // step 2: write each element
8750  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
8751  {
8752  write_cbor(el.first);
8753  write_cbor(el.second);
8754  }
8755  break;
8756  }
8757 
8758  default:
8759  break;
8760  }
8761  }
8762 
8763  /*!
8764  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
8765  */
8766  void write_msgpack(const BasicJsonType& j)
8767  {
8768  switch (j.type())
8769  {
8770  case value_t::null: // nil
8771  {
8772  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xC0));
8773  break;
8774  }
8775 
8776  case value_t::boolean: // true and false
8777  {
8778  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
8779  ? to_char_type(0xC3)
8780  : to_char_type(0xC2));
8781  break;
8782  }
8783 
8784  case value_t::number_integer:
8785  {
8786  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
8787  {
8788  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
8789  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used
8790  // the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
8791  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
8792  {
8793  // positive fixnum
8794  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8795  }
8796  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8797  {
8798  // uint 8
8799  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCC));
8800  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8801  }
8802  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8803  {
8804  // uint 16
8805  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCD));
8806  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8807  }
8808  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8809  {
8810  // uint 32
8811  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCE));
8812  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8813  }
8814  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8815  {
8816  // uint 64
8817  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCF));
8818  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8819  }
8820  }
8821  else
8822  {
8823  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
8824  {
8825  // negative fixnum
8826  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8827  }
8828  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and
8829  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
8830  {
8831  // int 8
8832  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD0));
8833  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8834  }
8835  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and
8836  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
8837  {
8838  // int 16
8839  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD1));
8840  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8841  }
8842  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and
8843  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
8844  {
8845  // int 32
8846  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD2));
8847  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8848  }
8849  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and
8850  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
8851  {
8852  // int 64
8853  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD3));
8854  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8855  }
8856  }
8857  break;
8858  }
8859 
8860  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8861  {
8862  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
8863  {
8864  // positive fixnum
8865  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8866  }
8867  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8868  {
8869  // uint 8
8870  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCC));
8871  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8872  }
8873  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8874  {
8875  // uint 16
8876  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCD));
8877  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8878  }
8879  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8880  {
8881  // uint 32
8882  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCE));
8883  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8884  }
8885  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
8886  {
8887  // uint 64
8888  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xCF));
8889  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
8890  }
8891  break;
8892  }
8893 
8894  case value_t::number_float:
8895  {
8896  oa->write_character(get_msgpack_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float));
8897  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
8898  break;
8899  }
8900 
8901  case value_t::string:
8902  {
8903  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
8904  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
8905  if (N <= 31)
8906  {
8907  // fixstr
8908  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xA0 | N));
8909  }
8910  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
8911  {
8912  // str 8
8913  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xD9));
8914  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
8915  }
8916  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8917  {
8918  // str 16
8919  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDA));
8920  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8921  }
8922  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8923  {
8924  // str 32
8925  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDB));
8926  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8927  }
8928 
8929  // step 2: write the string
8930  oa->write_characters(
8931  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
8932  j.m_value.string->size());
8933  break;
8934  }
8935 
8936  case value_t::array:
8937  {
8938  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
8939  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
8940  if (N <= 15)
8941  {
8942  // fixarray
8943  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
8944  }
8945  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8946  {
8947  // array 16
8948  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDC));
8949  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8950  }
8951  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8952  {
8953  // array 32
8954  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDD));
8955  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8956  }
8957 
8958  // step 2: write each element
8959  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
8960  {
8961  write_msgpack(el);
8962  }
8963  break;
8964  }
8965 
8966  case value_t::object:
8967  {
8968  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
8969  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
8970  if (N <= 15)
8971  {
8972  // fixmap
8973  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xF)));
8974  }
8975  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
8976  {
8977  // map 16
8978  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDE));
8979  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
8980  }
8981  else if (N <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
8982  {
8983  // map 32
8984  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0xDF));
8985  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
8986  }
8987 
8988  // step 2: write each element
8989  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
8990  {
8991  write_msgpack(el.first);
8992  write_msgpack(el.second);
8993  }
8994  break;
8995  }
8996 
8997  default:
8998  break;
8999  }
9000  }
9001 
9002  /*!
9003  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
9004  @param[in] use_count whether to use '#' prefixes (optimized format)
9005  @param[in] use_type whether to use '$' prefixes (optimized format)
9006  @param[in] add_prefix whether prefixes need to be used for this value
9007  */
9008  void write_ubjson(const BasicJsonType& j, const bool use_count,
9009  const bool use_type, const bool add_prefix = true)
9010  {
9011  switch (j.type())
9012  {
9013  case value_t::null:
9014  {
9015  if (add_prefix)
9016  {
9017  oa->write_character(to_char_type('Z'));
9018  }
9019  break;
9020  }
9021 
9022  case value_t::boolean:
9023  {
9024  if (add_prefix)
9025  {
9026  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
9027  ? to_char_type('T')
9028  : to_char_type('F'));
9029  }
9030  break;
9031  }
9032 
9033  case value_t::number_integer:
9034  {
9035  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_integer, add_prefix);
9036  break;
9037  }
9038 
9039  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9040  {
9041  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_unsigned, add_prefix);
9042  break;
9043  }
9044 
9045  case value_t::number_float:
9046  {
9047  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.number_float, add_prefix);
9048  break;
9049  }
9050 
9051  case value_t::string:
9052  {
9053  if (add_prefix)
9054  {
9055  oa->write_character(to_char_type('S'));
9056  }
9057  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.string->size(), true);
9058  oa->write_characters(
9059  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
9060  j.m_value.string->size());
9061  break;
9062  }
9063 
9064  case value_t::array:
9065  {
9066  if (add_prefix)
9067  {
9068  oa->write_character(to_char_type('['));
9069  }
9070 
9071  bool prefix_required = true;
9072  if (use_type and not j.m_value.array->empty())
9073  {
9074  assert(use_count);
9075  const CharType first_prefix = ubjson_prefix(j.front());
9076  const bool same_prefix = std::all_of(j.begin() + 1, j.end(),
9077  [this, first_prefix](const BasicJsonType & v)
9078  {
9079  return ubjson_prefix(v) == first_prefix;
9080  });
9081 
9082  if (same_prefix)
9083  {
9084  prefix_required = false;
9085  oa->write_character(to_char_type('$'));
9086  oa->write_character(first_prefix);
9087  }
9088  }
9089 
9090  if (use_count)
9091  {
9092  oa->write_character(to_char_type('#'));
9093  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.array->size(), true);
9094  }
9095 
9096  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
9097  {
9098  write_ubjson(el, use_count, use_type, prefix_required);
9099  }
9100 
9101  if (not use_count)
9102  {
9103  oa->write_character(to_char_type(']'));
9104  }
9105 
9106  break;
9107  }
9108 
9109  case value_t::object:
9110  {
9111  if (add_prefix)
9112  {
9113  oa->write_character(to_char_type('{'));
9114  }
9115 
9116  bool prefix_required = true;
9117  if (use_type and not j.m_value.object->empty())
9118  {
9119  assert(use_count);
9120  const CharType first_prefix = ubjson_prefix(j.front());
9121  const bool same_prefix = std::all_of(j.begin(), j.end(),
9122  [this, first_prefix](const BasicJsonType & v)
9123  {
9124  return ubjson_prefix(v) == first_prefix;
9125  });
9126 
9127  if (same_prefix)
9128  {
9129  prefix_required = false;
9130  oa->write_character(to_char_type('$'));
9131  oa->write_character(first_prefix);
9132  }
9133  }
9134 
9135  if (use_count)
9136  {
9137  oa->write_character(to_char_type('#'));
9138  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(j.m_value.object->size(), true);
9139  }
9140 
9141  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
9142  {
9143  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(el.first.size(), true);
9144  oa->write_characters(
9145  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(el.first.c_str()),
9146  el.first.size());
9147  write_ubjson(el.second, use_count, use_type, prefix_required);
9148  }
9149 
9150  if (not use_count)
9151  {
9152  oa->write_character(to_char_type('}'));
9153  }
9154 
9155  break;
9156  }
9157 
9158  default:
9159  break;
9160  }
9161  }
9162 
9163  private:
9164  //////////
9165  // BSON //
9166  //////////
9167 
9168  /*!
9169  @return The size of a BSON document entry header, including the id marker
9170  and the entry name size (and its null-terminator).
9171  */
9172  static std::size_t calc_bson_entry_header_size(const string_t& name)
9173  {
9174  const auto it = name.find(static_cast<typename string_t::value_type>(0));
9175  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it != BasicJsonType::string_t::npos))
9176  {
9177  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(409,
9178  "BSON key cannot contain code point U+0000 (at byte " + std::to_string(it) + ")"));
9179  }
9180 
9181  return /*id*/ 1ul + name.size() + /*zero-terminator*/1u;
9182  }
9183 
9184  /*!
9185  @brief Writes the given @a element_type and @a name to the output adapter
9186  */
9187  void write_bson_entry_header(const string_t& name,
9188  const std::uint8_t element_type)
9189  {
9190  oa->write_character(to_char_type(element_type)); // boolean
9191  oa->write_characters(
9192  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(name.c_str()),
9193  name.size() + 1u);
9194  }
9195 
9196  /*!
9197  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and boolean value @a value
9198  */
9199  void write_bson_boolean(const string_t& name,
9200  const bool value)
9201  {
9202  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x08);
9203  oa->write_character(value ? to_char_type(0x01) : to_char_type(0x00));
9204  }
9205 
9206  /*!
9207  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and double value @a value
9208  */
9209  void write_bson_double(const string_t& name,
9210  const double value)
9211  {
9212  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x01);
9213  write_number<double, true>(value);
9214  }
9215 
9216  /*!
9217  @return The size of the BSON-encoded string in @a value
9218  */
9219  static std::size_t calc_bson_string_size(const string_t& value)
9220  {
9221  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + value.size() + 1ul;
9222  }
9223 
9224  /*!
9225  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and string value @a value
9226  */
9227  void write_bson_string(const string_t& name,
9228  const string_t& value)
9229  {
9230  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x02);
9231 
9232  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value.size() + 1ul));
9233  oa->write_characters(
9234  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(value.c_str()),
9235  value.size() + 1);
9236  }
9237 
9238  /*!
9239  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and null value
9240  */
9241  void write_bson_null(const string_t& name)
9242  {
9243  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x0A);
9244  }
9245 
9246  /*!
9247  @return The size of the BSON-encoded integer @a value
9248  */
9249  static std::size_t calc_bson_integer_size(const std::int64_t value)
9250  {
9251  if ((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::min)() <= value and value <= (std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)())
9252  {
9253  return sizeof(std::int32_t);
9254  }
9255  else
9256  {
9257  return sizeof(std::int64_t);
9258  }
9259  }
9260 
9261  /*!
9262  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and integer @a value
9263  */
9264  void write_bson_integer(const string_t& name,
9265  const std::int64_t value)
9266  {
9267  if ((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::min)() <= value and value <= (std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)())
9268  {
9269  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x10); // int32
9270  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value));
9271  }
9272  else
9273  {
9274  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x12); // int64
9275  write_number<std::int64_t, true>(static_cast<std::int64_t>(value));
9276  }
9277  }
9278 
9279  /*!
9280  @return The size of the BSON-encoded unsigned integer in @a j
9281  */
9282  static constexpr std::size_t calc_bson_unsigned_size(const std::uint64_t value) noexcept
9283  {
9284  return (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)()))
9285  ? sizeof(std::int32_t)
9286  : sizeof(std::int64_t);
9287  }
9288 
9289  /*!
9290  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and unsigned @a value
9291  */
9292  void write_bson_unsigned(const string_t& name,
9293  const std::uint64_t value)
9294  {
9295  if (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int32_t>::max)()))
9296  {
9297  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x10 /* int32 */);
9298  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(value));
9299  }
9300  else if (value <= static_cast<std::uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<std::int64_t>::max)()))
9301  {
9302  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x12 /* int64 */);
9303  write_number<std::int64_t, true>(static_cast<std::int64_t>(value));
9304  }
9305  else
9306  {
9307  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(value) + " cannot be represented by BSON as it does not fit int64"));
9308  }
9309  }
9310 
9311  /*!
9312  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and object @a value
9313  */
9314  void write_bson_object_entry(const string_t& name,
9315  const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9316  {
9317  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x03); // object
9318  write_bson_object(value);
9319  }
9320 
9321  /*!
9322  @return The size of the BSON-encoded array @a value
9323  */
9324  static std::size_t calc_bson_array_size(const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& value)
9325  {
9326  std::size_t embedded_document_size = 0ul;
9327  std::size_t array_index = 0ul;
9328 
9329  for (const auto& el : value)
9330  {
9331  embedded_document_size += calc_bson_element_size(std::to_string(array_index++), el);
9332  }
9333 
9334  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + embedded_document_size + 1ul;
9335  }
9336 
9337  /*!
9338  @brief Writes a BSON element with key @a name and array @a value
9339  */
9340  void write_bson_array(const string_t& name,
9341  const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& value)
9342  {
9343  write_bson_entry_header(name, 0x04); // array
9344  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(calc_bson_array_size(value)));
9345 
9346  std::size_t array_index = 0ul;
9347 
9348  for (const auto& el : value)
9349  {
9350  write_bson_element(std::to_string(array_index++), el);
9351  }
9352 
9353  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x00));
9354  }
9355 
9356  /*!
9357  @brief Calculates the size necessary to serialize the JSON value @a j with its @a name
9358  @return The calculated size for the BSON document entry for @a j with the given @a name.
9359  */
9360  static std::size_t calc_bson_element_size(const string_t& name,
9361  const BasicJsonType& j)
9362  {
9363  const auto header_size = calc_bson_entry_header_size(name);
9364  switch (j.type())
9365  {
9366  case value_t::object:
9367  return header_size + calc_bson_object_size(*j.m_value.object);
9368 
9369  case value_t::array:
9370  return header_size + calc_bson_array_size(*j.m_value.array);
9371 
9372  case value_t::boolean:
9373  return header_size + 1ul;
9374 
9375  case value_t::number_float:
9376  return header_size + 8ul;
9377 
9378  case value_t::number_integer:
9379  return header_size + calc_bson_integer_size(j.m_value.number_integer);
9380 
9381  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9382  return header_size + calc_bson_unsigned_size(j.m_value.number_unsigned);
9383 
9384  case value_t::string:
9385  return header_size + calc_bson_string_size(*j.m_value.string);
9386 
9387  case value_t::null:
9388  return header_size + 0ul;
9389 
9390  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9391  default:
9392  assert(false);
9393  return 0ul;
9394  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9395  }
9396  }
9397 
9398  /*!
9399  @brief Serializes the JSON value @a j to BSON and associates it with the
9400  key @a name.
9401  @param name The name to associate with the JSON entity @a j within the
9402  current BSON document
9403  @return The size of the BSON entry
9404  */
9405  void write_bson_element(const string_t& name,
9406  const BasicJsonType& j)
9407  {
9408  switch (j.type())
9409  {
9410  case value_t::object:
9411  return write_bson_object_entry(name, *j.m_value.object);
9412 
9413  case value_t::array:
9414  return write_bson_array(name, *j.m_value.array);
9415 
9416  case value_t::boolean:
9417  return write_bson_boolean(name, j.m_value.boolean);
9418 
9419  case value_t::number_float:
9420  return write_bson_double(name, j.m_value.number_float);
9421 
9422  case value_t::number_integer:
9423  return write_bson_integer(name, j.m_value.number_integer);
9424 
9425  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9426  return write_bson_unsigned(name, j.m_value.number_unsigned);
9427 
9428  case value_t::string:
9429  return write_bson_string(name, *j.m_value.string);
9430 
9431  case value_t::null:
9432  return write_bson_null(name);
9433 
9434  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9435  default:
9436  assert(false);
9437  return;
9438  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9439  }
9440  }
9441 
9442  /*!
9443  @brief Calculates the size of the BSON serialization of the given
9444  JSON-object @a j.
9445  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
9446  @pre j.type() == value_t::object
9447  */
9448  static std::size_t calc_bson_object_size(const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9449  {
9450  std::size_t document_size = std::accumulate(value.begin(), value.end(), 0ul,
9451  [](size_t result, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type & el)
9452  {
9453  return result += calc_bson_element_size(el.first, el.second);
9454  });
9455 
9456  return sizeof(std::int32_t) + document_size + 1ul;
9457  }
9458 
9459  /*!
9460  @param[in] j JSON value to serialize
9461  @pre j.type() == value_t::object
9462  */
9463  void write_bson_object(const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& value)
9464  {
9465  write_number<std::int32_t, true>(static_cast<std::int32_t>(calc_bson_object_size(value)));
9466 
9467  for (const auto& el : value)
9468  {
9469  write_bson_element(el.first, el.second);
9470  }
9471 
9472  oa->write_character(to_char_type(0x00));
9473  }
9474 
9475  //////////
9476  // CBOR //
9477  //////////
9478 
9479  static constexpr CharType get_cbor_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9480  {
9481  return to_char_type(0xFA); // Single-Precision Float
9482  }
9483 
9484  static constexpr CharType get_cbor_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9485  {
9486  return to_char_type(0xFB); // Double-Precision Float
9487  }
9488 
9489  /////////////
9490  // MsgPack //
9491  /////////////
9492 
9493  static constexpr CharType get_msgpack_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9494  {
9495  return to_char_type(0xCA); // float 32
9496  }
9497 
9498  static constexpr CharType get_msgpack_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9499  {
9500  return to_char_type(0xCB); // float 64
9501  }
9502 
9503  ////////////
9504  // UBJSON //
9505  ////////////
9506 
9507  // UBJSON: write number (floating point)
9508  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9509  std::is_floating_point<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9510  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9511  const bool add_prefix)
9512  {
9513  if (add_prefix)
9514  {
9515  oa->write_character(get_ubjson_float_prefix(n));
9516  }
9517  write_number(n);
9518  }
9519 
9520  // UBJSON: write number (unsigned integer)
9521  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9522  std::is_unsigned<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9523  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9524  const bool add_prefix)
9525  {
9526  if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)()))
9527  {
9528  if (add_prefix)
9529  {
9530  oa->write_character(to_char_type('i')); // int8
9531  }
9532  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9533  }
9534  else if (n <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9535  {
9536  if (add_prefix)
9537  {
9538  oa->write_character(to_char_type('U')); // uint8
9539  }
9540  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9541  }
9542  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)()))
9543  {
9544  if (add_prefix)
9545  {
9546  oa->write_character(to_char_type('I')); // int16
9547  }
9548  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(n));
9549  }
9550  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)()))
9551  {
9552  if (add_prefix)
9553  {
9554  oa->write_character(to_char_type('l')); // int32
9555  }
9556  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(n));
9557  }
9558  else if (n <= static_cast<uint64_t>((std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)()))
9559  {
9560  if (add_prefix)
9561  {
9562  oa->write_character(to_char_type('L')); // int64
9563  }
9564  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(n));
9565  }
9566  else
9567  {
9568  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(n) + " cannot be represented by UBJSON as it does not fit int64"));
9569  }
9570  }
9571 
9572  // UBJSON: write number (signed integer)
9573  template<typename NumberType, typename std::enable_if<
9574  std::is_signed<NumberType>::value and
9575  not std::is_floating_point<NumberType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9576  void write_number_with_ubjson_prefix(const NumberType n,
9577  const bool add_prefix)
9578  {
9579  if ((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9580  {
9581  if (add_prefix)
9582  {
9583  oa->write_character(to_char_type('i')); // int8
9584  }
9585  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(n));
9586  }
9587  else if (static_cast<int64_t>((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::min)()) <= n and n <= static_cast<int64_t>((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)()))
9588  {
9589  if (add_prefix)
9590  {
9591  oa->write_character(to_char_type('U')); // uint8
9592  }
9593  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(n));
9594  }
9595  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9596  {
9597  if (add_prefix)
9598  {
9599  oa->write_character(to_char_type('I')); // int16
9600  }
9601  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(n));
9602  }
9603  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9604  {
9605  if (add_prefix)
9606  {
9607  oa->write_character(to_char_type('l')); // int32
9608  }
9609  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(n));
9610  }
9611  else if ((std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() <= n and n <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
9612  {
9613  if (add_prefix)
9614  {
9615  oa->write_character(to_char_type('L')); // int64
9616  }
9617  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(n));
9618  }
9619  // LCOV_EXCL_START
9620  else
9621  {
9622  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(407, "integer number " + std::to_string(n) + " cannot be represented by UBJSON as it does not fit int64"));
9623  }
9624  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
9625  }
9626 
9627  /*!
9628  @brief determine the type prefix of container values
9629 
9630  @note This function does not need to be 100% accurate when it comes to
9631  integer limits. In case a number exceeds the limits of int64_t,
9632  this will be detected by a later call to function
9633  write_number_with_ubjson_prefix. Therefore, we return 'L' for any
9634  value that does not fit the previous limits.
9635  */
9636  CharType ubjson_prefix(const BasicJsonType& j) const noexcept
9637  {
9638  switch (j.type())
9639  {
9640  case value_t::null:
9641  return 'Z';
9642 
9643  case value_t::boolean:
9644  return j.m_value.boolean ? 'T' : 'F';
9645 
9646  case value_t::number_integer:
9647  {
9648  if ((std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9649  {
9650  return 'i';
9651  }
9652  if ((std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9653  {
9654  return 'U';
9655  }
9656  if ((std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9657  {
9658  return 'I';
9659  }
9660  if ((std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() <= j.m_value.number_integer and j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9661  {
9662  return 'l';
9663  }
9664  // no check and assume int64_t (see note above)
9665  return 'L';
9666  }
9667 
9668  case value_t::number_unsigned:
9669  {
9670  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
9671  {
9672  return 'i';
9673  }
9674  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
9675  {
9676  return 'U';
9677  }
9678  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
9679  {
9680  return 'I';
9681  }
9682  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
9683  {
9684  return 'l';
9685  }
9686  // no check and assume int64_t (see note above)
9687  return 'L';
9688  }
9689 
9690  case value_t::number_float:
9691  return get_ubjson_float_prefix(j.m_value.number_float);
9692 
9693  case value_t::string:
9694  return 'S';
9695 
9696  case value_t::array:
9697  return '[';
9698 
9699  case value_t::object:
9700  return '{';
9701 
9702  default: // discarded values
9703  return 'N';
9704  }
9705  }
9706 
9707  static constexpr CharType get_ubjson_float_prefix(float /*unused*/)
9708  {
9709  return 'd'; // float 32
9710  }
9711 
9712  static constexpr CharType get_ubjson_float_prefix(double /*unused*/)
9713  {
9714  return 'D'; // float 64
9715  }
9716 
9717  ///////////////////////
9718  // Utility functions //
9719  ///////////////////////
9720 
9721  /*
9722  @brief write a number to output input
9723  @param[in] n number of type @a NumberType
9724  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
9725  @tparam OutputIsLittleEndian Set to true if output data is
9726  required to be little endian
9727 
9728  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because bytes
9729  in CBOR, MessagePack, and UBJSON are stored in network order (big
9730  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
9731  */
9732  template<typename NumberType, bool OutputIsLittleEndian = false>
9733  void write_number(const NumberType n)
9734  {
9735  // step 1: write number to array of length NumberType
9736  std::array<CharType, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
9737  std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(NumberType));
9738 
9739  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
9740  if (is_little_endian and not OutputIsLittleEndian)
9741  {
9742  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
9743  std::reverse(vec.begin(), vec.end());
9744  }
9745 
9746  oa->write_characters(vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
9747  }
9748 
9749  public:
9750  // The following to_char_type functions are implement the conversion
9751  // between uint8_t and CharType. In case CharType is not unsigned,
9752  // such a conversion is required to allow values greater than 128.
9753  // See <https://github.com/nlohmann/json/issues/1286> for a discussion.
9754  template < typename C = CharType,
9755  enable_if_t < std::is_signed<C>::value and std::is_signed<char>::value > * = nullptr >
9756  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9757  {
9758  return *reinterpret_cast<char*>(&x);
9759  }
9760 
9761  template < typename C = CharType,
9762  enable_if_t < std::is_signed<C>::value and std::is_unsigned<char>::value > * = nullptr >
9763  static CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9764  {
9765  static_assert(sizeof(std::uint8_t) == sizeof(CharType), "size of CharType must be equal to std::uint8_t");
9766  static_assert(std::is_pod<CharType>::value, "CharType must be POD");
9767  CharType result;
9768  std::memcpy(&result, &x, sizeof(x));
9769  return result;
9770  }
9771 
9772  template<typename C = CharType,
9773  enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<C>::value>* = nullptr>
9774  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(std::uint8_t x) noexcept
9775  {
9776  return x;
9777  }
9778 
9779  template < typename InputCharType, typename C = CharType,
9780  enable_if_t <
9781  std::is_signed<C>::value and
9782  std::is_signed<char>::value and
9783  std::is_same<char, typename std::remove_cv<InputCharType>::type>::value
9784  > * = nullptr >
9785  static constexpr CharType to_char_type(InputCharType x) noexcept
9786  {
9787  return x;
9788  }
9789 
9790  private:
9791  /// whether we can assume little endianess
9792  const bool is_little_endian = binary_reader<BasicJsonType>::little_endianess();
9793 
9794  /// the output
9795  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
9796 };
9797 } // namespace detail
9798 } // namespace nlohmann
9799 
9800 // #include <nlohmann/detail/output/serializer.hpp>
9801 
9802 
9803 #include <algorithm> // reverse, remove, fill, find, none_of
9804 #include <array> // array
9805 #include <cassert> // assert
9806 #include <ciso646> // and, or
9807 #include <clocale> // localeconv, lconv
9808 #include <cmath> // labs, isfinite, isnan, signbit
9809 #include <cstddef> // size_t, ptrdiff_t
9810 #include <cstdint> // uint8_t
9811 #include <cstdio> // snprintf
9812 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
9813 #include <string> // string
9814 #include <type_traits> // is_same
9815 
9816 // #include <nlohmann/detail/exceptions.hpp>
9817 
9818 // #include <nlohmann/detail/conversions/to_chars.hpp>
9819 
9820 
9821 #include <cassert> // assert
9822 #include <ciso646> // or, and, not
9823 #include <cmath> // signbit, isfinite
9824 #include <cstdint> // intN_t, uintN_t
9825 #include <cstring> // memcpy, memmove
9826 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
9827 #include <type_traits> // conditional
9828 
9829 namespace nlohmann
9830 {
9831 namespace detail
9832 {
9833 
9834 /*!
9835 @brief implements the Grisu2 algorithm for binary to decimal floating-point
9836 conversion.
9837 
9838 This implementation is a slightly modified version of the reference
9839 implementation which may be obtained from
9840 http://florian.loitsch.com/publications (bench.tar.gz).
9841 
9842 The code is distributed under the MIT license, Copyright (c) 2009 Florian Loitsch.
9843 
9844 For a detailed description of the algorithm see:
9845 
9846 [1] Loitsch, "Printing Floating-Point Numbers Quickly and Accurately with
9847  Integers", Proceedings of the ACM SIGPLAN 2010 Conference on Programming
9848  Language Design and Implementation, PLDI 2010
9849 [2] Burger, Dybvig, "Printing Floating-Point Numbers Quickly and Accurately",
9850  Proceedings of the ACM SIGPLAN 1996 Conference on Programming Language
9851  Design and Implementation, PLDI 1996
9852 */
9853 namespace dtoa_impl
9854 {
9855 
9856 template <typename Target, typename Source>
9857 Target reinterpret_bits(const Source source)
9858 {
9859  static_assert(sizeof(Target) == sizeof(Source), "size mismatch");
9860 
9861  Target target;
9862  std::memcpy(&target, &source, sizeof(Source));
9863  return target;
9864 }
9865 
9866 struct diyfp // f * 2^e
9867 {
9868  static constexpr int kPrecision = 64; // = q
9869 
9870  uint64_t f = 0;
9871  int e = 0;
9872 
9873  constexpr diyfp(uint64_t f_, int e_) noexcept : f(f_), e(e_) {}
9874 
9875  /*!
9876  @brief returns x - y
9877  @pre x.e == y.e and x.f >= y.f
9878  */
9879  static diyfp sub(const diyfp& x, const diyfp& y) noexcept
9880  {
9881  assert(x.e == y.e);
9882  assert(x.f >= y.f);
9883 
9884  return {x.f - y.f, x.e};
9885  }
9886 
9887  /*!
9888  @brief returns x * y
9889  @note The result is rounded. (Only the upper q bits are returned.)
9890  */
9891  static diyfp mul(const diyfp& x, const diyfp& y) noexcept
9892  {
9893  static_assert(kPrecision == 64, "internal error");
9894 
9895  // Computes:
9896  // f = round((x.f * y.f) / 2^q)
9897  // e = x.e + y.e + q
9898 
9899  // Emulate the 64-bit * 64-bit multiplication:
9900  //
9901  // p = u * v
9902  // = (u_lo + 2^32 u_hi) (v_lo + 2^32 v_hi)
9903  // = (u_lo v_lo ) + 2^32 ((u_lo v_hi ) + (u_hi v_lo )) + 2^64 (u_hi v_hi )
9904  // = (p0 ) + 2^32 ((p1 ) + (p2 )) + 2^64 (p3 )
9905  // = (p0_lo + 2^32 p0_hi) + 2^32 ((p1_lo + 2^32 p1_hi) + (p2_lo + 2^32 p2_hi)) + 2^64 (p3 )
9906  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (p0_hi + p1_lo + p2_lo ) + 2^64 (p1_hi + p2_hi + p3)
9907  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (Q ) + 2^64 (H )
9908  // = (p0_lo ) + 2^32 (Q_lo + 2^32 Q_hi ) + 2^64 (H )
9909  //
9910  // (Since Q might be larger than 2^32 - 1)
9911  //
9912  // = (p0_lo + 2^32 Q_lo) + 2^64 (Q_hi + H)
9913  //
9914  // (Q_hi + H does not overflow a 64-bit int)
9915  //
9916  // = p_lo + 2^64 p_hi
9917 
9918  const uint64_t u_lo = x.f & 0xFFFFFFFF;
9919  const uint64_t u_hi = x.f >> 32;
9920  const uint64_t v_lo = y.f & 0xFFFFFFFF;
9921  const uint64_t v_hi = y.f >> 32;
9922 
9923  const uint64_t p0 = u_lo * v_lo;
9924  const uint64_t p1 = u_lo * v_hi;
9925  const uint64_t p2 = u_hi * v_lo;
9926  const uint64_t p3 = u_hi * v_hi;
9927 
9928  const uint64_t p0_hi = p0 >> 32;
9929  const uint64_t p1_lo = p1 & 0xFFFFFFFF;
9930  const uint64_t p1_hi = p1 >> 32;
9931  const uint64_t p2_lo = p2 & 0xFFFFFFFF;
9932  const uint64_t p2_hi = p2 >> 32;
9933 
9934  uint64_t Q = p0_hi + p1_lo + p2_lo;
9935 
9936  // The full product might now be computed as
9937  //
9938  // p_hi = p3 + p2_hi + p1_hi + (Q >> 32)
9939  // p_lo = p0_lo + (Q << 32)
9940  //
9941  // But in this particular case here, the full p_lo is not required.
9942  // Effectively we only need to add the highest bit in p_lo to p_hi (and
9943  // Q_hi + 1 does not overflow).
9944 
9945  Q += uint64_t{1} << (64 - 32 - 1); // round, ties up
9946 
9947  const uint64_t h = p3 + p2_hi + p1_hi + (Q >> 32);
9948 
9949  return {h, x.e + y.e + 64};
9950  }
9951 
9952  /*!
9953  @brief normalize x such that the significand is >= 2^(q-1)
9954  @pre x.f != 0
9955  */
9956  static diyfp normalize(diyfp x) noexcept
9957  {
9958  assert(x.f != 0);
9959 
9960  while ((x.f >> 63) == 0)
9961  {
9962  x.f <<= 1;
9963  x.e--;
9964  }
9965 
9966  return x;
9967  }
9968 
9969  /*!
9970  @brief normalize x such that the result has the exponent E
9971  @pre e >= x.e and the upper e - x.e bits of x.f must be zero.
9972  */
9973  static diyfp normalize_to(const diyfp& x, const int target_exponent) noexcept
9974  {
9975  const int delta = x.e - target_exponent;
9976 
9977  assert(delta >= 0);
9978  assert(((x.f << delta) >> delta) == x.f);
9979 
9980  return {x.f << delta, target_exponent};
9981  }
9982 };
9983 
9984 struct boundaries
9985 {
9986  diyfp w;
9987  diyfp minus;
9988  diyfp plus;
9989 };
9990 
9991 /*!
9992 Compute the (normalized) diyfp representing the input number 'value' and its
9993 boundaries.
9994 
9995 @pre value must be finite and positive
9996 */
9997 template <typename FloatType>
9998 boundaries compute_boundaries(FloatType value)
9999 {
10000  assert(std::isfinite(value));
10001  assert(value > 0);
10002 
10003  // Convert the IEEE representation into a diyfp.
10004  //
10005  // If v is denormal:
10006  // value = 0.F * 2^(1 - bias) = ( F) * 2^(1 - bias - (p-1))
10007  // If v is normalized:
10008  // value = 1.F * 2^(E - bias) = (2^(p-1) + F) * 2^(E - bias - (p-1))
10009 
10010  static_assert(std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::is_iec559,
10011  "internal error: dtoa_short requires an IEEE-754 floating-point implementation");
10012 
10013  constexpr int kPrecision = std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::digits; // = p (includes the hidden bit)
10014  constexpr int kBias = std::numeric_limits<FloatType>::max_exponent - 1 + (kPrecision - 1);
10015  constexpr int kMinExp = 1 - kBias;
10016  constexpr uint64_t kHiddenBit = uint64_t{1} << (kPrecision - 1); // = 2^(p-1)
10017 
10018  using bits_type = typename std::conditional< kPrecision == 24, uint32_t, uint64_t >::type;
10019 
10020  const uint64_t bits = reinterpret_bits<bits_type>(value);
10021  const uint64_t E = bits >> (kPrecision - 1);
10022  const uint64_t F = bits & (kHiddenBit - 1);
10023 
10024  const bool is_denormal = (E == 0);
10025  const diyfp v = is_denormal
10026  ? diyfp(F, kMinExp)
10027  : diyfp(F + kHiddenBit, static_cast<int>(E) - kBias);
10028 
10029  // Compute the boundaries m- and m+ of the floating-point value
10030  // v = f * 2^e.
10031  //
10032  // Determine v- and v+, the floating-point predecessor and successor if v,
10033  // respectively.
10034  //
10035  // v- = v - 2^e if f != 2^(p-1) or e == e_min (A)
10036  // = v - 2^(e-1) if f == 2^(p-1) and e > e_min (B)
10037  //
10038  // v+ = v + 2^e
10039  //
10040  // Let m- = (v- + v) / 2 and m+ = (v + v+) / 2. All real numbers _strictly_
10041  // between m- and m+ round to v, regardless of how the input rounding
10042  // algorithm breaks ties.
10043  //
10044  // ---+-------------+-------------+-------------+-------------+--- (A)
10045  // v- m- v m+ v+
10046  //
10047  // -----------------+------+------+-------------+-------------+--- (B)
10048  // v- m- v m+ v+
10049 
10050  const bool lower_boundary_is_closer = (F == 0 and E > 1);
10051  const diyfp m_plus = diyfp(2 * v.f + 1, v.e - 1);
10052  const diyfp m_minus = lower_boundary_is_closer
10053  ? diyfp(4 * v.f - 1, v.e - 2) // (B)
10054  : diyfp(2 * v.f - 1, v.e - 1); // (A)
10055 
10056  // Determine the normalized w+ = m+.
10057  const diyfp w_plus = diyfp::normalize(m_plus);
10058 
10059  // Determine w- = m- such that e_(w-) = e_(w+).
10060  const diyfp w_minus = diyfp::normalize_to(m_minus, w_plus.e);
10061 
10062  return {diyfp::normalize(v), w_minus, w_plus};
10063 }
10064 
10065 // Given normalized diyfp w, Grisu needs to find a (normalized) cached
10066 // power-of-ten c, such that the exponent of the product c * w = f * 2^e lies
10067 // within a certain range [alpha, gamma] (Definition 3.2 from [1])
10068 //
10069 // alpha <= e = e_c + e_w + q <= gamma
10070 //
10071 // or
10072 //
10073 // f_c * f_w * 2^alpha <= f_c 2^(e_c) * f_w 2^(e_w) * 2^q
10074 // <= f_c * f_w * 2^gamma
10075 //
10076 // Since c and w are normalized, i.e. 2^(q-1) <= f < 2^q, this implies
10077 //
10078 // 2^(q-1) * 2^(q-1) * 2^alpha <= c * w * 2^q < 2^q * 2^q * 2^gamma
10079 //
10080 // or
10081 //
10082 // 2^(q - 2 + alpha) <= c * w < 2^(q + gamma)
10083 //
10084 // The choice of (alpha,gamma) determines the size of the table and the form of
10085 // the digit generation procedure. Using (alpha,gamma)=(-60,-32) works out well
10086 // in practice:
10087 //
10088 // The idea is to cut the number c * w = f * 2^e into two parts, which can be
10089 // processed independently: An integral part p1, and a fractional part p2:
10090 //
10091 // f * 2^e = ( (f div 2^-e) * 2^-e + (f mod 2^-e) ) * 2^e
10092 // = (f div 2^-e) + (f mod 2^-e) * 2^e
10093 // = p1 + p2 * 2^e
10094 //
10095 // The conversion of p1 into decimal form requires a series of divisions and
10096 // modulos by (a power of) 10. These operations are faster for 32-bit than for
10097 // 64-bit integers, so p1 should ideally fit into a 32-bit integer. This can be
10098 // achieved by choosing
10099 //
10100 // -e >= 32 or e <= -32 := gamma
10101 //
10102 // In order to convert the fractional part
10103 //
10104 // p2 * 2^e = p2 / 2^-e = d[-1] / 10^1 + d[-2] / 10^2 + ...
10105 //
10106 // into decimal form, the fraction is repeatedly multiplied by 10 and the digits
10107 // d[-i] are extracted in order:
10108 //
10109 // (10 * p2) div 2^-e = d[-1]
10110 // (10 * p2) mod 2^-e = d[-2] / 10^1 + ...
10111 //
10112 // The multiplication by 10 must not overflow. It is sufficient to choose
10113 //
10114 // 10 * p2 < 16 * p2 = 2^4 * p2 <= 2^64.
10115 //
10116 // Since p2 = f mod 2^-e < 2^-e,
10117 //
10118 // -e <= 60 or e >= -60 := alpha
10119 
10120 constexpr int kAlpha = -60;
10121 constexpr int kGamma = -32;
10122 
10123 struct cached_power // c = f * 2^e ~= 10^k
10124 {
10125  uint64_t f;
10126  int e;
10127  int k;
10128 };
10129 
10130 /*!
10131 For a normalized diyfp w = f * 2^e, this function returns a (normalized) cached
10132 power-of-ten c = f_c * 2^e_c, such that the exponent of the product w * c
10133 satisfies (Definition 3.2 from [1])
10134 
10135  alpha <= e_c + e + q <= gamma.
10136 */
10137 inline cached_power get_cached_power_for_binary_exponent(int e)
10138 {
10139  // Now
10140  //
10141  // alpha <= e_c + e + q <= gamma (1)
10142  // ==> f_c * 2^alpha <= c * 2^e * 2^q
10143  //
10144  // and since the c's are normalized, 2^(q-1) <= f_c,
10145  //
10146  // ==> 2^(q - 1 + alpha) <= c * 2^(e + q)
10147  // ==> 2^(alpha - e - 1) <= c
10148  //
10149  // If c were an exakt power of ten, i.e. c = 10^k, one may determine k as
10150  //
10151  // k = ceil( log_10( 2^(alpha - e - 1) ) )
10152  // = ceil( (alpha - e - 1) * log_10(2) )
10153  //
10154  // From the paper:
10155  // "In theory the result of the procedure could be wrong since c is rounded,
10156  // and the computation itself is approximated [...]. In practice, however,
10157  // this simple function is sufficient."
10158  //
10159  // For IEEE double precision floating-point numbers converted into
10160  // normalized diyfp's w = f * 2^e, with q = 64,
10161  //
10162  // e >= -1022 (min IEEE exponent)
10163  // -52 (p - 1)
10164  // -52 (p - 1, possibly normalize denormal IEEE numbers)
10165  // -11 (normalize the diyfp)
10166  // = -1137
10167  //
10168  // and
10169  //
10170  // e <= +1023 (max IEEE exponent)
10171  // -52 (p - 1)
10172  // -11 (normalize the diyfp)
10173  // = 960
10174  //
10175  // This binary exponent range [-1137,960] results in a decimal exponent
10176  // range [-307,324]. One does not need to store a cached power for each
10177  // k in this range. For each such k it suffices to find a cached power
10178  // such that the exponent of the product lies in [alpha,gamma].
10179  // This implies that the difference of the decimal exponents of adjacent
10180  // table entries must be less than or equal to
10181  //
10182  // floor( (gamma - alpha) * log_10(2) ) = 8.
10183  //
10184  // (A smaller distance gamma-alpha would require a larger table.)
10185 
10186  // NB:
10187  // Actually this function returns c, such that -60 <= e_c + e + 64 <= -34.
10188 
10189  constexpr int kCachedPowersSize = 79;
10190  constexpr int kCachedPowersMinDecExp = -300;
10191  constexpr int kCachedPowersDecStep = 8;
10192 
10193  static constexpr cached_power kCachedPowers[] =
10194  {
10195  { 0xAB70FE17C79AC6CA, -1060, -300 },
10196  { 0xFF77B1FCBEBCDC4F, -1034, -292 },
10197  { 0xBE5691EF416BD60C, -1007, -284 },
10198  { 0x8DD01FAD907FFC3C, -980, -276 },
10199  { 0xD3515C2831559A83, -954, -268 },
10200  { 0x9D71AC8FADA6C9B5, -927, -260 },
10201  { 0xEA9C227723EE8BCB, -901, -252 },
10202  { 0xAECC49914078536D, -874, -244 },
10203  { 0x823C12795DB6CE57, -847, -236 },
10204  { 0xC21094364DFB5637, -821, -228 },
10205  { 0x9096EA6F3848984F, -794, -220 },
10206  { 0xD77485CB25823AC7, -768, -212 },
10207  { 0xA086CFCD97BF97F4, -741, -204 },
10208  { 0xEF340A98172AACE5, -715, -196 },
10209  { 0xB23867FB2A35B28E, -688, -188 },
10210  { 0x84C8D4DFD2C63F3B, -661, -180 },
10211  { 0xC5DD44271AD3CDBA, -635, -172 },
10212  { 0x936B9FCEBB25C996, -608, -164 },
10213  { 0xDBAC6C247D62A584, -582, -156 },
10214  { 0xA3AB66580D5FDAF6, -555, -148 },
10215  { 0xF3E2F893DEC3F126, -529, -140 },
10216  { 0xB5B5ADA8AAFF80B8, -502, -132 },
10217  { 0x87625F056C7C4A8B, -475, -124 },
10218  { 0xC9BCFF6034C13053, -449, -116 },
10219  { 0x964E858C91BA2655, -422, -108 },
10220  { 0xDFF9772470297EBD, -396, -100 },
10221  { 0xA6DFBD9FB8E5B88F, -369, -92 },
10222  { 0xF8A95FCF88747D94, -343, -84 },
10223  { 0xB94470938FA89BCF, -316, -76 },
10224  { 0x8A08F0F8BF0F156B, -289, -68 },
10225  { 0xCDB02555653131B6, -263, -60 },
10226  { 0x993FE2C6D07B7FAC, -236, -52 },
10227  { 0xE45C10C42A2B3B06, -210, -44 },
10228  { 0xAA242499697392D3, -183, -36 },
10229  { 0xFD87B5F28300CA0E, -157, -28 },
10230  { 0xBCE5086492111AEB, -130, -20 },
10231  { 0x8CBCCC096F5088CC, -103, -12 },
10232  { 0xD1B71758E219652C, -77, -4 },
10233  { 0x9C40000000000000, -50, 4 },
10234  { 0xE8D4A51000000000, -24, 12 },
10235  { 0xAD78EBC5AC620000, 3, 20 },
10236  { 0x813F3978F8940984, 30, 28 },
10237  { 0xC097CE7BC90715B3, 56, 36 },
10238  { 0x8F7E32CE7BEA5C70, 83, 44 },
10239  { 0xD5D238A4ABE98068, 109, 52 },
10240  { 0x9F4F2726179A2245, 136, 60 },
10241  { 0xED63A231D4C4FB27, 162, 68 },
10242  { 0xB0DE65388CC8ADA8, 189, 76 },
10243  { 0x83C7088E1AAB65DB, 216, 84 },
10244  { 0xC45D1DF942711D9A, 242, 92 },
10245  { 0x924D692CA61BE758, 269, 100 },
10246  { 0xDA01EE641A708DEA, 295, 108 },
10247  { 0xA26DA3999AEF774A, 322, 116 },
10248  { 0xF209787BB47D6B85, 348, 124 },
10249  { 0xB454E4A179DD1877, 375, 132 },
10250  { 0x865B86925B9BC5C2, 402, 140 },
10251  { 0xC83553C5C8965D3D, 428, 148 },
10252  { 0x952AB45CFA97A0B3, 455, 156 },
10253  { 0xDE469FBD99A05FE3, 481, 164 },
10254  { 0xA59BC234DB398C25, 508, 172 },
10255  { 0xF6C69A72A3989F5C, 534, 180 },
10256  { 0xB7DCBF5354E9BECE, 561, 188 },
10257  { 0x88FCF317F22241E2, 588, 196 },
10258  { 0xCC20CE9BD35C78A5, 614, 204 },
10259  { 0x98165AF37B2153DF, 641, 212 },
10260  { 0xE2A0B5DC971F303A, 667, 220 },
10261  { 0xA8D9D1535CE3B396, 694, 228 },
10262  { 0xFB9B7CD9A4A7443C, 720, 236 },
10263  { 0xBB764C4CA7A44410, 747, 244 },
10264  { 0x8BAB8EEFB6409C1A, 774, 252 },
10265  { 0xD01FEF10A657842C, 800, 260 },
10266  { 0x9B10A4E5E9913129, 827, 268 },
10267  { 0xE7109BFBA19C0C9D, 853, 276 },
10268  { 0xAC2820D9623BF429, 880, 284 },
10269  { 0x80444B5E7AA7CF85, 907, 292 },
10270  { 0xBF21E44003ACDD2D, 933, 300 },
10271  { 0x8E679C2F5E44FF8F, 960, 308 },
10272  { 0xD433179D9C8CB841, 986, 316 },
10273  { 0x9E19DB92B4E31BA9, 1013, 324 },
10274  };
10275 
10276  // This computation gives exactly the same results for k as
10277  // k = ceil((kAlpha - e - 1) * 0.30102999566398114)
10278  // for |e| <= 1500, but doesn't require floating-point operations.
10279  // NB: log_10(2) ~= 78913 / 2^18
10280  assert(e >= -1500);
10281  assert(e <= 1500);
10282  const int f = kAlpha - e - 1;
10283  const int k = (f * 78913) / (1 << 18) + static_cast<int>(f > 0);
10284 
10285  const int index = (-kCachedPowersMinDecExp + k + (kCachedPowersDecStep - 1)) / kCachedPowersDecStep;
10286  assert(index >= 0);
10287  assert(index < kCachedPowersSize);
10288  static_cast<void>(kCachedPowersSize); // Fix warning.
10289 
10290  const cached_power cached = kCachedPowers[index];
10291  assert(kAlpha <= cached.e + e + 64);
10292  assert(kGamma >= cached.e + e + 64);
10293 
10294  return cached;
10295 }
10296 
10297 /*!
10298 For n != 0, returns k, such that pow10 := 10^(k-1) <= n < 10^k.
10299 For n == 0, returns 1 and sets pow10 := 1.
10300 */
10301 inline int find_largest_pow10(const uint32_t n, uint32_t& pow10)
10302 {
10303  // LCOV_EXCL_START
10304  if (n >= 1000000000)
10305  {
10306  pow10 = 1000000000;
10307  return 10;
10308  }
10309  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
10310  else if (n >= 100000000)
10311  {
10312  pow10 = 100000000;
10313  return 9;
10314  }
10315  else if (n >= 10000000)
10316  {
10317  pow10 = 10000000;
10318  return 8;
10319  }
10320  else if (n >= 1000000)
10321  {
10322  pow10 = 1000000;
10323  return 7;
10324  }
10325  else if (n >= 100000)
10326  {
10327  pow10 = 100000;
10328  return 6;
10329  }
10330  else if (n >= 10000)
10331  {
10332  pow10 = 10000;
10333  return 5;
10334  }
10335  else if (n >= 1000)
10336  {
10337  pow10 = 1000;
10338  return 4;
10339  }
10340  else if (n >= 100)
10341  {
10342  pow10 = 100;
10343  return 3;
10344  }
10345  else if (n >= 10)
10346  {
10347  pow10 = 10;
10348  return 2;
10349  }
10350  else
10351  {
10352  pow10 = 1;
10353  return 1;
10354  }
10355 }
10356 
10357 inline void grisu2_round(char* buf, int len, uint64_t dist, uint64_t delta,
10358  uint64_t rest, uint64_t ten_k)
10359 {
10360  assert(len >= 1);
10361  assert(dist <= delta);
10362  assert(rest <= delta);
10363  assert(ten_k > 0);
10364 
10365  // <--------------------------- delta ---->
10366  // <---- dist --------->
10367  // --------------[------------------+-------------------]--------------
10368  // M- w M+
10369  //
10370  // ten_k
10371  // <------>
10372  // <---- rest ---->
10373  // --------------[------------------+----+--------------]--------------
10374  // w V
10375  // = buf * 10^k
10376  //
